title: Why NYFA? Travel, Study, and Create in Cities That Inspire ‚Äî Worldwide.
description:
Study film, media, and performing arts in inspiring cities around the world. The New York Film Academy gives students the opportunity to travel, study, and create in places that offer new perspectives, rich cultural experiences, and expanded opportunities ‚Äî including New York City, Los Angeles, Paris, Beijing, and Kazakhstan.

Whether you're pursuing Filmmaking, Acting for Film, Cinematography, Musical Scoring, 3D Animation & VFX, Game Design, Broadcast Journalism, Producing, or another creative discipline, NYFA offers immersive, hands-on programs designed to help you grow as an artist and storyteller.

Across all NYFA locations, students experience:
‚Äì Hands-on training from day one
‚Äì Access to world-class equipment and professional facilities
‚Äì Guidance from industry-experienced faculty
‚Äì Diverse communities of creators from around the globe
‚Äì Environments that expose you to new cultures, creative styles, and real-world learning

From the artistic energy of New York City, to the film capital of Los Angeles, to the cultural richness of Paris, the global creative landscapes explored in Beijing, and the unique storytelling traditions found in Kazakhstan, NYFA is committed to giving students more places to learn, more ways to grow, and more opportunities to create.

üåê Learn more at: https://www.nyfa.edu

#NYFA #NewYorkFilmAcademy #FilmSchool #ActingSchool #CreativeArts #StudyAbroad #GlobalLocations #Filmmaking #ActingForFilm #AnimationSchool #VFX #FilmPrograms

title: Photo Guest Speaker Series - Robin Schwartz
description:
The New York Film Academy (NYFA) sat down with photographer Robin Schwartz as part of our Photo Guest Speaker Series.

Robin Schwartz is a photographer driven to capture the sameness of animals and humans. She is a 2016 Guggenheim Fellow in photography with photographs in the collections of the Metropolitan Museum, MoMA, the Smithsonian American Art Museum, SF MOMA, The Brooklyn Museum and the Biblioth√©que Nationale, France, National Museum of Photography, Film and Television, England; and The Museum Folkwang, Germany, among others.

Robin‚Äôs fourth monograph is Amelia and the Animals published by Aperture, sited by Time LIGHTBOX as one of the Best Fall Books of 2014. Earlier books are Amelia‚Äôs World, 2008 Aperture; LIKE US: Primate Portraits, 1993 W.W. Norton & Co.; and Dog Watching, 1995, Takarajima Books. Robin‚Äôs photographs have been published in the New York Times Magazine, Time Magazine LIGHTBOX, The New Yorker, Oprah, NPR, Fader, Slate, Stern, Telegraph UK, Guardian UK, Hyperallergic and Mus√©e Magazines, Brooklyn Museum; Biblioth√©que Nationale, Paris, France.

Schwartz has presented Master Talks at the National Geographic Magazine Seminar, LOOK3: The Festival of the Photograph, The Eddie Adams Workshop, the Aperture Foundation, FotoDC Week, FOTOfusion and The Chrysler Museum of Art, Norfolk VA, among others. She is a professor in photography at William Paterson University of New Jersey.

title: Photo Guest Speaker Series- Michael Troast
description:
The New York Film Academy (NYFA) sat down with photographer Michael Troast as part of out Photo Guest Speaker Series. 

Michael Troast is a photographer based in Brooklyn. He got his first camera at 12, built a darkroom by 13 with gear from a $150 yard sale haul, and spent his teens chasing skateboarding, graffiti, and street life through a lens. He‚Äôs been at it ever since. After helping launch Gotham and Complex magazines in the early 2000s, Michael went on to manage studios, lead creative teams, and produce hundreds of shoots ‚Äî from Fox Racing in California to eCommerce in Hoboken.

Now he runs his own space in the Lower East Side, where every shoot starts with understanding what the client actually needs. He‚Äôs hands-on with set building and design, and swears the easy part is taking the photo ‚Äî the hard part is everything before it.

Self-taught, endlessly curious, husband, dad of two, and happiest outdoors ‚Äî sailing, surfing, or cooking.

title: Photo Guest Speaker Series - Pixy Liao
description:
The New York Film Academy (NYFA) sat down with photographer Pixy Liao

Born and raised in Shanghai, Pixy Liao is a photographer currently residing in Tokyo.Her long-term photo project ‚ÄúExperimental Relationship‚Äù challenges conventional ideas of gender dynamics. Liao has had solo exhibitions both nationally and internationally, including the Art Institute of Chicago, Fotografiska, Rencontres d‚ÄôArles, the Asia Society, and the National Gallery of Australia.

She is a recipient of a New York Foundation of the Arts Fellowship in photography, Santo Foundation Individual Artist Awards, Madame Figaro Women Photographers Award, En Foco's New Works Fellowship, etc. She has also had artist residencies at Light Work, Lower Manhattan Cultural Council, Center for Photography at Woodstock, University of Arts London, La Residencia, School of Visual Arts,¬†Pioneer Works, and Camera Club of New York.

title: NYFA FILMMAKING HIGHLIGHTS
description:
TAKE A LOOK INTO SOME OF THE WORK OUR FILMMAKING STORYTELLERS HAVE CREATED WHILE HERE AT NYFA! 

Filmmakers tell captivating stories through film, television, and new media, using compelling narratives and engaging performances to bring their cinematic vision to life. At NYFA‚Äôs Film School, aspiring filmmakers master these skills and techniques, choosing from a variety of Filmmaking degrees, certificate programs, and workshops at our campuses in New York, Los Angeles, and Florence (Italy), as well as numerous international locations. During these hands-on programs, students learn-by-doing, spending a majority of their studies writing, shooting, editing, directing, and producing original films and digital content.

Through robust coursework, production workshops, and actual on-set experience that reflects the work done within the film industry, students build their confidence as directors and filmmakers. NYFA filmmaking students explore every phase of classical film structure and content creation, receiving a well-rounded education in the always-evolving art of visual storytelling. Our rigorous, accelerated approach provides students with the opportunity to make a number of films during their time at NYFA, and graduates leave our programs with a selection of their best work. Typically, the longer the program, the more content and films students get to create. For students interested in creating non-fiction content, we also offer a number of programs specifically for documentary films.

As the original disruptors of the Hollywood gate-keeping system, NYFA strives to make education in filmmaking accessible to the most diverse, international, and broadest community of students. At our film school, we foster an environment that is creatively challenging, respectful, and actively supportive of each unique student and of a collectively diverse student body.

#NYFA #NEWYORKFILM ACADEMY #NYFANY #NYFALA #FILMMAKING

title: WE ARE NYFA - NEW YORK FILM ACADEMY
description:
Over the last few decades, the New York Film Academy has become one of the most prominent institutions for visual and performing arts education. Known as "The Original Hands-on Film, Media, and Performing Arts School," NYFA was founded on the philosophy that ‚Äúlearning by doing‚Äù combined with best industry practices is more valuable than years of theoretical study for film, media, and performing arts students. 

NYFA offers hands-on intensive undergraduate and graduate degree programs, certificates, and workshops across a multitude of areas of study in New York City, Los Angeles, South Beach/Miami, Gold Coast (Australia), Florence (Italy), and more. Its programs are accelerated and NYFA students can complete a four-year BFA degree in three years. 

WE ARE NYFA. https://www.nyfa.edu/

title: NYFA Florence - 4-Week Digital Editing w/ DaVinci Resolve
description:
A strong editor knows how to piece together a compelling, engaging story. In NYFA‚Äôs full-time, 4-Week Digital Editing with DaVinci Resolve in Florence, students learn the art of storytelling for film, television, and media and become proficient in editing with DaVinci Resolve.

This workshop blends practical projects with in-depth coursework, giving you a solid foundation in editing with DaVinci Resolve‚Äîan industry-standard tool known for its powerful editing, color grading, and sound design capabilities. You‚Äôll learn cutting techniques, post-production workflows, media management, sound design, basic effects, and color correction, all while working on real projects that build your portfolio.

By the end of the workshop, you‚Äôll have a polished editing reel showcasing your work. If you‚Äôre considering a future in film or media, this workshop is the perfect place to start. 

#NYFA #NYFAFLORENCE #DaVinciResolve

title: Elective 1-Semester Filmmaking Workshop in association with Red Bull Media House at NYFA Florence
description:
Looking for an exciting and unique filmmaking program?

This special Elective 1-Semester Filmmaking Workshop in association with Red Bull Media House is offered exclusively at NYFA‚Äôs Florence, Italy Campus.

üé• What to Expect:
Exploration of multiple facets of filmmaking and creation of your own short movies.

Directing, Screenwriting, Editing, Cinematography & Elective Classes (Documentaries, Series, Live Events and Social Media).

Immersion in a unique, cross-cultural experience in Florence, Italy.

At the end of the workshop, students can invite family and friends to an exclusive screening of your work.

Graduates of the Elective 1-Semester Workshop can enroll in NYFA‚Äôs 1-Year Filmmaking Program to continue their film studies in the US.

Students attending other colleges and universities may be able to transfer credit earned based on their home institution's policies.*

description:
At NYFA Florence, students deepen their understanding and connection to the city's rich history of fine arts and Italian culture through the creative process of filmmaking and acting for film. Florence, Italy is an ideal backdrop for inspiration, innovation, and immersion.

Students can pursue semester long programs, in-person workshops, youth summer camps, and Study Abroad programs (both short-term and semester-long).
Study at NYFA in Florence, Italy - the Birthplace of the Renaissance!

title: Inside Film Festivals: Q&A with Wyoming International Festival Director Rudi Womack
description:
Rudi Womack is an editor, producer, and director from Cheyenne, Wyoming. He‚Äôs worked for Marvel, Disney, Lionsgate, DreamWorks, and currently serves as the Executive Director of the Wyoming International Film Festival. 

This February, Rudi joined Crickett Rumley, Senior Director of NYFA‚Äôs Film Festival Department, for a Deep Dive into how films are judged, how to avoid the common mistakes new filmmakers make, and the heavy lifting required once your film becomes an official selection.

title: NYFA Photo Guest Speaker Series:  Paul Sunday
description:
New York Film Academy  welcomed Paul Sunday for a special guest lecture and Q&A  as part of NYFA‚Äôs Photography Guest Speaker Series. NYFA Senior Faculty Member Nancy Burson, curated and moderated the event.

Paul Sunday is an internationally published photographer, multi-disciplinary artist, and educator.

Sunday was rigorously trained as an actor. He entered photography in the early 90s as a photo assistant and headshot photographer.¬†He rapidly advanced to celebrity portraiture and high-end fashion, shooting commissioned work for luxury brands like Bergdorf Goodman and Theory and publications including Interview, Flaunt, W magazine, and Paper.¬†

Simultaneously, he pursued an art practice, exhibiting abstract photography and reductive paintings in galleries and alternative spaces around New York.
He had institutional exhibitions at the New York Public Library and Pratt Manhattan.¬†More recently, he earned a mid-career MFA and began making sculptures and installations where photography hovers on the edges. 

Sunday is currently making collages and paintings and teaching in upstate New York.

title: Ronen Rubinstein's Inspiring Graduation Speech at NYFA's 2023 Commencement Ceremony
description:
Guest speaker, actor, and NYFA Alum Ronen Rubinstein recently took the stage during the Fall 2023 NYFA Los Angeles Commencement Ceremony to inspire us all and pay tribute to the gifted storytellers who achieved their college degrees this past year. 

From his transformative year at NYFA in 2012 to shining in Ryan Murphy's "9-1-1 Lone Star," Ronen shared his incredible journey with us before receiving an Honorary Degree of Master of Fine Arts in Acting for Film. üé≠‚ú® üåà To the Class of 2023, he sent his best wishes, foreseeing their brilliance on the big screen, TV & stage.

Watch this video and prepare to be inspired! üéì‚ú®

title: How two NYFA Alums crafted the Film Festival Run of Their Dreams
description:
New York Film Academy (NYFA) welcomed back NY Film Academy Alums Luc√≠a Fl√≥rez and Ch√©mi P√©rez as part of our Guest Speaker series moderated by Senior Director of NYFA‚Äôs Film Festival Department, Crickett Rumley.

Getting into the Sundance Film Festival is every emerging filmmaker‚Äôs dream, yet each year less than one percent of submitted shorts get selected.  This past August, Crickett Rumley sat down for a conversation with Luc√≠a Fl√≥rez and Ch√©mi P√©rez, who beat the odds when their documentary ‚ÄúShirampari: Legacies of the River‚Äù became an official selection of Sundance‚Äôs 2023 edition. In this Q&A, they discussed how they developed a festival strategy unique to them and their film, what they learned in the early months of their submission process and festival run, and how they prepared for -- and made the most of -- their Sundance experience.

 #NYFAAlums #Sundance #Shirampari #LegaciesOfTheRiver

NYFA I The College Tour I  Navigating Financial Aid
Inside New York Film Academy | The College Tour
description:
This October 2023, get ready for an exhilarating ride as the New York Film Academy takes center stage on the popular Amazon Prime series, The College Tour!

Viewers around the world will be treated to an exclusive, behind-the-scenes look at the NYFA community in the series‚Äô ninth season as ten students take the spotlight in what promises to be the most visually stunning episode of The College Tour.

In partnership with the series‚Äô production crew, NYFA‚Äôs episode was filmed across all three United States campuses in New York City, Los Angeles, and South Beach ¬∑ Miami.

The episode highlights NYFA‚Äôs diverse, passionate, and talented students as they practice their crafts with the school‚Äôs industry-standard equipment, professional sets, sound stages, theatres, and post-production labs, underlining the hands-on aspect of NYFA‚Äôs classes in the film, media, and performing arts.

Learn more at www.nyfa.edu/collegetour

title: NYFA Photo Guest Speaker Series: Luana Seu
description:
New York Film Academy  welcomed Luana Seu for a special guest lecture and Q&A  as part of NYFA‚Äôs Photography Guest Speaker Series. NYFA Photography Chair David Mager along with Photographer and NYFA Senior Faculty Member Nancy Burson, curated and moderated the event.

Luana Seu is a Romanian photographer currently based in NYC and Europe. Her background is in the performing arts, where her teenage years were spent competing and winning ballroom dance competitions. She studied in NYFA‚Äôs photography program, and her outstanding work has won her prestigious awards, such as the Jurors Picks of the Lens Culture Awards and a final nomination for the ReFocus Awards in Color Photography 2023. Luana‚Äôs work has appeared in Forbes, Bloom, Mob Journal, Opium Red, 17:23 Magazine, Men Cruze, and many other international publications.

Luana is nothing less than a powerhouse of creative energy, moving easily from actor, director, and screenwriter to photographer/videographer. The film she co-wrote and starred in is currently in production in London and is scheduled to be released next year. 

She recently completed work on a massive project at the First Contemporary Art Fair in Romania, where she used photography combined with AI to capture more than 1000 on-site portraits in a week.

#GuestSpeaker #NancyBrunson #PhotoGuestSpeaker

title: NYFA Guest Speaker Series : Kellen Gibbs
description:
New York Film Academy (NYFA) welcomed Director & NYFA Alum ,Kellen Gibbs, as part of our Guest Speaker series moderated by NYFA LA Creative Director of Acting, Lynda Goodfriend.

Since graduating from NYFA‚Äôs AFA Filmmaking program in 2015, writer and director Kellen Gibbs‚Äô has been nominated and invited to screen his work in numerous festivals, screening venues, and awards ceremonies, including the 34th Annual Fort Lauderdale International Film Festival, Carmel Film Festival, Idyllwild International Festival of Cinema, the Hollywood Music in Media Awards, and Legendary Digital‚Äôs Short Ends. 
His films have received over 40 award nominations. Tomorrow is his first feature film currently being screened in a number of festivals. For the film, Gibbs collaborated with several NYFA Acting alumni, including Jordan Knapp, Brandon Knabe, Ka‚ÄôPrise Colvin, Simmie Sangian, Tim Hildebrand, and Diego Medellin.

title: The 20/20 Series with Marc Sedaka
description:
In June 2021, we welcomed Feature Editor Marc Sedaka as part of The 20/20 Series, created by NYFA‚Äôs Creative Director of Filmmaking and Cinematography, Liz Hinlein.

After receiving his BA from Cornell University and MFA from NYU‚Äôs Tisch School of the Arts, Marc Sedaka quickly established himself as a successful screenwriter with numerous credits, including New Line Cinema‚Äôs Overnight Delivery starring Reese Witherspoon and Paul Rudd. Amongst his many TV credits, Marc wrote for CBS‚Äôs The King of Queens, NBC‚Äôs Inside Schwartz and had a blind script deal with Sony Pictures Television. Since receiving his 2nd MFA in editing from AFI in 2018, Marc has cut dozens of high-end shorts and five feature films. His most recent release, What Lies Below, starring Mena Suvari and Ema Horvath, came out theatrically in December.


#NYFA #The2020Series #MarcSedaka
 
The 20/20 Series is a pop-up event that takes us into the homes, hubs, and workspaces of an array of dynamic creative visionaries to allow for relaxed, engaging conversations on craft, creation, and artistic vision. title: The 20/20 Series with Hugh Kretschmer
description:
In April 2021, we welcomed Photographer Hugh Kretschmer as part of The 20/20 Series, created by NYFA‚Äôs Creative Director of Filmmaking and Cinematography, Liz Hinlein.

Hugh Kretschmer grew up in Los Angeles, and one of seven children in a family of artists. At the age of 13, he was introduced to photography by his father who was a photo-instrumentation engineer for MacDonnell Douglas from the Mercury through Apollo missions. Ten years later, Hugh received a Bachelor of Fine Arts Degree from Art Center College of Design, graduating with honors. He then moved to New York City to start his career, collaborating with editorial, design, and advertising clients such as Vanity Fair, New York Times Magazine, National Geographic, GQ, Penn & Teller, Old Spice, Huggies, Toyota, and Sony.

His images have been recognized by The International Photography Awards, American Photography, Communication Arts, PDN Photo Annual, Graphis Publications, and the Society of Publication Designers. His work has been profiled in many industry publications, books, podcasts, and blogs, including Graphis, Communication Arts, Juxtapoz, Plastik, Vision Magazine, and Beijing. His work has been selected for auction through Sotheby‚Äôs, Vienna and exhibited in galleries in Los Angeles, New York, and Paris, and is on permanent exhibit at the 911 Memorial, New York City.
Hugh has lectured and lead workshops at Eddie Adams Workshops in Jeffersonville, NY, Gulf Photo Plus, Dubai, and Fotorama, Serbia. He teaches photography part-time at Art Center College of Design, UCLA Extension, and the Los Angeles Center of Photography.


#NYFA #The2020Series #HughKretschmer

description:
In July 2021, we welcomed  COMMERCIAL DIRECTOR JORDAN BRADY
 as part of The 20/20 Series, created by NYFA‚Äôs Creative Director of Filmmaking and Cinematography, Liz Hinlein.

Stand-up comedian turned Director, Jordan Brady is a self-taught filmmaker with narrative feature films and commercial videos within his professional portfolio. 
Brady directs advertising campaigns for global brands and agencies. With a focus on comedy commercials, he has directed comedy giants including Will Ferrell, Kevin Hart, Keegan-Michael Key, Rory Scovel, and more. 
Brady received multiple Clios, National Gold, ADDY‚Äôs, Gold Promax Award, One Show, D Show, Pencil, and AICP Awards. His work is routinely spotlighted on AdWeek, Ads of The World, and Agency Spy. title: The 20/20 Series with Jordan Haro
description:
In May 2021, we welcomed Award-Winning Director/DP
Jordan Haro as part of The 20/20 Series, created by NYFA‚Äôs Creative Director of Filmmaking and Cinematography, Liz Hinlein.

Haro is known for his work on TV shows like Snowfall and Archer, as well as feature-length films including Machete (2010), The Wolverine (2013), and Balloon (2011). His long-spanning career titles include photographer, writer, editor, and keen observer. The Austin, TX-native filmmaker bounced around the globe telling stories for massive clients including National Geographic, Atlantic Records, TLC, and Sony Pictures. Aside from always watching, learning, and growing, Jordan‚Äôs current goals and aspirations are squarely set in the world of narrative filmmaking.
Haro, originally from Austin, Texas was raised on breakfast tacos and barbecue. He has mainly worked as a director, although has many years of experience in producing, editing, and shooting movies of all shapes and sizes. Jordan runs a production company, Homecourt Pictures, that specializes in producing and editing directly to the network, behind-the-scenes marketing, and promo materials. 
As an independent filmmaker, Haro sees owning a camera as a positive investment. Not only is he always at the ready for when a story is breaking but it is a great tool for collaborating/bartering with fellow filmmakers.

title: The 20/20 Series with Eric Steinman
description:
In May 2021, we welcomed  Commercial Director 
Eric Steinman as part of The 20/20 Series, created by NYFA‚Äôs Creative Director of Filmmaking and Cinematography, Liz Hinlein.

Eric Steinman continues to set new trends of dramatic and technical excellence through his company, Rhetoric, Inc., as well as partnering with top production companies worldwide. Whether it‚Äôs a heartfelt family story, a mom-baby bonding montage, a technical visual effects project, or an offbeat comedy/dialogue spot, Eric‚Äôs care and passion for casting, performance, detail and design can be seen throughout his award-winning work.

He began his career on the agency side, first in San Francisco and then New York, creating iconic campaigns for AT&T, HBO, PepsiCo and Gillette, turning to directing when the creative chief of TBWA/Chiat-Day suggested he pursue it. As a director, recent clients have included Philips, Kinder, Gerber, Dominion Energy, Merck, LG, Mead-Johnson, Sony, Allstate, Huggies, Texas DFPS, Bayer, Danone, Pampers, Mazda, Visa, P&G, Nestle, Beechnut, McDonalds, Toyota, Friso, Citibank as well as award-winning PSA‚Äôs for The Alzheimer‚Äôs Association, Big Brothers Big Sisters, and the Partnership for Drug Free Kids.
Always on the leading edge of technology and post-production, Eric‚Äôs London International Awards and Cannes-recognized spots for Astro-Mobile were the first TVC‚Äôs shot with what has become the industry standard camera, the Arri Alexa. He is also an experienced camera operator, skilled editor and has also supervised post- production in innumerable projects.
In addition to the London Awards and Cannes, other award recognition includes Andy, Clio, Art Director‚Äôs Club, Addy and AICP/MoMA among others.


#NYFA #The2020Series #EricSteinman

title: The 20/20 Series with Thomas Werner
description:
In June 2021, we welcomed Author and Consultant 
Thomas Werner as part of The 20/20 Series, created by NYFA‚Äôs Creative Director of Filmmaking and Cinematography, Liz Hinlein.

Thomas is the author of the book The Fashion Image for Bloomsbury Publishing, London, with a second book on fine art photography currently being written for Routledge Publishing. He is the founder of TWP Creative Edge, a consulting and educational organization focused on helping students and aspiring creatives achieve their goals in the commercial and fine arts. An Editor at Large for IRKmagazine, a Paris based fashion and culture magazine and website, founder of Thomas Werner Projects Podcast, instructor in the New York Film Academy Photography Program, and past Photography Program Director at Parsons School of Design in New York, Thomas currently lectures internationally on the topics of photography, fashion, innovation, education, and contemporary professional practices, with a series of recent presentations and workshops in 6 cities across China. He is the former owner of Thomas Werner Gallery in Manhattan‚Äôs Chelsea Art District, and a former National Board member and New York Chapter President for the American Society of Media Photographers. Werner also lead a team developing a media and literacy website and resource center in five languages, Spanish, French, Russian, Arabic and English for the United Nations Alliance of Civilizations/UNESCO. He has worked with the United States Department of State on cultural projects in Russia, and been a photography consultant for COACH and Rodale Publishing, among others. Thomas was a recurrent instructor at the United Nations Education First Summer School, and is now presenting workshops on effective message development and visual communication on an international basis.
Over the last 16 years his research has been Russia centric spending an average of 20 days a year there partnering with 32 cultural, educational, and governmental organizations to develop projects in 29 cities. The focus has been the introduction of contemporary education methodologies, and the development of creative cultures within the country. Russian partners have included; The State Hermitage Museum, the National Center of Contemporary Art, Perm Regional Government, The Moscow Biennale for Young Art, National Centre of Photography for the Russian Federation, The Central State Archive of Film, Photographic and Phonographic Documents, The Moscow Biennale, The Pro Arte Foundation, and others. He has curated exhibitions in the United States and abroad, including seven co-curated exhibitions at the State Hermitage Museum in Saint Petersburg, Russia. His private collection of Russian photographs and artifacts have been exhibited internationally.
#NYFA #The2020Series #ThomasWerner

title: The 20/20 Series with Steve Fuller
description:
In July 2021, we welcomed Emmy Award-Winning Director Steve Fuller as part of The 20/20 Series, created by NYFA‚Äôs Creative Director of Filmmaking and Cinematography, Liz Hinlein.



As a design-based director, Steve brings expertise in the integration of design and live-action to the production process, coupled with an ability to lead projects from conception to completion. Comfortable in a variety of mediums and genres, Steve's creative through-line is visual storytelling.
Steve is widely known for iconic projects such as his Emmy winning main titles for AMC's Mad Men serving as Creative Director and Designer. His creative efforts for Showtime's Nurse Jackie and the HBO miniseries The Pacific earned Steve two Emmy nominations in the Outstanding Main Title Design category in 2010.
Steve has recently been busy as an independent director helping major brands create memorable impressions with customers via commercials. His directing credits including major campaigns for McDonald‚Äôs and Anthem Healthcare. Steve has also worked with an impressive group of clients including Google, Ford, Amazon, Fender, Spike, MTV, CBS Sports, Fox, Reebok, NFL, Citibank, NBC, Covergirl, ESPN, Ubisoft, USA, Sears, BBC, Olympus, Glenmorangie, Sprint, Philips, Verizon, Turkish Airlines, and BMW.
Previously, Steve helped start and grow the East Coast offices of Imaginary Forces. Over his eight years with the firm, the Director/Designer forged a reputation for inspired, original projects for networks, agencies, and feature films.
His work has also been recognized by the BDA and The One Club.

title: The 20/20 Series with Tanuja Desai Hidier
description:
In December 2022, we welcomed Award-winning Novelist & Musician 
Tanuja Desai Hidier as part of The 20/20 Series, created by NYFA‚Äôs Creative Director of Filmmaking and Cinematography, Liz Hinlein.
Tanuja Desai Hidier was born in Bombay, India, and grew up in Wilbraham, Massachusetts. As an adult, the author/singer-songwriter moved to NYC, where she interned at The Paris Review and worked as a secretary for The Whitney Museum‚Äôs Film & Video Department. Hidier co-hosted the streaming music program DesiVibe and anchored an Indian news show. She met Liz Hinlein while working on a short film, The Test, at New York Film Academy. 
Hidier was the frontwoman to the punk-pop band io, playing gigs at CBGBs, Mercury Lounge, the Elbow Room, and Bitter End. After moving to London, Hidier wrote ‚ÄúBorn Confused,‚Äù her author debut, and is considered the first South Asian American YA novel. The novel was named an American Library Association Best Book for Young Adults and is included on numerous best-of lists. 
The author/singer-songwriter also made two albums of original songs based on ‚ÄúBorn Confused‚Äù and its award-winning sequel ‚ÄúBombay Blues.‚Äù The video for her ode to Bombay, ‚ÄúHeptanesia,‚Äù is an MTV Indies BuzzPick. Hidier produced the Deep Blue She #Mutiny2Unity #MeToo WeMix music video PSA, an intersectionality project featuring 100+ artists/activists (mostly women of color). 
The author is based in Maine on indigenous Wabanaki land, where she serves on the Board of Directors of a youth literary nonprofit, The Telling Room. The nonprofit‚Äôs mission is to empower youth, including immigrants and refugees, through writing and sharing their voices with the world. 
#NYFA #The2020Series #TanujaDesaiHidier

title: NYFA Guest Speaker Series: Founder & Managing Director of Neptune Sustainability Louise Marie Smith
description:
This year, as part of NYFA's Guest Speaker Series to mark Earth Day in April 2023, Louise Marie Smith, Founder, and Managing Director of Neptune Sustainability graced us with her inspiring insights. The conversation was moderated by none other than Jonathan Whittaker, Chair of Short-Term Filmmaking Workshops at NYFA.

Neptune Sustainability is a consultancy specializing in decarbonizing film and television production.
Following several years of working within an interdisciplinary Environmental Consultancy producing Environmental Impact Assessments for various industries, Louise established Neptune in 2006. By 2011, Neptune's client focus shifted to the film and television industry. Following two years of research into the workings of the industry, life on set, and the resulting environmental and climate impacts of production, she began work on her first studio feature in 2013.
 Smith spent a year with the BBC working on rolling out Albert to independent production companies and building it into the BBC commissioning requirements. She was an advisor for the Grid Project with Film London and The British Film Commission's Stage Space Design Strategy. 


#NYFA #LouiseMarieSmith #NeptuneSustainability

title: The 20/20 Series with Alan J. Levi
description:
In March 2022, we welcomed Award-winning Director Alan J Levi as part of The 20/20 Series, created by NYFA‚Äôs Creative Director of Filmmaking and Cinematography, Liz Hinlein.

Born and raised in St. Louis, Missouri, Alan J. Levi began his filmmaking career at fifteen years of age when he produced and directed a half-hour, black-and-white comedy, Keep Your Spirits High while as a high school sophomore. By the time he graduated high school, Alan ‚Äì with his own company ‚ÄúPetite Productions‚Äù - made a total of 43 films.
A Northwestern University graduate with a degree in Radio, TV and Film with minors in Electrical Engineering and Psychology, Alan directed over 2000 hours of live television around the world, and functioned as Director of Photography/Director on over 450 primetime network commercials. He was cameraman/director for 67 ABC‚Äôs Wide World of Sports and the 1970 and 1974 Olympics‚Äô ‚Äúup close and personal‚Äù segment which focused on American Olympic athletes.
Alan directed over 350 hours of network television in the past 45 years including Movies-of-the-Week, pilots and miniseries such as Scruples, Battlestar Galactica, The Incredible Hulk, Columbo, The Return of Sam McCloud, Legend of the Golden Gun, The New Invisible Man, and The Stepford Children. Among the series he's directed are NCIS, NCIS-LA, ER, JAG, Columbo, Buffy the Vampire Slayer, Magnum, P.I., Miami Vice, Dr. Quinn, Medicine Woman, Hercules, The Fugitive, Lois & Clark - The New Adventures of Superman, The Cosby Mysteries, Simon & Simon, Airwolf, Bionic Woman, Fame, Six Million Dollar Man, and a bunch of unmentionable others!
His directing credits earned him a Cannes Film Festival Gold Lion, Western Heritage Award, two New York International TV and Film Festival Grand Awards, two Clio Awards, several Silver Spike Awards, an Idyllwild International Film Festival award, Mediterranean Film Festival Cannes award, 2019 Circle Festival of Shorts award, and Sapporo International Short Film Festival award. 
Alan has guest lectured classes on filmmaking techniques at AFI, USC, UCLA and Brooks Institute of Photography, as well as numerous acting and filmmaking study groups.

#NYFA #The2020Series #AlanJLevi

title: The 20/20 Series with Marcus Stokes
description:
In March 2021, we welcomed Film & TV Director Marcus Stokes as part of The 20/20 Series, created by NYFA‚Äôs Creative Director of Filmmaking and Cinematography, Liz Hinlein.



Marcus Stokes worked as a computer graphics artist at George Lucas‚Äô Industrial Light and Magic (ILM). While at ILM, Stokes created groundbreaking visual effects for blockbuster films including Star Wars Episode I, Minority Report, and The Mummy. He then moved to Los Angeles and supervised visual effects for The Matrix Reloaded, The Matrix: Revolutions, I Robot, and Serenity.
Stokes officially began his directorial career when he joined the Director‚Äôs Guild of America as a commercial director and created ads for clients including GMC, Nissan, and Walt Disney Pictures. Soon after, he realized his true passion for narrative filmmaking and began creating his own content. His very first film as writer/director, The Catalyst, was acquired by HBO and aired on their networks for two years. He has since gone on to direct shows including Criminal Minds, 911, The Flash, Station 19, and The Astronauts.
Stokes joined the conversation from Canada where he was currently preparing to shoot episodes for the upcoming season of The CW‚Äôs popular series The Flash. Stokes spoke with Hinlein about how his VFX background at ILM exposed him to the filmmaking process and granted him facetime with some of the business‚Äôs most talented directors. It was this exposure to the role that allowed Stokes to be confident to transfer his skills for VFX and filmmaking to pursue becoming a director himself, citing mentors F. Gary Gray (Straight Outta Compton) and Tim Story (Fantastic Four) as his mentors.


#NYFA #The2020Series #MarcusStokes

title: NYFA's Q&A-List with Tova Laiter: Carey Mulligan
description:
New York Film Academy had the honor of hosting a live video Q&A with Academy Award¬Æ-nominated actor Carey Mulligan. Tova Laiter, Director of the NYFA Q&A-List Series, moderated the event and chatted with Mulligan about her many roles and career in film.

Carey Mulligan is an Academy Award¬Æ-nominated actor who first broke out in a starring role in the critically-acclaimed film An Education. The role garnered her the BAFTA Award for Best Actress and nominations for an Academy Award¬Æ and SAG Award.

Currently, Mulligan stars in Universal‚Äôs She Said alongside Zoe Kazan, which tells the true story of The New York Times journalists Meghan Twohey (Mulligan) and Jodi Kantor (Kazan) as they break the story of abuse in Hollywood in the pages of The New York Times. Mulligan is also in Netflix‚Äôs Spaceman alongside Adam Sandler, a science fiction drama film based on Jaroslav Kalfa≈ô‚Äôs novel by the same name. 

In 2021, Mulligan was nominated for her second Oscar in the Lead Actress category for her performance in Emerald Fennell‚Äôs directorial debut Promising Young Woman. The role garnered awards from the Critics‚Äô Choice Association, the Film Independent Spirit Awards, and the National Board of Review.

Mulligan has numerous additional film credits spanning her tenure in film, television, and theatre. Other titles featuring the actor include Netflix‚Äôs The Dig opposite Ralph Fiennes; Inside Llweyn Davis alongside Oscar Isaac, directed by Joel and Ethan Coen; The Great Gatsby alongside Leonardo DiCaprio, directed by Baz Luhrmann; Shame alongside Michael Fassbender, and more. 

With experience in the stage theatre, Mulligan made her West End stage debut in 2014 alongside Bill Nighy in the critically acclaimed revival of David Hare‚Äôs Olivier Award-winning play ‚ÄúSkylight,‚Äù directed by Stephen Daldry. A year later, the play transferred to Broadway, for which Mulligan received Drama League, Drama Desk, and Tony Award nominations. 

 #NYFA #CareyMulligan #SheSaid

title: The 20/20 Series with Mary Lou Belli
description:
In September 2022, we welcomed Emmy Award-winning Director Mary Lou Belli as part of The 20/20 Series, created by NYFA‚Äôs Creative Director of Filmmaking and Cinematography, Liz Hinlein.

Mary Lou Belli is a two-time Emmy award-winning director spanning content across a 30-year career, including NCIS New Orleans, Black Lightning, Bull, Legacies, Station 19, Sweet Magnolias, Pitch, Monk, Famous In Love, Devious Maids, The Quad, American Woman, and Hart of Dixie as well as Disney‚Äôs The Secret of Sulphur Springs, Ms. Pat, Wizards of Waverly Place, Sister, Sister, Girlfriends, and The Game. Her short film, Straight Eye for the Gay Guy won ‚ÄúBest Mini-short‚Äù at the California Independent Film Fest where she also premiered I Heard Something, a thriller that went on to play festivals internationally. She has done ground-breaking work on web series and her award-winning short, America, played its 14th festival at The Hague and won ‚ÄòBest Short.‚Äô
Mary Lou served two terms as the Co-chair of the Women‚Äôs Steering Committee at the DGA where she also has served on the Western Director‚Äôs Council, presently she is on Leadership Council PAC and as an alternate to the National Board. She is an Honorary Board member of the Alliance of Women Directors and Advisory Board member of Women in Media, and long-time member of Women In Film as well as the Peer Group Executive Committee of the Academy of Television Arts & Sciences.
She has served as a judge and/or guest speaker for the CSU Media Arts Fest, a judge for the Miss America Outstanding Teen Pageant, a jury member at the Sapporo Short Festival, Newport Beach Film Fest, Regina International Film Festival, and The Voice awards, a lecturer at the Chautauqua Institute, and a panelist for Women In Film, the DGA, SAG, and AFTRA and the LA Times Festival of Books. She has been a guest artist at the International Thespian Festival for secondary school theatre where she gave workshops to thousands of teens and high school theatre teachers. Through her teaching, she supports many of the vibrant diversity programs including ABC/Disney, CBS, Sony, HBO Access, AFI‚Äôs Directing Workshop for Women, and Warner Bros. 
She is the co-author of four books: ‚ÄúThe NEW Sitcom Career Book,‚Äù "Acting for Young Actors," and ‚ÄúDirectors Tell the Story‚Äù which she co-wrote with fellow DGA member Bethany Rooney. Her 4th book, "Acting for the Screen" was published by Focal Press in the Summer of 2019.

#NYFA #The2020Series #MaryLouBelli

title: The 20/20 Series with Norman Buckley
description:
In October 2022, we welcomed TV Producing Director Norman Buckley as part of The 20/20 Series, created by NYFA‚Äôs Creative Director of Filmmaking and Cinematography, Liz Hinlein.

Norman Buckley is a prolific director whose work spans various networks, genres, and styles. His credits include Pretty Little Liars, Charmed, In the Dark, Zoo, Quantico, Rizzoli and Isles, Chuck, Gossip Girl, and The OC. He was co-executive producer/producing director on the Netflix show Sweet Magnolias, a job he previously did on Pretty Little Liars: The Perfectionists.
His television movie The Pregnancy Project won Best Primetime Program (Special or Movie of the Week) and Best Actress (Alexa Vega) at the 2012 Imagen Awards. His episode of The OC ‚ÄúThe Metamorphosis‚Äù was chosen by Entertainment Weekly magazine as one of the five best episodes of the series. His episode of Gossip Girl ‚ÄúThe Handmaiden‚Äôs Tale‚Äù was chosen by Newsweek Magazine as one of the top ten television episodes of 2007.
Buckley began working in the industry as an assistant editor on the Oscar-nominated films Tender Mercies, Silkwood, and Places in the Heart. He continued editing for a number of years on many films, television series, and TV movies. He worked with many outstanding directors, including Bruce Beresford, Robert Benton, Mike Nichols, Rob Reiner, Michael Lindsay-Hogg, Richard Donner, J.S. Cardone, McG, Doug Liman, and Robert M. Young. He also learned the editing craft from some of the best film editors in the business, including Carol Littleton, Sam O'Steen, William Anderson, and Bob Leighton.
He worked as an editor on many independent films at the Sundance, Toronto, and Telluride film festivals, including Happy, Texas, which he also associate-produced. Beginning in 2000, Buckley edited several television pilots, all of which were picked up to series, which led to his regular work in television.
He has been nominated twice for an American Cinema Editors award: in 2003 for Joe and Max, for best-edited motion picture for non-commercial television, and he won the award in 2008 for the pilot of Chuck, for best-edited one-hour series for commercial television.

#NYFA #The2020Series #NormanBuckley

title: The 20/20 Series with Sheryl J. Anderson
description:
In November 2022, we welcomed Showrunner Sheryl J. Anderson as part of The 20/20 Series, created by NYFA‚Äôs Creative Director of Filmmaking and Cinematography, Liz Hinlein.

Sheryl J. Anderson is the showrunner of Sweet Magnolias, a romantic drama for Netflix that just wrapped production on Season Two; she also has a variety of projects in development. She began her writing journey as a playwriting major at The College of William & Mary. Lured to Los Angeles by the intrigue of television and the promise of 300 sunny days a year, she worked as a television studio executive, screenwriter, and half-hour episodic writer (Parker Lewis Can‚Äôt Lose, Dave‚Äôs World). She then moved to writing and producing hour-long series, working on a wide range of shows (Charmed, Flash Gordon, When Calls the Heart). She has sold pilots to Disney, SyFy, NBC, and Lifetime, and written movies for Hallmark, UPtv, and Lifetime. Sheryl also teaches and mentors through a variety of universities and organizations.

#NYFA #The2020Series #SherylJAnderson

title: The 20/20 Series with Geary McLeod
description:
In November 2022, we welcomed Episodic Director Geary McLeod as part of The 20/20 Series, created by NYFA‚Äôs Creative Director of Filmmaking and Cinematography, Liz Hinlein.

Geary McLeod is a Cinematographer and member of the Director‚Äôs Guild of America (DGA), the International Alliance of Theatrical Stage Employees (IATSE), and the American Society of Cinematographers (CSA). McLeod spent two years as a 2nd AC, eleven years as a 1st AC, and seven years as a Camera Operator. 
McLeod worked with feature directors including Spike Lee, Brian De Palma, Richard Donner, and Penny Marshall. Throughout his career, he worked with cinematographers including Stephen Goldblatt, Ernest Dickerson, Vilmos Zsigmond, John Lindley, and Elliot Davis. After five jobs with director Spike Lee as First AC and Camera Operator on the feature films Malcolm X, Crooklyn, Clockers, He Got Game, and Get on the Bus, McLeod transitioned to episodic television.
The Cinematographer earned his first union job as a DP in 2000. In 2008, the producers of the CBS TV show, The Mentalist, offered McLeod the opportunity to direct. By the time the show wrapped, he directed enough episodes to move into directing full-time.
McLeod is a graduate of the University of Massachusetts in Boston with a major in English. 

#NYFA #The2020Series #GearyMcLeod

title: The 20/20 Series with Carolina Groppa
description:
In June 2022, we welcomed Emmy-nominated Producer Carolina Groppa as part of The 20/20 Series, created by NYFA‚Äôs Creative Director of Filmmaking and Cinematography, Liz Hinlein.

Carolina Groppa is an Emmy-nominated Producer based in Los Angeles. She produced the 2017 Emmy-nominated feature documentary Autism in Love, which explores how adults with autism find and navigate romantic relationships. It premiered internationally to rave reviews at the 2015 Tribeca Film Festival and aired on the PBS Independent Lens series.
Autism in Love was the recipient of the Fifth Annual Peek Award for Disability in Film by the Utah Film Center, which pays tribute to artists who positively impact society‚Äôs perception of people with disabilities.
Groppa was co-producer to Miss Virginia, starring Uzo Aduba and was Production Supervisor to the Netflix original film Girlfriend‚Äôs Day starring Bob Odenkirk, and Happy Anniversary starring Ben Schwartz and N√∂el Wells.
In 2016, she had the pleasure of co-producing The Female Brain, Whitney Cummings' directorial debut and produced Curated, a short film for Refinery 29's Shatterbox Anthology Series, directed by Gillian Jacobs which premiered at TIFF in 2018.
She was the physical producer (UPM) on Sylvie‚Äôs Love, available for streaming on Amazon. Written and directed by Eugene Ashe, this ode to classic melodramas stars Tessa Thompson and Nnamdi Asomugha. An official selection of Sundance 2020, the film received raved reviews by The New York Times and The LA Times.
Groppa produced the feature documentary Hysterical for FX, directed by Andrea Nevins (Tiny Shoulders: Rethinking Barbie), and premiered internationally at SXSW 2021. The film is an honest and hilarious backstage pass into the lives of some of stand-up comedy‚Äôs most boundary-breaking women, exploring the hard-fought journey to become the voices of their generation and their gender. She is an executive producer to Honk for Jesus. Save Your Soul, and is an executive in charge of production at Issa Rae‚Äôs ColorCreative Management and Hoorae Media.

#NYFA #The2020Series #CarolinaGroppa

title: The 20/20 Series with Matt Harry
description:
In April 2022, we welcomed Novelist and Screenplay Writer Matt Harry as part of The 20/20 Series, created by NYFA‚Äôs Creative Director of Filmmaking and Cinematography, Liz Hinlein.

Matt Harry has been telling stories since he was 10 years old. He spent his early years writing newspaper articles for the Cleveland Plain Dealer, one-act plays, and some very serious short stories. He studied playwriting under Wendy MacLeod at Kenyon College before transferring to Ohio University, where he discovered filmmaking. He graduated cum laude with a BS in Television Production. He moved to Los Angeles to attend the University of Southern California‚Äôs School of Cinematic Arts and received an MFA in Film Production. Since graduating from USC, Matt has worked as a reality TV editor, director, and producer on The Bachelor, Design on a Dime, Seriously Funny Kids, and Rock the Reception.
As a writer, Matt‚Äôs screenplays have been recognized by the Austin Film Festival, the NYTVF Comedy Script Contest, Script Pipeline, the Launchpad Manuscript Contest, the Stowe Story Labs, the Screencraft Fellowships, and the Nicholl Fellowships. His first produced feature screenplay, Fugue, landed on several top-ten lists, won Best Horror Film at the Mississippi Film Festival, and was picked up for distribution by GoDigital. Matt has written also screenplays for Primary Wave, Platform One Media, Co-op Entertainment, and Flynn Picture Co. His short film Super Kids, which he wrote and co-directed, has over 6 million views on YouTube. His TV pilot Monster Cops was awarded Grand Prize in the Second City Original Sitcom Contest and is currently in development.
His debut novel ‚ÄòSorcery for Beginners‚Äô was described as ‚ÄúJ.K. Rowling meets V.E. Schwab,‚Äù and Publishers Weekly declared it ‚Äúa charming package and drily funny adventure.‚Äù It was recently optioned for television by Boatrocker Media and Matt was hired to adapt the pilot. Book II in the series, ‚ÄòCryptozoology for Beginners,‚Äô was published in 2019. His middle-grade adventure novel ‚ÄòSuperkid‚Äô was published in June 2021. The interactive novel ‚ÄòYou Are a Filmmaker‚Äô publishes in 2022.
Matt also wrote, produced, and directed the immersive romantic comedy Somebody to Love, which played to a sold-out run in a site-specific Los Angeles neighborhood in the summer of 2019. No Proscenium called the production "endearing, playful, and a bold new take on a genre," while Haunting agreed it was a "delightful romp."
#NYFA #The2020Series #MattHarry

title: The 20/20 Series with Holle Singer
description:
In July 2022, we welcomed Feature Film and Commercial Editor Holle Singer as part of The 20/20 Series, created by NYFA‚Äôs Creative Director of Filmmaking and Cinematography, Liz Hinlein.

Holle Singer is a Brooklyn-born editor. Her most recent film, Tim Sutton‚Äôs Taurus starring Machine Gun Kelly, premiered at the 2022 Berlin International Film Festival. She also cut the feature film Aviva, directed by Boaz Yakin which premiered at the 2020 SXSW Film Festival.
Singer‚Äôs career was built from cutting music videos, commercials, and short films. Her music videos include Miley Cyrus‚Äô ‚ÄúWrecking Ball‚Äù (2014 MTV VMA Video of the Year), Justin Timberlake‚Äôs ‚ÄúWhat Goes Around‚Äù (Best Editing nominee 2007 MTV VMAs) and The White Stripes‚Äô ‚ÄúBlue Orchid‚Äù (Best Editing nominee 2006 MVPAs). Her short films include Postmortem Bliss with Director Floria Sismondi, The Big Break directed by Philp Andelman, and Bugcrush directed by Carter Smith (2006 Sundance short film winner).
She edited the documentaries House of Z (Tribeca Film Festival 2017) about fashion designer Zac Posen, and Look At What The Light Did Now (2012 Juno Award Winner) about the making of Feist‚Äôs seminal album ‚ÄúThe Reminder.‚Äù

#NYFA #The2020Series #HolleSinger
 
The 20/20 Series is a pop-up event that takes us into the homes, hubs, and workspaces of an array of dynamic creative visionaries to allow for relaxed, engaging conversations on craft, creation, and artistic vision. Each conversation with a creative visionary features 20 minutes of discussion with a moderator and a 20-minute Q&A from YOU, the audience.

title: NYFA Photo Guest Speaker Series: Pauline Vermare
description:
New York Film Academy  welcomed Pauline Vermare, photography historian, curator, and writer based in NYC for a special guest lecture and Q&A  as part of NYFA‚Äôs Photography Guest Speaker Series. NYFA Photography Chair David Mager along with Photographer and NYFA Senior Faculty Member Nancy Burson, curated and moderated the event.

Pauline Vermare was formerly the cultural director of Magnum Photos in New York, and a curator at both ICP and MoMA. From 2002 to 2009 she worked at the Henri Cartier-Bresson Foundation in Paris. Pauline grew up in France and Japan. She studied Japanese at the Institut National des Langues et Civilisations Orientales (Paris). In 2017, she curated the ‚ÄúAll About Saul Leiter‚Äù exhibition at the Bunkamura Museum in Tokyo.  This presentation forms the basis of her upcoming book on Japanese women photographers that she is currently editing with Lesley Martin at Aperture, and is scheduled to be published in 2024. Pauline just became a Ph.D. as well as a Chevalier de l‚ÄôOrdre des Arts et des Lettres, an honor granted by the French Ministry of Culture. She sits on the boards of the Saul Leiter Foundation in New York, and the Catherine Leroy Fund in Paris.

#NYFA #PaulineVermare #photography

title: The 20/20 Series with Nick Job
description:
In July 2022, we welcomed Actor and Writer Nick Job as part of The 20/20 Series, created by NYFA‚Äôs Creative Director of Filmmaking and Cinematography, Liz Hinlein.
Nick Job is a creative thought leader, actor, writer, and screenwriting coach. As an actor, his credits include David Fincher‚Äôs Mank, Yellowstone, Billions, Blindspot, and many others. As a writer, he is working on a TV project in development within the streaming space alongside a sought-after showrunner. 
As a coach and consultant, his company Page One has helped countless clients write pitches and scripts for TV. His clients have gone on to sell at major studios like Netflix and Universal Studios. His approach to screenwriting focuses on ‚Äúmaking the personal universal,‚Äù and his ideas about narrative artists finding their personal ‚Äúkey‚Äù inspired many to connect to and share the deepest parts of themselves on screen. 
#NYFA #The2020Series #NickJob

title: The 20/20 Series with Dr. Valerie Weiss
description:
In December 2022, we welcomed Award-winning Filmmaker and Scientist Dr. Valerie Weiss as part of The 20/20 Series, created by NYFA‚Äôs Creative Director of Filmmaking and Cinematography, Liz Hinlein.

Dr. Valerie Weiss has infused her signature blend of elevated and emotional storytelling into her four feature films and dozens of television episodes. Her work has been called "daringly light" for the way it embraces controversial topics in enchanting ways and spans the genres of action, thriller, drama, science-fiction and comedy. Valerie‚Äôs recently released feature film, Mixtape, which she directed for Netflix from a Blacklist-winning script, has scored a coveted 100% on Rotten Tomatoes and ranks as one of the best family films of 2021 according to The Washington Post and Common Sense Media.

Valerie‚Äôs recent television work includes directing the finale of the upcoming limited series Echoes (Netflix) for showrunners Brian Yorkey and Quinton Peeples which reached #1 Worldwide on the streamer for more than 10 days, two episodes of Fox‚Äôs new Country Music Drama, Monarch, starring Susan Sarandon, and episode of Star Trek: Strange New Worlds, and multiple episodes across all seasons of Netflix‚Äôs global megahit Outer Banks. Additionally, she directed multiple episodes for several of television's biggest producers including Shonda Rhimes, Dick Wolf, Greg Berlanti and Marc Cherry.

Valerie's third feature, The Archer, is a feminist coming-of-age action film best described as Thelma and Louise meets First Blood and premiered at the 2017 SXSW Film Festival. Her other films have played at a multitude of film festivals and won various awards including the Audience Award at the Mill Valley Film Festival and Best Director at the Whistler Film Festival.
A proud member of the DGA, Valerie was recently elected Director Category Representative of the DGA's Women's Steering Committee and appointed to the DGA's new Eco-Committee by President Lesli Linka Glatter. In 2018, Valerie won the top honors in the Fox Filmmaking Lab for her pitch of a female-centric sequel in the Maze Runner franchise called True Maze. She participated in the WeForShe DirectHer Program, and the inaugural DGA Director Development Initiative. Valerie is on the Board of Advisors for the Paperless App Scriptation for which she recently won an Engineering Emmy. She is an alum of the AFI Directing Workshop for Women (DWW) Program and holds a Ph.D. in biophysics and a Masters in Medical Sciences from Harvard Medical School.
 
#NYFA #The2020Series #DrValerieWeiss

title: NYFA's Q&A-List with Tova Laiter: Kevin Nealon
description:
New York Film Academy had the honor of hosting a live video Q&A with Former SNL Cast Member & Comedian Kevin Nealon. Tova Laiter, Director of the NYFA Q&A-List Series, moderated the event along with NYFA LA Faculty member Eric Conner. Together, they chatted with Nealon about his role on SNL and career in film.

Kevin Nealon is an Emmy and SAG-nominated actor and comedian who sets himself apart from other comedic performers with his unique sense of humor, dry wit, and likable demeanor.¬†

Nealon is best known for his nine-year stint as a cast member of NBC‚Äôs Saturday Night Live, and received critical acclaim for his role in the hit Showtime series Weeds. Kevin currently produces and hosts his digital series Hiking with Kevin, and tours his stand-up globally. He will be releasing his latest book ‚ÄúI Exaggerate: My Brushes with Fame‚Äù on October 25th, 2022, published by Abrams Books. Part art book, part memoir -- the book is full of original full-color caricatures Kevin has created along with funny, endearing personal essays about his famous friends.¬†

Nealon has found great comedic success in his extensive film career. In Anger Management, he played opposite Jack Nicholson and fellow SNL comedian Adam Sandler. He and Sandler teamed up in Eight Crazy Nights, The Wedding Singer, Happy Gilmore, Just Go With It, Blended, and You Don‚Äôt Mess with the Zohan, the latter of which grossed over $200 million worldwide.¬†

As one of the longest-running cast members on NBC‚Äôs Saturday Night Live (1986-1995), Nealon created some of the show‚Äôs most memorable characters including ‚ÄòThe Subliminal Man‚Äô and ‚ÄòHans and Franz.‚Äô Nealon‚Äôs recurring role as an anchor on ‚ÄòWeekend Update‚Äô helped make the sketch a show staple. In 1988, he earned an Emmy nomination as part of the SNL writing team.¬†

¬†#NYFA #KevinNealon #SNL¬†¬†

title: NYFA Photo Guest Speaker Series: Oliver Wasow
description:
New York Film Academy  welcomed back Oliver Wasow, a fine art photographer currently living and working in Rhinebeck, NY for a special guest lecture and Q&A  as part of NYFA‚Äôs Photography Guest Speaker Series. Photographer and NYFA Senior Faculty Member Nancy Burson curated and moderated the event.

Wasow‚Äôs photographs are included in a number of private collections and are also represented in various prominent public collections, including The Metropolitan Museum of Art, The Whitney Museum of Art, The Museum of Modern Art in New York City, and The Milwaukee Art Museum. Reviews of his work have been featured in most major art publications, including, among others, Art Forum, ArtNews, and The New York Times.

title: The 20/20 Series with Daniella Eisman
description:
In October 2022, we welcomed Television Director Daniella Eisman as part of The 20/20 Series, created by NYFA‚Äôs Creative Director of Filmmaking and Cinematography, Liz Hinlein.

Daniella Eisman grew up in Cape Town, South Africa and used her storytelling skill as a means of expression during a politically rife climate. She was a record-breaking swimmer and competitive dancer. She began her US career as an actor and performer. After joining SAG in 1999, she realized her passion lay in storytelling behind the camera.

During the pandemic, Daniella directed Shameless, was the Producing Director on Season 3 of First Wives Club in Atlanta and Season 2 of Sex Lives of College Girls. She directed multiple episodes of Pivoting, Saved By the Bell, the final season of Brooklyn 99, The Mindy Project, Superstore, Loosely Exactly Nicole, and ABC's Splitting Up Together.

Daniella has extensive on-set experience as a 1st Assistant Director, leading cast and crew with her commanding presence and focused approach. She was Assistant Director for Grey's Anatomy (where the team was nominated for a DGA award), American Horror Story, Medium, Mistresses, Gilmore Girls, Getting On, HawthoRNe, and CSI, among others.

Daniella worked with top-notch directors to transform her skills & shape who she is as a director today. These invaluable experiences have helped find her own original directing voice, allowing her to thoughtfully craft and mold her episodes.

#NYFA #The2020Series #DaniellaEisman

title: The 20/20 Series - Case study with Dan Attias and Eliot Rockett
description:
In August 2022, we welcomed FX‚Äôs ‚ÄòSnowfall‚Äô Director Dan Attias & DP Eliot Rockett as part of The 20/20 Series, created by NYFA‚Äôs Creative Director of Filmmaking and Cinematography, Liz Hinlein.

Dan Attias has worked as a director in the film and television industry since 1984. As a director of series television, he has received the Directors Guild of America award for outstanding direction of dramatic television for The Wire and has been nominated for episodes of The Sopranos, Six Feet Under, Homeland, and The Marvelous Mrs. Maisel. He has received Emmy Award nominations for his comedy direction on Entourage and continues to work on some of the most celebrated American television shows. His recent credits include The Americans, Billions, and The Boys. 
Dan started his career by studying acting, then worked as an assistant director on E.T. the Extra-Terrestrial, Airplane!, One From the Heart, and several other feature films. 

Eliot Rockett has been a cinematographer for the last 30 years. He started his career in New York and then moved back out west, spending time in San Francisco and Los Angeles. For the last decade, he spent his time working in both television and feature films. 

#NYFA #The2020Series #DanAttias #EliotRockett #Snowfall #FX

title: NYFA's Q&A-List with Tova Laiter: Nate Moore
description:
New York Film Academy had the honor of hosting a live video Q&A with Marvel Studios Producer, Nate Moore. Tova Laiter, Director of the NYFA Q&A-List Series, moderated the event and chatted with Moore about his role in producing Marvel‚Äôs Black Panther: Wakanda Forever.

Nate Moore is the Executive of Production & Development at Marvel Studios. During his 12+ years at the studio, Moore developed scripts from existing Marvel publishing properties for feature films. Once developed, he found filmmakers, supported the selection of cast and crew for films, and oversaw projects from prep through post-production.

Moore was a Producer on the recently released Black Panther: Wakanda Forever, Producer on Eternals, and Executive Producer on the Disney+ limited series The Falcon and the Winter Soldier. Moore was also Executive Producer on Black Panther, Captain America: Civil War, and Co-Producer on Captain America: The Winter Soldier.


 #NYFA #NateMoore #MarvelStudios #BlackPanther

title: The 20/20 Series with Amanda Toney
description:
In November 2022, we welcomed producer & managing director at Stage 32, Amanda Toney, as part of The 20/20 Series, created by NYFA‚Äôs Creative Director of Filmmaking and Cinematography, Liz Hinlein.

As¬†Managing Director for Stage 32, Amanda Toney¬†oversees operations and partnerships for the global business.¬†

Toney spearheaded partnerships with prestigious organizations, including¬†Cannes Film Festival March√© du Film,¬†American Film Market,¬†Netflix,¬†SXSW,¬†Austin Film Festival,¬†Raindance Film Festival,¬†Hollyshorts Film Festival,¬†PGA,¬†WGA¬†and¬†DGA. She‚Äôs worked with brands including AT&T, Peerspace, Pond5, Mandy, Bondit Media Capital, and her personal favorite, Tito‚Äôs Handmade Vodka‚Äìthe official vodka of Stage 32.

As a film producer, Toney worked on the psychological thriller¬†What Lies Ahead¬†starring¬†Rumer Willis and Emma Dumont,¬†Metaphorms, a Hungarian film that premiered at the Raindance Film Festival, and¬†Dolphin Girl,¬†which¬†premiered at the Oscar-qualifying¬†Hollyshorts Film Festival.¬†
She helped incubate¬†Chick Fight, starring¬†Malin Akerman,¬†Alec Baldwin, and¬†Bella¬†Thorne. She is an Executive Producer on¬†Vagic¬†with Amy Baer at Gidden Media, and¬†My Clone's an A*Hole¬†with¬†National Lampoon. As a television producer, she recently sold a scripted drama series to a mini-major studio and premium unscripted show to a major U.S. network.Toney has spoken all over the world at Cannes Film Festival (France), Hollyshorts Film Festival (US), Raindance Film Festival (UK), Hamburg Film Fest (Germany), Trinidad & Tobago Film Commission (Trinidad), Black Nights Film Festival (Estonia), Fest Festival (Portugal), and Harvard (US) on the subject of business in the entertainment industry.


#NYFA #The2020Series #AmandaToney #Stage32

title: NYFA Guest Speaker Series: Screenwriting Alum & Marvel Studios Director Mohamed Diab
description:
Years ago, Mohamed Diab was a 1-Year Screenwriting Student at NYFA LA. Today, he is the lead director and executive producer of Marvel Studios‚Äô Emmy Award-winning series Moon Knight.

In September 2022, Diab returned to our LA Campus to speak with his former instructor Crickett Rumley and current MFA Filmmaking student Israa Al-Kamali. In this video recap, Rumley and Diab discuss his career, recent work, advice, and anecdotes with aspiring filmmakers and screenwriters who dream of the same success.

Matteo Borghese and Rob Turbovsky have a long list of credits including Silicon Valley, Lady Dynamite, Black Monday, It‚Äôs Always Sunny in Philadelphia, and Detroiters. They have developed original pilots at Comedy Central, TBS, ABC, and Fox. In film, they have contributed to the scripts for Spider-Man: Into the SpiderVerse, Ghostbusters (2016), Office Christmas Party, The Peanuts Movie, and Borat Subsequent Moviefilm, among others. Borghese and Turbovsky have been writing partners for ten years and both received an MFA in screenwriting from USC. They are Emmy, Golden Globe, PGA and two-time WGA award nominees.

title: NYFA Guest Speaker Series: Shabana Azmi
description:

#NYFA #GuestSpeaker #ShabanaAzmi

Known to play unconventional female characters across many genres, she has also received international recognition for her work on screen.

title: NYFA's Q&A-List with Tova Laiter: Emmy Rossum
description:
New York Film Academy had the honor of hosting a live video Q&A with Actor and Producer, Emmy Rossum. Tova Laiter, Director of the NYFA Q&A-List Series, moderated the event and chat with Rossum about her role on Peacock‚Äôs latest limited series, Angelyne.

ANGELYNE, Peacock‚Äôs limited series about fame, identity, survival, billboards, Corvettes, lingerie, men, women, women teasing men, men obsessed with women, West Hollywood, crystals, UFOs, and most importantly of all, the self-proclaimed Rorschach test in pink, glow-in-the-dark queen of the universe, Angelyne.

Read more about this event at the following link: http://bit.ly/3EsqKm2

About Emmy Rossum
Emmy Rossum has been captivating audiences with her varied and exceptional talents for over a decade. Rossum‚Äôs performance in Songcatcher earned her an Independent Spirit Award nomination in the category of ‚ÄúBest Debut Performance.‚Äù Four years later in 2004, her starring performance as ‚ÄúChristine‚Äù in The Phantom of the Opera earned her a Golden Globe Award nomination, as well as the National Board of Review‚Äôs ‚ÄúBest Female Breakthrough Performance‚Äù Award and the Broadcast Film Critics Association‚Äôs ‚ÄúBest Young Actress‚Äù Award in 2005.

Rossum can currently be seen starring in Angelyne, a limited series based on The Hollywood Reporter's investigative feature about the life of Los Angeles‚Äô mysterious billboard icon. Rossum executive produced and stars in the series, with critics hailing her performance as ‚Äúincandescent and gritty and equal measure,‚Äù and ‚Äúdazzling.‚Äù The 5-episode limited series is available on Peacock.

Rossum starred as ‚ÄòFiona Gallagher‚Äô in Showtime‚Äôs critically acclaimed dark comedy series, Shameless, for nine seasons, departing the series in 2019. Rossum made her directorial debut on the series in the seventh season for the episode I Am a Storm, and directed on the series for the second time for the eighth season episode Frank‚Äôs Northern Shuttle Express. Rossum also had the opportunity to direct an episode on another John Wells series, TNT‚Äôs Animal Kingdom. She also directed an episode of Amazon‚Äôs Modern Love series, based on The New York Times column of the same name.

In 2019, Rossum signed a First Look deal with Universal Content Productions and began developing premium scripted content for the studio under her production company, Composition 8. In 2018, Rossum appeared opposite Will Forte in the Netflix original film A Futile and Stupid Gesture. The film follows the success of National Lampoon in the 1970‚Äôs and 80‚Äôs and premiered at the Sundance Film Festival.

Rossum‚Äôs other film credits include Comet opposite Justin Long and Shawn Christensen‚Äôs Before I Disappear, based on the 2012 Oscar-winning short Curfew, which won the prestigious ‚ÄúAudience Award‚Äù at SXSW. Other film credits include Warner Bros.‚Äô Beautiful Creatures, DARE alongside Zach Gilford, Poseidon, The Day After Tomorrow with Jake Gyllenhaal, and the Clint Eastwood-directed drama Mystic River.

In 2007, Rossum recorded her first album for Geffen records, Inside Out, which showcased her classically trained voice as the primary instrument. She wrote and recorded all her own songs. She released her second album, Sentimental Journey ‚Äîa collection of 1940s standards‚Äîin January 2013.

Rossum began her theatrical career at the age of seven when she began singing the children‚Äôs roles at the Metropolitan Opera at Lincoln Center. Between the ages of seven and twelve, she was trained there in stagecraft and classical vocal technique and performed in five languages in 20 different operas.

Rossum has worked with Best Friends Animal Society for over a decade and she is also on the board of the Gorilla Doctors of Rwanda.

Rossum was born in New York City in 1986 and attended the Spence School until 1996. She earned her high school degree through Stanford University‚Äôs Education Program for Gifted Youth (EPGY) and Northwestern University‚Äôs Center for Talent Development (CTD).

Rossum splits her time between New York and Los Angeles.

title: NYFA Guest Speaker Series: Team Behind ‚ÄòExposure‚Äô
description:
New York Film Academy & GreenLight Women brought an exciting guest speaker event with the team behind the documentary Exposure, which follows the expedition of ordinary women from across the globe who face danger and overcome all obstacles in order to travel to the melting Arctic polar ice cap.

Kicking off the event at our Los Angeles Campus, current students and alums had the opportunity to watch Exposure: Risking Everything For True North before joining a conversation moderated by producer Carolyn Pfeiffer with the film‚Äôs Director Holly Morris, Producer Jill Mazursky, and Jeremy Gold, Executive Producer & President of Production Blumhouse Television.


About Exposure
As the Arctic polar ice cap melts, reaching the North Pole has become increasingly dangerous. Yet an expedition of ordinary women from the Arab world, the west strap on skis and haul heaving sledges toward true north, against all odds and polar advice.

Award-winning Filmmaker Holly Morris captures it all, from frostbite and polar bear threats to sexism and self-doubt in this intimate story of resilience, survival, and global citizenry‚Äìon what may be the last-ever expedition to the top of the world.

The film is produced by Powderkeg Studios & Blumhouse Television.


#NYFA #GreenLightWomen #ExposureDoc

Roy Lee is a film and television producer and founder of Vertigo Entertainment. Lee has an undergraduate degree from George Washington University and attended law school at American University. He earned his first producer credit from the popular horror film The Ring, and afterward, Lee went on to produce many iconic American horror films in the past two decades, including The Grudge, The Strangers, and IT.

Lee produced the beloved children's animated films The Lego Movie and How To Train Your Dragon. He executive-produced The Departed, which won three Academy Awards. Currently, Roy produces a diverse slate of popular video game adaptations, acclaimed-director-driven thrillers, television series at many major streaming services, and horror films.

His film Barbarian (2022), directed by Zach Cregger, opened to acclaim and was a successful theatrical release on the weekend of September 9, 2022, debuting as a #1 box office hit, exceeding expectations, and receiving 93% on Rotten Tomatoes.

Nicole Clemens serves in the dual role as President of Paramount Television Studios (PTVS) and Paramount+ Original Scripted Series. She joined PTVS in 2018 and added the Paramount+ position to her portfolio in 2021.
 
Clemens‚Äô primary responsibility at Paramount+ is to shepherd original series and formulate programming strategies for the streaming platform. Paramount+ projects include the global hit series Halo, The Offer, and the Star Trek franchises ‚Äì Star Trek: Strange New Worlds, Star Trek: Picard, and Star Trek: Discovery, as well as Seal Team, Evil, The Good Fight, and The Game.

Upcoming series include Grease: Rise of the Pink Ladies, Fatal Attraction, Rabbit Hole, and Criminal Minds.
 
In addition, as President of PTVS, Clemens oversees a robust slate of shows for buyers across multiple platforms, including Emmy-nominated Station Eleven for HBO Max, Reacher and Jack Ryan for Amazon Prime, American Gigolo for SHOWTIME, Defending Jacob, Shantaram, and Time Bandits for Apple TV+, and The Haunting anthology series for Netflix.
 
Before coming to Paramount, Clemens was a producer at Anonymous Content. Previously, she served as Executive Vice President and Head of Series Development for FX Networks, with a roster of original series including Atlanta, Snowfall, Better Things, You‚Äôre the Worst, Baskets, Tyrant, Mayans MC, and The Strain.
 
Clemens was a partner and Head of the Motion Picture Literary Department at ICM Partners for 16 years, preceded by tenures running Rod Holcomb Productions and as a television executive at Spelling Television.

title: Guest Speaker Series: NYFA Alum & 9-1-1 Lone Star Actor Ronen Rubinstein
description:
On July 6, we welcomed New York Film Academy alum Ronen Rubinstein at the Los Angeles campus for a Q&A. Rubinstein currently stars in Ryan Murphy‚Äôs 9-1-1: Lone Star which follows a New York firefighter, Owen Strand (Rob Lowe), who relocates to Austin, Texas with his son T.K. Strand (Rubinstein), where he works to save people‚Äôs lives while trying to solve his own personal problems. Rubinstein stars as T.K., an openly gay fireman and recovering addict who works equally as hard in his job, his relationship with his father, and his relationship with his life partner, Carlos Reyes (Rafael Silva).

The evening started off with a screening of an emotional and action-packed episode from 9-1-1: Lone Star. During the event, hosted by the Creative Director of the Acting Department at NYFA Los Angeles, Lynda Goodfriend, Rubinstein spoke to NYFA students about his role in the series, the brutal emotional scenes, the intense physical work on the show, and learning the technicalities of playing a paramedic. 

Read all about this magical night with Ronen at #NYFALA at the following link: https://bit.ly/3QU5pHk

title: The 20/20 Series with Paige Morrow Kimball
description:
In May 2022, we welcomed award-winning writer, director, and producer Paige Morrow Kimball as part of The 20/20 Series, created by NYFA‚Äôs Creative Director of Filmmaking and Cinematography, Liz Hinlein.

Paige Morrow Kimball began her career producing and directing music videos, documentaries, unscripted television, and later established herself as an actor and director of scripted films and television. 

She has directed over a dozen films for HBO‚Äôs iconic, Sesame Street. Her highly acclaimed social justice short film, Play Date, won seven festival awards and was distributed by Amazon Prime. Her comedy short, Ending Up, is currently on ROKU‚Äôs ZTV and was a ShortsHD Movie of the Week. 

She Co-Ep‚Äôd and directed the comedy web series, Exiled Out East and her newest film, Powers, which she shot on an iPhone and also edited, is premiering at the Oscar Qualifying Cleveland International Film Festival in 2022. 

Paige‚Äôs extensive credits in unscripted TV include Project Greenlight, The Oprah Winfrey Show, 16 Days of Glory, and many more. Her feature film, Late Bloomers garnered multiple script awards and is in late development. Paige was selected for four studio directing programs: CBS TV, SONY TV, WEFORSHE, DGAs DDI, and she shadowed many veteran TV directors. 

As an actress, Paige appeared in numerous films and TV shows, and she spearheaded @BestDirectHER - a grassroots movement that amplifies women directors for the awards they richly deserve. She is a member of the DGA, SAG-AFTRA, and holds a BFA from NYU Film School. She lives with her husband and two daughters in Los Angeles.

#NYFA #The2020Series #PaigeMorrowKimball 

The 20/20 Series is a pop-up event that takes us into the homes, hubs, and workspaces of an array of dynamic creative visionaries to allow for relaxed, engaging conversations on craft, creation, and artistic vision.
