About Anything's Possible

The modern and entertaining coming-of-age story follows Kelsa (Eva Reign), a trans high school senior. After Khal (Abubakr Ali) posts online about his school crush, the internet encourages him to go for it. Anything‚Äôs Possible tells the story of Kelsa and Khal navigating a senior-year relationship that neither could have expected. Renee Elise Goldsberry, Courtnee Carter, Kelly Lamor Wilson and Grant Reynolds also star.

It‚Äôs a really sweet movie that finds a way to be both light and meaningful at the same time. It accurately showcases the world we live in today with the feel of a classic, coming-of-age romantic comedy.

You can watch Anything's Possible's trailer here: https://youtu.be/20WlagB4vFU

About Billy Porter

Billy Porter is an award-winning actor, singer, director, composer, and playwright. He won the Emmy Award for Lead Actor for his appearance in FX‚Äôs drama Pose, and most recently received his third Emmy nomination for this role. A Hollywood Walk of Fame inductee, Porter has numerous theatre credits, including the role of ‚ÄúLola‚Äù in the Broadway musical Kinky Boots, which he originated in 2013 and for which he won the Tony, Drama Desk, and Outer Critics Circle awards, as well as the Grammy for best musical theatre album. He just won his second Tony Award in 2022 for ‚ÄúBest Musical‚Äù as a producer on A Strange Loop.

Recently, Porter appeared in the third season of FX‚Äôs Pose, Amazon‚Äôs Cinderella remake as the Fab G, alongside Camila Cabello and Idina Menzel. Porter also recently appeared in the Paramount Players comedy Like a Boss, alongside Tiffany Haddish, Rose Byrne and Salma Hayek, Baz Luhrman‚Äôs The Get Down, and under the direction of Barry Levinson, Porter starred in The Humbling, alongside Al Pacino and Greta Gerwig. He just finished the second season of CBS All Access‚Äô The Twilight Zone, Ryan Murphy‚Äôs American Horror Story: Apocalypse, and narrated HBO Max‚Äôs Equal. Porter can currently be heard in Disney+'s animated series, The Proud Family: Louder and Prouder.

Upcoming, he will star in Our Son alongside Luke Evans and direct a teen comedy from Gabrielle Union‚Äôs company To Be Real, as well as an episode of Fox‚Äôs anthology series Accused.

His directorial debut Anything‚Äôs Possible, a coming-of-age film, written by Ximena Garc√≠a Lecuona, was released on July 22 on Amazon Prime Video.

Porter released his first literary project, Unprotected, in October 2021, which was published by Abrams Press. As a recording artist, Porter most recently released his single ‚ÄúChildren‚Äù under his new record deal with Island Records (UK) and Republic Records (US).

Porter is also a graduate of The Professional Program in Screenwriting at UCLA and is an adjunct professor at his alma mater Carnegie Mellon University‚Äôs School Of Drama, where he has directed productions of Company and Letters From ‚ÄòNam. Additionally, Porter has received an honorary doctorate from Washington & Jefferson College.

title: The 20/20 Series with Isaac Bolden
description:
In March 2021, we welcomed Executive Producer Isaac Bolden as part of The 20/20 Series, created by NYFA‚Äôs Creative Director of Filmmaking and Cinematography, Liz Hinlein.

Isaac Bolden is an executive producer with a distinguished array of work from white-collar crime to high fashion, storm chasing, full (tattooed) sleeves, death row to the friendly skies.

Bolden‚Äôs 1998 short film, Final Act, Executive Produced by Danny Glover, tackled the final thoughts of a man on death row and enjoyed a successful run on IFC. In the early 2000s, he began work with Granada New York, and helped create/produce what is now cable‚Äôs longest-running series, The First 48 (A&E), a follow-doc with police from multiple cities as they attempt to solve local homicides. He produced Emmy-nominated documentaries for A&E‚Äôs franchise Investigative Reports with Bill Kurtis: Anatomy of 9/11, Portrait of A Terrorist: The Muhammad Atta Story, Room Raiders (MTV), and Airline (A&E), which granted exclusive access to Southwest Airline‚Äôs operations.

In 2005, Bolden was tapped by Charlie Corwin and Clara Markowicz‚Äôs Original Media, known for its widely nominated independent films (The Squid and The Whale, Half Nelson) to produce for the newly formed small screen unit of its production house. Original Media specialized in subculture talent-driven docu-series and Bolden produced: Miami Ink, LA Ink (TLC), Storm Chasers (Discovery), The Rachel Zoe Project (Bravo), and Johnny (Weir) Be Good (Sundance).

By 2013, Bolden began work with Alex Gibney‚Äôs Jigsaw Productions, bringing his journalistic provocative storytelling style to television, producing: Death Row Stories (CNN); Dirty Money (Netflix), The New Yorker Presents (Amazon), Cooked, and Salt Fat Acid & Heat (Netflix), and Hip Hop: The Songs that Shock America (AMC), a six-part series, in partnership with Executive Producers Black Thought and Questlove of The Roots and Shawn Gee.

Bolden‚Äôs most recent Jigsaw work in 2019 include Why We Hate (Discovery), and The Innocence Files (Netflix), with Executive Producers Alex Gibney, Liz Garbus, and Roger Ross Williams; each group working with the team(s) at The Innocence Project creating nine films in the form of three documentaries to expose (in)justice through wrongful: prosecution, witness identity and tainted evidence.

title: NYFA Guest Speaker Series: Women Behind the Lens
description:
As part of 2022 Women's History Month, we invited some of NYFA‚Äôs own trailblazers to share their experiences and successes in the film industry. 

Moderated by Director of Photography and NYFA professor Claudia Raschke, the panel showcased a collection of women cinematographers from across the industry. The invited guests included Martina Radwan, Shana Hagan, ASC, and Nancy Schreiber, ASC - all who shared their experience working in this field as well as advice for those looking to break into it professionally or simply gain more insight on what it takes to succeed at such an advanced level.

Claudia Raschke was born in one of the largest European ports near the Baltic Sea in Northern Germany. Throughout her childhood, the chain of movie theaters owned by her mother brought Claudia into the world of film. After college, Claudia studied the art and technique of cinematography on a practical level while working with some of the most prominent and accomplished international filmmakers. She is a founding member of the NYC Kamera Kollektiv, a boutique agency for documentary cinematographers, and a member of AMPAS.

Among her many notable award-winning films are: Oscar-nominated and Emmy-winning RBG (Magnolia/ Participant/ CNN), Oscar short-listed JULIA (CNN / Imagine Entertainment/ Sony Classic), Critics Choice nominated FAUCI (NAT GEO/ Magnolia/ Disney+), NAACP Image Award-nominated MY NAME IS PAULI MURRAY (Amazon Studios/Participant Media), Oscar short-listed and Emmy winning BOYS STATE (A24), Oscar-nominated GOD IS THE BIGGER ELVIS (HBO), Oscar short-listed MAD HOT BALLROOM (Paramount), PARTICLE FEVER (Bond 360), THE FREEDOM TO MARRY (Argot Pictures). Her latest documentary series work titled LAND OF THE GIANTS (CNN Films /Vox Media) will air in the Spring of 2022 on CNN Plus.



#NYFA #WomenHistoryMonth #Cinematography #PanelDiscussion

title: NYFA Photo Guest Speaker Series: Kieran Dodds
description:
New York Film Academy (NYFA) welcomed Photographer Kieran Dodds for a special guest lecture and Q&A as part of NYFA's Photo Guest Speaker Series.

Kieran Dodds is a non-fiction photographer known for his research-driven photo stories and portraiture recently seen in two books; Gingers (2020), and The Church Forests of Ethiopia (2021).

His personal work considers the interplay of environment and culture, tracing global events through daily lives. He trained at The Herald newspaper group in Glasgow before embarking on a career as an independent photographer. He is a regular contributor to The New York Times and is a member of Panos Pictures, London.

Kieran‚Äôs work has been awarded by World Press Photo and Sony World Photography Awards and he is also a Winston Churchill Travel Fellow. He lives in Scotland with his wife and twin daughters.

Learn more about the Photo Arts Conservatory at NYFA here: https://www.nyfa.edu/photography-school/


#KieranDodds #NYFA #Photography

title: The 20/20 Series with Anka Malatynska
description:
In June 2021, we welcomed again Award-Winning Cinematographer Anka Malatynska as part of The 20/20 Series, created by NYFA‚Äôs Creative Director of Filmmaking and Cinematography, Liz Hinlein.

The accolades for Anka Malatynska continue to pour in as she is included in Variety‚Äôs prestigious 10 Cinematographers to Watch list for 2020. Already named as one of the ‚Äú10 Rising Stars of Cinematography 2019‚Äù in American Cinematographer Magazine, Anka has been in the spotlight with the October 2020 premiere of Hulu‚Äôs new anthology horror series Monsterland. This year she completed photography on two series thus far: Amazon Studios/Sony Pictures Television series I Know What You Did Last Summer, which will stream worldwide exclusively on Amazon Prime Video as well as OWN‚Äôs Delilah, for which she has been submitted for an Emmy in Cinematography by The OWN Network. Anka‚Äôs most recent feature film Breaking Fast premiered at Cinequest in early 2020 and has been screening throughout the year on the virtual film festival circuit internationally. In 2019 Anka collaborated with director Gabriella Tolman on the short film Lovely, which was awarded Best Cinematography at the Under The Stars International Film Festival in Bari, Italy.

Her previous credits as cinematographer, 2nd unit DP and camera operator have ranged from Claire Niederpruem‚Äôs intimate 2018 adaptation of Little Women to National Geographic's Most Amazing Photos television series, Walden Media's Dear Dumb Diary to Showtime‚Äôs I‚Äôm Dying Up Here, Firestarter Films‚Äô Akicita: The Battle of Standing Roc and season 3 of HBO's Insecure. Anka‚Äôs collaborators have included Rose McGowan, Kristin Hanggi, Tim Hunter, Michael Gondrey, Issa Rae, James Chressanthis ASC and many more.

title: The 20/20 Series with Patrick Capone
description:
In February 2022, we welcomed Award-Winning Director of Photography Patrick Capone as part of The 20/20 Series, created by NYFA‚Äôs Creative Director of Filmmaking and Cinematography, Liz Hinlein.

Patrick Capone began his career as a first and second-unit cameraman on feature films. Throughout the years he made the transition to Camera Operator for such movies as The Mirror has Two Faces, Zoolander, The Producers, Analyze This, Analyze That, Kinsey, The Pink Panther, and Shine a Light. 

He spent the last several years as Second Unit Director of Photography on such films as Ghostbusters, American Hustle, August: Osage County, Alpha House, After Earth, Wall Street 2, It‚Äôs Complicated, The Last Airbender, 30 Minutes or Less, Doubt, Away We Go, Extremely Loud & Incredibly Close, Last Night, Paul Blart: Mall Cop, Nick and Norah‚Äôs Infinite Playlist, The Happening, Untraceable, Made of Honor, My Sassy Girl, Tenderness, Hide and Seek, Lady in the Water, The Village, and Signs.
Patrick provided additional Photography on the films The Big Short, Jimmy Carter: Man from Plains, Analyze That, Revolutionary Road, The Brave One, Perfect Murder, and Miss Congeniality.
Steaming television has also provided a platform for Patrick‚Äôs cinematography. Among them is Gary Trudeau‚Äôs Alpha House for Amazon, and Little Voices for Apple. HBO‚Äôs Succession landed Patrick a home to combine all aspects of his cinematography and storytelling.
Patrick received an Emmy for ‚ÄúOutstanding Technical Direction, Camerawork, Video Control for a Special‚Äù on Disney+‚Äôs Hamilton. Winning several awards for Cinematography including ‚ÄúBest Film‚Äù at Slam Dunk Festival, Cine awards, and Kodak Emerging Cinematography Award for Born Loser.

title: NYFA Photo Guest Speaker Series: The Importance of Publishing your work
description:
The importance of publishing your work can't be understated. Getting your work out there for the world to see is a hugely gratifying feeling.¬†But it's not just about getting your work seen. Publishing your work can also be a great way to connect with other artists and create a community around your work. It can help you improve as an artist, push you to create even better work in the future, and inspire others to create their own art. 

On this online Q&A, photographer and NYFA Los Angeles Instructor Nikk Rich moderates a chat with #NYFA Photography Alumni Jon Henry, Mariangela Quiroga Cantillo and Rutvik Katuri, and Float Photo Magazine Co-founder and Photographer Dana Stirling to discuss the value of publishing photography work in books, magazines as well as digital placement.

title: The 20/20 Series with Tara Miele
description:
In November 2021, we welcomed Feature/TV Director Tara Miele as part of The 20/20 Series, created by NYFA‚Äôs Creative Director of Filmmaking and Cinematography, Liz Hinlein.

Tara Miele is a filmmaker originally from Long Island. Her latest film, Wander Darkly, starring Sienna Miller and Diego Luna, premiered in competition at the 2020 Sundance Film Festival and was distributed by Lionsgate. Tara is currently attached to write and direct a Carol Burnett bio-pic, which is being produced by Tina Fey for Apple.

Tara is also well known for her 2016 viral video, ‚ÄúMeet a Muslim,‚Äù which she created to combat Islamophobia and which has over 40 million views. She has helmed episodes of Hawaii Five-0, Arrow, Batwoman, the pilot for Green Arrow and the Canaries, as well as four micro-budget features. She is a graduate of Ryan Murphy‚Äôs Half Initiative and the CBS Directing Initiative. Looking forward, Tara aims to create more socially conscious work and when she isn‚Äôt doing that, she‚Äôs busy raising two daughters. Both love that their mom went viral.

title: NYFA Guest Speaker Series with  Oscar-Nominated Team Behind the Short 'Please Hold'
description:
New York Film Academy hosted a live video Q&A with Oscar-Nominated Short Film "Please Hold" Writer/Director K.D. D√°vila and Writer/Producer Levin Menekse. This live virtual event was hosted by the Director of NYFA's Film Festival Department, Crickett Rumley.


Crickett spoke with D√°vila and Menekse about the making of their sci-fi satire, their world premiere at the Austin Fantastic Film Festival, screenings at Palm Springs International Shortfest and Indy Shorts, and their Oscar qualification following a Grand Jury Award at the Florida Film Festival. 


"Please Hold," tells the story of a young man who is wrongfully arrested due to a computer error. Realizing he has no means of recourse in the fully automated, fully privatized justice system, he attempts to reach a human being who can set things right.


K.D. D√°vila is a Mexican-American screenwriter. A Universal Pictures Emerging Writers Fellow and Film Independent Project Involve Fellow, D√°vila has won awards for her past works at SXSW and Sundance Film Festival. 


Levin Menekse, co-producer of "Please Hold," is a freelance story consultant by trade and was awarded the Annenberg Fellowship from USC's School of Cinematic Arts.


#NYFA #PleaseHold #CrickettRumley #NYFAQA

title: The 20/20 Series with Harry Yoon
description:
In September 2021, we welcomed Award-winning Editor Harry Yoon as part of The 20/20 Series, created by NYFA‚Äôs Creative Director of Filmmaking and Cinematography, Liz Hinlein.

Harry Yoon is a Korean-American editor based in Los Angeles. His most recent film, Destin Daniel Cretton‚Äôs Shang-Chi and the Legend of the Ten Rings, was released by Marvel and Disney on September 3rd. Yoon edited the critically acclaimed Academy and Golden Globe Award-winning feature, Minari, for director Lee Isaac Chung, Plan B Entertainment, and A24. Yoon‚Äôs work earned him both ACE Eddie and Satellite Award nominations. Yoon worked on the first season of HBO and A24‚Äôs ground-breaking drama, Euphoria, created by Sam Levinson. He also collaborated with Plan B and A24 as an additional editor on The Last Black Man in San Francisco directed by Joe Talbot, which premiered at Sundance. Yoon co-edited Detroit, Kathryn Bigelow‚Äôs feature film about a true-crime incident that occurred during the 1967 Detroit riots.

He met Kathryn and his co-editor Billy Goldenberg while serving as the VFX Editor on Bigelow‚Äôs Zero Dark Thirty. Yoon edited the historical drama, The Best of Enemies, written and directed by Robin Bissell, starring Sam Rockwell and Taraji P. Henson. He also worked as an additional editor on Universal Pictures‚Äô First Man directed by Damien Chazelle. Yoon‚Äôs previous credits include HBO's The Newsroom and several feature films that premiered at the Sundance Film Festival including Drunktown's Finest directed by Sydney Freeland, and Half-Life directed by Jennifer Phang. His credits as a VFX Editor and Assistant Editor include The Revenant, The Hunger Games, Footloose, The Crazies, and Lords of Dogtown.

New York Film Academy alum and Grand Jury Prize Sundance 2021 Winner Akinola Davies Jr. presents his award-winning film Lizard to his alma mater. 

Lizard follows an eight-year-old girl, Juwon, who has the ability to sense danger. After getting ejected from a Sunday school service, Juwon witnesses the underbelly in and around a Mega Church in Lagos, Nigeria.

NYFA's Chair of Short-term Programs, Jonathan Whittaker, hosted the online event and invited a panel of current students to discuss the film's visual strategy and its key technical aspects.

title: NYFA's Q&A-List with Tova Laiter: Preparing Your Script for Netflix with Michael Schulman
description:
New York Film Academy had the honor of hosting a live video Q&A with Script Consultant Michael Schulman. Tova Laiter, Director of the NYFA Q&A-List Series, moderated the event and discussed with Schulman how you should approach writing a script for Netflix.

Until recently, Michael Schulman has been working as a script consultant/acquisitions for Netflix in the Original Independent Film (OIF) division. Michael has presented several well-received webinars on the screenplay development and acquisition process at Netflix, and he has been interviewed and frequently quoted in the industry media about the future of screenwriting and filmmaking in the streamer age!

Michael began his career at the William Morris Agency as an agent trainee and assistant to the worldwide head-of-talent where he worked with top actors including Richard Gere, Mel Gibson, Nicolas Cage, Denzel Washington, Michelle Pfeiffer, and Nicole Kidman. After a move to ICM and upon promotion to agent in the motion picture literary department, Michael began representing emerging screenwriters, directors, and producers, brokering the deal for Danny Rubin‚Äôs screenplay GROUNDHOG DAY to director Harold Ramis.

Michael ultimately switched from the agency world to the buyer side as VP of Development for Alec Baldwin‚Äôs company at Orion Pictures and subsequently for Dennis Quaid‚Äôs company at TriStar. Michael later served a stint at Barry Mendel Productions on the Disney lot where he was involved with the acquisition, development and production of RUSHMORE, THE SIXTH SENSE, and MUNICH. Michael spent two years as head of development for Michael Mann‚Äôs company where he worked on ALI, THE AVIATOR, and TEXAS KILLING FIELDS .

Read more about this event at the following link: https://www.nyfa.edu/nyfa-news/nyfa-welcomes-script-consultant-michael-shulman.php#.Yo6WFZPMJTb

title: The 20/20 Series with Kimberly Huie
description:
In May 2022, we had the pleasure of welcoming Award-winning Actor Kimberly Huie as part of The 20/20 Series, created by NYFA‚Äôs Creative Director of Filmmaking and Cinematography, Liz Hinlein.

Kimberly Huie is an award-winning actor, writer, and producer. She has an extensive list of film and television credits from Canada and the US. Some credit highlights include Good Sam, SELF MADE: Inspired by the life of Madam CJ Walker, Grey‚Äôs Anatomy, Rookie Blue, CSI Miami, and Andromeda. She is currently recurring as Grace on the nighttime drama The Kings of Napa on OWNtv.

Kimberly is a graduate of the Second City Toronto Improvisation program and has trained at Circle in the Square Theatre School and the Atlantic Acting School in New York City. Kimberly is a versatile and accomplished storyteller; a love of language and laughter inspired her short film, The Intervention. It has been shown in film festivals across North America and the Caribbean and received multiple awards.

Born in Jamaica and raised in Canada, Kimberly Huie came of age in France. She speaks both French and English fluently and divides her time between Toronto and New York.

description:
New York Film Academy had the honor of hosting a live video Q&A with "Station 11," "Maniac" & "The Leftovers" writer Patrick Somerville.

Tova Laiter, Director of the NYFA Q&A-List Series, moderated the event and discussed with Somerville the writer's room, the importance of having a voice in Hollywood, and bad drafts.

Patrick Somerville is a novelist and screenwriter who currently has an overall deal with Paramount Television. He most recently created, showran, wrote and executive produced Station 11, which debuted to rave reviews. The series has been nominated for a Peabody Entertainment Award and his work received a USC Scripter nomination. Somerville previously created, wrote, and executive produced the critically acclaimed Maniac, starring Emma Stone and Jonah Hill. Somerville‚Äôs work on ‚ÄúManiac‚Äù received two nominations for both the WGA and PGA Awards. He also served as writer/producer on the HBO drama "The Leftovers" starring Justin Theroux and got his start in television writing on the FX drama "The Bridge" and FOX‚Äôs "24: Live Another Day."


Somerville's books include two collections of stories, Trouble (2006) and The Universe in Miniature in Miniature (2010), and two novels, The Cradle (2009) and This Bright River (2012). "The Cradle" was nominated for the Center for Fiction‚Äôs First Novel Award. It was also a Barnes & Noble Discover Great New Writers pick for Spring 2009, a Target Emerging Writers Pick, and a New York Times Editor‚Äôs Choice. "This Bright River" was a New York Times Editor‚Äôs Choice as well, and The Universe in Miniature in Miniature was short-listed for the 2010 Story Prize.


Somerville's writing has also appeared in The New York Times, GQ, Esquire, and more. He is a MacDowell Fellow and the winner of the 2009 21st Century Award, given annually by the Chicago Public Library. 


He grew up in Green Bay, Wisconsin, went to college at the University of Wisconsin-Madison, and later earned his MFA from Cornell University. He currently resides in Los Angeles with his wife and three kids.

title: The 20/20 Series with Dan Attias
description:
In May 2022, we had the pleasure of welcoming Award-winning Director Dan Attias as part of The 20/20 Series, created by NYFA‚Äôs Creative Director of Filmmaking and Cinematography, Liz Hinlein.

Attias is the author of ‚ÄòDirecting Great Television: Inside TV‚Äôs New Golden Age‚Äô and has worked as a director in the film and television industry since 1984. As a director of series television, he has received the Directors Guild of America Award for Outstanding Direction of Dramatic Television for The Wire and has been nominated for episodes of The Sopranos, Six Feet Under, Homeland, and The Marvelous Mrs. Maisel. 

He has received Emmy Award nominations for his comedy direction on Entourage and continues to work on some of the most celebrated American television shows. His recent credits include The Americans, Billions, and The Boys. Dan started his career by studying acting, then worked as an assistant director on E.T. the Extra-Terrestrial, Airplane!, One From the Heart, and several other feature films. 

He has taught acting and directing workshops in the United States and has conducted master classes in Italy, Greece, Brazil, Mexico, and Canada. He has also mentored many young directors, several of whom have gone on to successful careers in television.

title: NYFA Photo Guest Speaker Series: Jason Florio
description:
New York Film Academy (NYFA) welcomed Photojournalist & Filmmaker Jason Florio for a special guest lecture and Q&A as part of NYFA's Photo Guest Speaker Series.

Jason Florio is an award-winning photojournalist and filmmaker, originally from London, based in NYC for 18 years before relocating to The Gambia, West Africa, in 2013. He has produced images and documentaries for clients including The New York Times, Smithsonian, The New Yorker, Outside, Bloomberg, Geographical, MIT Technology Review, and Amnesty International. His focus has been on under-reported stories about people living on the margins of society and human rights. His work has been recognized with a number of awards, including The Magnum Photography Award for his work on migration. His work is held in a number of public and private collections and has been presented in solo and joint exhibitions in the USA, Europe, Asia, and Africa. Jason is represented by Redux Pictures in NYC.

Learn more about the Photo Arts Conservatory at NYFA here: https://www.nyfa.edu/photography-school/

title: The 20/20 Series with Rachel Harms
description:
In February 2022, we had the pleasure of welcoming Emmy Award-Winning Director Rachel Harms as part of The 20/20 Series, created by NYFA‚Äôs Creative Director of Filmmaking and Cinematography, Liz Hinlein.

Nuanced performances characterize the work of Rachel Harms. Her reputation for authentic vignettes and her extraordinary communication skills with adult and child actors have enhanced her international profile and placed her in demand for spot work worldwide.

A four-time Emmy Award winner for her original Sesame Street films, Rachel brings the same soulful, humanistic storytelling to her work as a commercial director. Whether the content is serious, quirky, or whimsical, she finds the heart of the matter and delivers it to the screen, creating acclaimed campaigns for Wells Fargo, ExxonMobil, Tide, Johnson & Johnson, Nestle, and Quaker Oats, among many others. Her timeless Folgers spot, ‚ÄúA Dancer's Morning" is considered to be one of the brand‚Äôs most successful spots in P&G history.

New York Film Academy (NYFA) welcomed Photographer Evgenia Arbugaeva for a special guest lecture and Q&A as part of NYFA's Photo Guest Speaker Series.

Evgenia Arbugaeva was born in 1985 in the town of Tiksi, located on the shore of the Laptev Sea. In her personal work, she often looks into her homeland - the Arctic, discovering and capturing the remote worlds and people who inhabit them.

Evgenia is a National Geographic Society Storytelling Fellow, a recipient of the ICP Infinity Award and the Leica Oskar Barnack Award. Her work has been exhibited internationally and appeared in publications such as National Geographic, Time Magazine, and The New Yorker, among others. She lives in London, UK.

title: NYFA Alum Spotlight: Zane Jones
description:
NYFA alum Zane Jones, born and raised in Columbia, SC,  discusses the origins of his passion for storytelling, his time in the Marines, and his move to LA to study Acting for Film at New York Film Academy Los Angeles. 

Jones is known for his recent work as the executive producer on the short film The Girl in Apartment 15 (2020). The short won the 2021 Daytime Emmy for ‚ÄòOutstanding Short Form Daytime Fiction Program.‚Äô

Learn more about Emmy Award-winning Executive Producer, Acting for Film Alum & US Veteran Zane Jones at the following link: https://www.nyfa.edu/nyfa-news/alumni/zane-jones/

title: NYFA Welcomes Paramount Television Studios Liz Miller & Madeleine Nimoy - Presented by Adam Nimoy
description:
New York Film Academy (NYFA) had the honor of hosting a live video Q&A with Liz Miller and Madeleine Nimoy of Paramount Television Studios to discuss the art of production with NYFA students and alumni. NYFA instructor Adam Nimoy curated and moderated the event, where Liz and Maddy gave us an inside look at the production process and how it all begins with an idea.

title: The 20/20 Series with Andy Wolk
description:
In December 2021, we had the pleasure of welcoming Award-Winning Writer/Director Andy Wolk as part of The 20/20 Series, created by NYFA‚Äôs Creative Director of Filmmaking and Cinematography, Liz Hinlein.

Andy Wolk‚Äôs film writing and directing career began with the much-lauded HBO movie Criminal Justice that made Time Magazine‚Äôs ‚ÄúTen Best‚Äù List. Starring Forest Whitaker, Anthony LaPaglia, and Rosie Perez. Criminal Justice received the Silver Prize at FIPA in Cannes and was named Best Cable Movie of the year. Whitaker, LaPaglia, and Perez were all nominated for acting awards and Mr. Wolk was nominated for the Writer‚Äôs Guide Award. He received the Writer‚Äôs Guide Award for writing Natica Jackson on PBS which starred Michelle Pfeiffer.

The 20/20 Series is a pop-up event that takes us into the homes, hubs, and workspaces of an array of dynamic creative visionaries to allow for relaxed, engaging conversations on craft, creation, and artistic vision. title: The 20/20 Series with Sara Goodman
description:
In October 2021, we had the pleasure of welcoming Showrunner Sara Goodman as part of The 20/20 Series, created by NYFA‚Äôs Creative Director of Filmmaking and Cinematography, Liz Hinlein.

Sara Goodman is the writer, creator, executive producer, and showrunner of the Amazon Prime Video original series, I Know What You Did Last Summer, which is based on the 1973 iconic film of the same name. Goodman is currently under an overall deal at Sony Entertainment Television, where she is developing a new iteration of the 1999 film Cruel Intentions as a series for IMDb TV. She will serve as both co-writer and co-executive producer with Phoebe Fisher (Assassination Nation).

description:

Sollinger is the producer of more than 400 commercials, music videos, and short films for clients including Pepsi, Warner Brothers Records, CBS, Sony, and Comedy Central and working with such artists as Will Smith, LL Cool J, and A Tribe Called Quest, Daniel has produced documentaries such at Rhyme & Reason and Immortality or Bust which he also directed. He has over 50 narrative feature film credits including, Clean, Girls Against Boys, L.A. Slasher, Ktown Cowboys, and Dark Summer. He is also a member of the Producer's Guild of America and the Director‚Äôs Guild of America.

title: NYFA Grad Amy Wright's Documentary wins Best Short Award at White House
description:
Former New York Film Academy Documentary student Amy Wright talks about her thesis film, Legacy, which was recognized and awarded Best Short by the March on Washington Film Festival, held at the White House in 2016. 

"Legacy" takes a glimpse into the lives of the men and women who comprise The Federation of Black Cowboys. From trail riding in Virginia to giving riding lessons to kids back in Brooklyn, The Federation ensures that the legacy of America's forgotten black cowboys will live on for generations to come.

This video was directed by NYFA Alumni Braulio Jatar and Anais Michel.

title: Virtual Masters of Game Design with Celia Hodent
description:
In February 2021, Game Designer and NYFA instructor Scott Rogers (God of War, Darksiders, Pac-Man World) hosted an evening of conversation and networking with Game UX leader, Celia Hodent. 

Celia was a UX lead on Fortnite, Assassins Creed, Star Wars 1313, Far Cry, Watch Dogs, and many other titles. She is the author of The Gamer's Brain and The Psychology of Video Games.

Learn more about NYFA's Game Design School here: https://www.nyfa.edu/game-design-school/

title: The 20/20 Series with Shane Hurlbut
description:
Last June, we had the pleasure of welcoming Director of Photography Shane Hurlbut as part of The 20/20 Series, created by NYFA‚Äôs Creative Director of Filmmaking and Cinematography, Liz Hinlein.

Director of Photography Shane Hurlbut, ASC works at the forefront of cinema as a storyteller, innovator, and discerning collaborator, bringing more than three decades of experience to his art.

Most recently, Hurlbut worked on Disney+ original film "Safety."  In addition, he lensed "Holidate" for Netflix, starring Emma Roberts and Luke Bracey, and the pilot episode for SyFy‚Äôs Resident Alien, starring Alan Tudyk.

description:

Manuel has a long list of incredible credits in both Hollywood and Mexican cinema and TV. Acting alongside Hollywood‚Äôs biggest names, including Tom Hanks, Denzel Washington, Chris Pratt, Ethan Hawke, Kenneth Branagh, Pen√©lope Cruz, and Willem Dafoe, Manuel shared his story and journey to becoming the famed actor he is today.

description:
In March 2021, we had the pleasure of welcoming NYFA Cinematography instructor and Director of Photography Tommy Maddox-Upshaw, ASC as part of The 20/20 Series, created by NYFA‚Äôs Creative Director of Filmmaking and Cinematography, Liz Hinlein.

Tommy Maddox-Upshaw is currently lensing the sixth season of Fox‚Äôs hit series "Empire" for creators Lee Daniels and Danny Strong. He recently wrapped shooting the third season of FX‚Äôs "Snowfall," chronicling the crack cocaine epidemic in 1980s Los Angeles. Previously, Maddox-Upshaw shot the second season of Netflix‚Äôs breakout hit "On My Block" and the first season of "Huge" in France, also for Netflix.

description:
New York Film Academy recently welcomed filmmaker, and director of box-office hits like The LEGO Batman Movie (2017) and Tomorrow War (2021), Chris McKay. Tova Laiter, Director of the NYFA Q&A-List Series, curated and moderated the event alongside Guest Moderator, Craig Caton-Largent.

Guest Chris McKay is an award-winning filmmaker with a specialty in animation, although he has performed almost every function of filmmaking, including producer. He produced The Lego Ninjago Movie (2017), starring Justin Theroux, Dave Franco, and Jackie Chan. description:
In March 2021, we had the pleasure of welcoming The Founder of Emmanuel Bates Communications, Meredith Emmanuel, as part of The 20/20 Series, created by NYFA‚Äôs Creative Director of Filmmaking and Cinematography, Liz Hinlein.

Emmanuel has more than 40 years of experience in film, television, radio, music, and media; and has built an impressive network of valuable relationships. Focusing on behind-the-camera public relations, she has successfully executed numerous client award campaigns for the Academy Awards, Creative Arts Emmys, and guild-specific awards. In addition, she has helped grow the careers of creative artists‚Äô by highlighting their achievements on film and television projects and expanding their individual networks.

Read more about this event here: https://www.nyfa.edu/nyfa-news/nyfa-welcomes-meredith-emmanuel-to-the-2020-series.php#.YW2y3RDMLzd

title: The 20/20 Series with Screenwriter Tom Schlesinger
description:
In March 2021, we had the pleasure of welcoming Screenwriter Tom Schlesinger as part of The 20/20 Series, created by NYFA‚Äôs Creative Director of Filmmaking and Cinematography, Liz Hinlein.

Schlesinger is what some in the writer‚Äôs room call a story architect, someone who works with the creative team to help visualize what the film could be when it‚Äôs finished. An intuitive role, Schlesinger explained this role is important for when the script is being developed or the film is being shot. Read more about this online event here: https://www.nyfa.edu/nyfa-news/nyfa-welcomes-tom-schlesinger-to-online-2020-series.php#.YWoH_hDMLzf

title: Virtual Masters of Game Design with Geoff Engelstein
description:
In December 2020, Game Designer and NYFA instructor Scott Rogers (God of War, Darksiders, Pac-Man World) hosted an evening of conversation and networking with Master of Game Design, Geoff Engelstein.
 
Geoff is an award-winning tabletop game designer, whose titles include Space Cadets, The Fog of War, Pit Crew, and The Expanse. He is also a noted podcaster. Since 2007 he has been a contributor to the Dice Tower, the leading table-top game podcast, with a series on the math, science, and psychology of games. He has also hosted Ludology a weekly podcast on game design since 2011, and recently published GameTek, a collection of essays on Game Design.

title: The 20/20 Series with Evercoast's Ben Nunez and Sebastian Marino
description:
In February 2021, we had the pleasure of welcoming Evercoast's Ben Nunez and Sebastian Marino as part of The 20/20 Series, created by NYFA‚Äôs Creative Director of Filmmaking and Cinematography, Liz Hinlein.

Ben Nunez and Sebastian Marino both work at Evercoast, a volumetric capture service provider. Evercoast provides high-quality, cost-effective volumetric capture, rendering, and streaming platform, turning people into 3D holograms in full motion for both live and recorded volumetric content. Some of their clients include Verizon, Comcast, WarnerMedia, NBCU, Intel, and others.


Read more about this online event here: https://www.nyfa.edu/nyfa-news/nyfa-welcomes-evercoasts-ben-nunez-and-sebastian-marino-to-the-2020-series.php#.YV-O_hDML0q

description:
New York Film Academy recently welcomed Brooklyn-born director and producer Marcus A. Clarke. Tova Laiter, Director of the NYFA Q&A-List Series, curated and moderated the event. 

Clarke, director and executive producer of the acclaimed Netflix documentary Blood Brothers: Malcolm X & Muhammad Ali, discussed his career in filmmaking and how he landed the role of storyteller for two iconic American men. title: The 20/20 Series with Director of Photography Claudia Raschke
description:
In March 2021, we had the pleasure of welcoming Director of Photography Claudia Raschke as part of The 20/20 Series, created by NYFA‚Äôs Creative Director of Filmmaking and Cinematography, Liz Hinlein.

Claudia Raschke is an award-winning New York City-based cinematographer, whose notable award-winning films include the Oscar-nominated and Emmy award-winning documentary "RBG," the Oscar-nominated film "God is Bigger Than Elvis" (HBO), the Peabody Award-winning film "Black Magic" (ESPN), the Oscar short-listed "Mad Hot Ballroom" (Paramount), "Particle Fever" (Bond), "Atomic Homefront" (HBO), and "The Freedom to Marry" (Argot Pictures).

Her new cinematic feature documentary work includes the Sundance Film Festival selected "My Name is Pauli Murray" (Participant Media) and the 2021 premiere of "Julia" (CNN /Imagine Entertainment), as well as PBS/American Masters productions of "The Code Breaker" and "Ballerina Boys." It was also recently announced then, that Raschke was lensing the National Geographic "FAUCI" documentary about epidemiologist and famed White House COVID-19 pandemic advisor Dr. Anthony Fauci.

Read more about this online event here: https://www.nyfa.edu/nyfa-news/nyfa-welcomes-dp-claudia-raschke-to-2020-series.php#.YGJK9EhKh24

title: The 20/20 Series with Award-Winning Director & Entrepreneur Bradley Ross
description:
In January 2021, we had the pleasure of welcoming Award-Winning Director and Entrepreneur Bradley Ross as part of The 20/20 Series, created by NYFA‚Äôs Creative Director of Filmmaking and Cinematography, Liz Hinlein.

As a commercial director, Ross's work earned him multiple awards including a 2020 Telly and Clio. He spent a decade editing and producing a wide variety of content in New York City earning him multiple Emmy Nominations and Awards. Most notably, he edited and co-produced the hit documentary feature "Cartel Land," which was nominated for the Academy Award for Best Documentary in 2016. His other long-form credits include "The Kindergarten Teacher" starring Maggie Gyllenhaal, the 2017 TriBeCa Film Festival Audience Award Winner, "Here Alone," and the 2020 release of "Centigrade," now streaming on HULU.

title: Industry Q&A Panel with NYFA Alumni
description:
New York Film Academy Alumni Coordinator Aundrea Parson hosts a lively discussion with Black and African American Alumni who share their perspectives about what has helped them succeed and persevere in their professional lives after graduation from NYFA. Aundrea is joined by:

Elon Joi Washington (MFA Screenwriting) Founder of Black Film Allegiance, Former Development Manager at Jordan Peele‚Äôs Monkeypaw Productions and currently working at Warner Bros. Television Studios under Matthew A. Cherry.

Jaquece Abraham (BFA Filmmaking) A Producer who has pivoted into being a Covid Compliance Officer/Coordinator working for Gordon Ramseys' Season 11 of Master Chef and now the Foodtastic Disney+ show (hosted by Keke Palmer).

Samuel McKnight (1-Year Photography) has gone on to direct multiple music videos and started a production company called Sam McNight Films. Some notable companies Sam has worked for are Capitol Records, Warner Records, Roc Nation, and Epic Records, with artists like Mary J. Blige, Bridget Kelly, and Jeremih.

Gina Parris (MFA Acting for Film) is signed to The Brogan Agency. Her award-winning thesis film, A Twist of Life, will be shown on irietimestv.com until 2023. Her TV show, The Honest Honestest Truth aired on national TV in Trinidad and she is currently working on the docuseries Like A Dog With a Bone.

Melinda Graves (MFA Producing) is a Production Manager at MotorTrend Group in Los Angeles where she oversees numerous projects from pre-production to post. Her many working credits include Hot Wheels Life Size to Defying the Elements, where she was an Associate Producer.

title: NYFA's Twitch Rewind with Bryan Jaycox

During the live Q&A, moderated by NYFA Screenwriting instructor Dafina Roberts, they not only discussed Saracho's transition from playwriting to screenwriting, running and staffing a writers room, but also the importance of authenticity in storytelling and the art of writing diverse Latinx characters, stories and worlds from an intersectional perspective.

description:

Hinlein began the conversation by sharing a sizzle reel from RSA‚Äôs (Ridley Scott Association) projects with the audience. After showing the clips, Hinlein remarked that the reel evokes so many emotions and asked Laport to share more about her involvement with the famed RSA company. Laport remembered working at another production house and applying for a position at RSA, and not long after rising through the ranks where she eventually became promoted to her more recent title during the COVID pandemic of Executive Producer.

TEN WEEKS is a docuseries that follows a cohort of recruits over the course of ten weeks in their journey from untested, young adults into soldiers.

Pirozek shared that she normally thinks about those things early on in her writing process. The Q&A was conducted by Los Angeles Chairs of the Documentary and Producing Departments, Sanora Bartels, and Roberta (Robi) Colangelo, respectively, and the discussion focused on how to make the transition from film student to filmmaking professional and the most important aspects of a successful professional career.

title: The 20/20 Series with Film Director Pablo Berger
description:
On November 18, 2020, as part of The 20/20 Series, we welcomed Film Director Pablo Berger for a conversation with director, cinematographer, and NYFA‚Äôs Filmmaking & Cinematography Creative Director, Liz Hinlein.

Pablo Berger is one of Spain‚Äôs most acclaimed international film directors and a former instructor at NYFA. His debut feature film¬†Torremolinos 73¬†(2003) was a local box office hit and premiered at the Malaga Film Festival, winning Best Film, Best Director, Best Actor, and Best Actress.¬†Torremolinos 73¬†was nominated for four Goya Awards and received prizes in many international film festivals. His second feature,¬†Blancanieves¬†(2013), premiered at the Toronto Film Festival and won over 100 awards worldwide, including ten Goyas, the Special Jury Prize at the San Sebastian Film Festival, nominations for Best Film and Best Director at the European Film Awards, a C√©sar Awards nomination for Best Foreign Film, and selection as Spain's Oscar entry for Best Foreign Language Film.

Read more about this online event here: https://www.nyfa.edu/film-school-blog/new-york-film-academy-nyfa-welcomes-film-director-pablo-berger-for-the-20-20-series/

description:

The movie Black Bear is a meta thriller about movie-making, creativity, and ego from writer-director Lawrence Michael Levine. The film debuted earlier this year at Sundance and is certified fresh on Rotten Tomatoes. Black Bear boasts an incredible cast, featuring NYFA alum Aubrey Plaza (Ingrid Goes West, Parks & Recreation), Christopher Abbott (Catch-22, First Man), and Sarah Gadon (True Detective, Alias Grace).

Tova Laiter, Director of the NYFA Q&A-List Series, curated and moderated the event. Read all about it here: http://www.nyfa.edu/film-school-blog/new-york-film-academy-nyfa-welcomes-cast-and-director-of-meta-thriller-black-bear-for-nyfa-qa-list-series/

title: Kids Online Weekend & After-School Camps at NYFA
description:
New York Film Academy offers kids online weekend & after-school camps for storytellers between 10 and 13 years old. These programs provide an active, creative learning experience where students have the ability to interact with instructors and classmates from all around the world, from home, while also creating original work. 

Our Programs in Filmmaking, Animation & Game Design, Photography, Acting, and Musical Theatre, include live interactive instruction, group meetings, and practical, creative projects. As with our on-campus camps, classes are kept small to allow for optimal teacher-student interaction, critique, and discussion of creative work. 

For more information on NYFA's camps for kids, visit nyfa.edu/kids.

title: New York Film Academy Los Angeles Virtual Campus Tour
description:
Take the NYFA Los Angeles Virtual Tour and explore the facilities, services, classrooms, equipment, and more, that the campus has to offer. You will also take a sneak peek into the Universal Studios Backlot and the Burbank Studios including one of the sound stages that students have access to during their time at NYFA. 

Surrounded by some of the best film studios in Los Angeles ‚Äî Universal and Warner Bros. ‚Äî and located in the heart of Hollywood, NYFA Los Angeles offers hands-on graduate and undergraduate degrees, certificates, workshops and youth camps, in the film, media and performing arts. New York Film Academy is accredited by the WASC Senior College and University Commission (WSCUC), 985 Atlantic Avenue, Suite 100, Alameda, CA 94501, 510.748.9001.

To learn more, call +1 818 333 3558 or visit nyfa.edu.

title: The 20/20 Series with Mitchell Travers
description:
On September 9, 2020, as part of The 20/20 Series, we welcomed Acclaimed Costume Designer Mitchell Travers, for a conversation with director, cinematographer, and NYFA‚Äôs Filmmaking & Cinematography Creative Director, Liz Hinlein.

Mitchell Travers is an American Costume Designer, who earned his breakout for his work on A24 indie hit "Eighth Grade," which landed him a spot on Variety's Artisan's Impact Report. He was then tasked to transform Emma Thompson into a chic pantsuit-sporting Late Night TV host in Mindy Kaling's "Late Night," directed by Nisha Ganatra. His striking work on Lorene Scafaria's critically acclaimed "Hustlers" also earned him a nomination for the Costume Designer's Guild Awards in 2019.

Read more about Travers and this 20/20 Series conversation here: https://www.nyfa.edu/nyfa-news/nyfa-welcomes-costume-designer-mitchell-travers.php#.X2kPe9NKg1L

title: The 20/20 Series with William Tyler Smith
description:
On September 2, 2020, as part of The 20/20 Series, we welcomed award-winning filmmaker William Tyler Smith, for a conversation with director, cinematographer, and NYFA‚Äôs Filmmaking & Cinematography Creative Director, Liz Hinlein.

Smith, who grew up in the 70‚Äôs, recalled being inspired by films he watched growing up and credits them with helping him to become the filmmaker he is today. The NYFA instructor practically grew up in the history of cinema as we know it, getting to see classics in the theater like The Godfather or The Exorcist. Smith also cited the film Wings of Desire (Dir. Wim Wenders) as a work of art that completely changed his life and proved to be a constant source of inspiration to him behind the camera and when teaching.

Read more about the event here: https://www.nyfa.edu/nyfa-news/nyfa-welcomes-filmmaker-william-tyler-smith.php#.X2JQ9ZNKgnd

title: The 20/20 Series with Nicole Kassell & Sarah Pirozek
description:
On August 26, 2020, NYFA had the honor of welcoming award-winning directors Nicole Kassell (Watchmen, Westworld, The Leftovers, The Killing, The Americans, The Following) and Sarah Pirozek (Flora, Free Tibet, #LIKE) as part of The 20/20 Series, created by NYFA‚Äôs Creative Director of Filmmaking and Cinematography, Liz Hinlein. 

Both directors shared how important the research process is for not only their actors to understand, but for directors to grasp the characters as well, not just tweak actors‚Äô performances. As an example, Kassell explained that, for "Watchmen,"  she worked closely with Regina Hall in discussing her character‚Äôs history to elevate both the director and actor's understanding of the character.

Read more about the event here: https://www.nyfa.edu/nyfa-news/nyfa-welcomes-directors-nicole-kassell-and-sarah-pirozek-20-20-series.php#.X1fn69NKg1L

description:
On August 19, 2020, as part of The 20/20 Series, we welcomed award-winning producer Gretchen McGowan, for a conversation with director, cinematographer, and NYFA‚Äôs Filmmaking & Cinematography Creative Director, Liz Hinlein.

Gretchen McGowan is an award-winning producer and the Head of Production for Goldcrest Features in New York City where she has overseen the titles "Carol," "Mojave," "Slumber," "Restrepo," "Carrie Pilby," and "Danger, Close." 

During the live Q&A, Gretchen explained that, generally, when she receives a project she thinks about the relevance of the story in time, noting that, ‚Äúyou may have a great script for the moment, but it begs the question of, once production is finished, will the story still be well received by an audience?‚Äù

Read more about the event here: https://www.nyfa.edu/nyfa-news/nyfa-welcomes-award-winning-producer-gretchen-mcgowan.php#.X1k85dNKhTb

"The 20/20 Series" is a pop-up event, presented by New York Film Academy and created by Liz Hinlein, that takes us into the homes, hubs, and workspaces of an array of dynamic creative visionaries to allow for relaxed, engaging conversations on craft, creation, and artistic vision.

title: NYFA Filmmaking Alum Q&A: Phyllis Tam
description:
NYFA's own Phyllis Tam, who recently graduated with her MFA in Filmmaking from NYFA‚Äôs Los Angeles campus, was named a finalist in the 47th Annual Student Academy Awards for her narrative short film "Fragile Moon."

Crickett Rumley, NYFA's Director of the Film Festival Department hosted a virtual school screening of "Fragile Moon" and talked with Tam about the making of her thesis film.

"Fragile Moon" tells the story of a 60 year old Chinese immigrant named King, who was known in China as a famous Peking Opera singer before immigrating to Los Angeles and becoming a dishwasher in a Chinese restaurant. The film grapples with themes of memory, loss, and the impact of immigrating to the U.S and pursuing the American dream.

title: The 20/20 Series with Cheryl Marks
description:
On August 12, 2020, as part of The 20/20 Series, we welcomed Emmy-Nominated Celebrity Stylist, Cheryl Marks, for a conversation with director, cinematographer, and NYFA‚Äôs Filmmaking & Cinematography Creative Director, Liz Hinlein.

When asked about the difference between working on a television series and working on a scripted series, Cheryl Marks shared that it comes down to the time for preparation. ‚ÄúEvery week [for television], you may get a new script and you need to constantly prepare, whereas a movie becomes your baby and you know the script by heart and there are generally no surprises. Movies aren‚Äôt necessarily easier, but they are easier to anticipate.‚Äù

Read more about the event here:  https://www.nyfa.edu/nyfa-news/nyfa-welcomes-emmy-nominated-celebrity-stylist-cheryl-marks-for-the-2020-series.html#.X0RCZNNKg1L

title: The 20/20 Series with Marcos Siega
description:
On August 5, 2020, as part of The 20/20 Series, we welcomed Executive Producer and Director Marcos Siega for a conversation with director, cinematographer, and NYFA‚Äôs Filmmaking & Cinematography Creative Director, Liz Hinlein. The conversation was held virtually, allowing individuals to join NYFA and the special guest from all over the world.

Marcos Siega is a film, television, commercials, and music video director. He is known for directing such acclaimed television series as Dexter, True Blood, Veronica Mars, Tyrant, Blindspot, and The Following. He directed the Pilot episodes (and served as the Executive Producer/Director) of Vampire Diaries, Charlie‚Äôs Angels, The Following, The Passage, and God Friended Me. He also served as executive producer on NBC‚Äôs Outlaw, Netflix‚Äôs YOU, and, more recently, Siega directed and executive produced the pilot for CW‚Äôs Batwoman.

Read more about the event here: https://www.nyfa.edu/nyfa-news/nyfa-welcomes-executive-producer-and-director-marcos-siega-20-20-series.php#.Xz3BGJNKhTb

title: NYFA Australia & Village Roadshow Studios Discuss Film Industry Growth
description:
Following the Australian Prime Minister‚Äôs recent visit to Village Roadshow Studios backlot to announce a $400 million incentive for international studios and filmmakers, New York Film Academy Australia (‚ÄúNYFA Australia‚Äù) met with Lynne Benzie, President of Village Roadshow Studios. Together, they discussed its flow-on effects for the local film industry, the local job market and the need for Australia to produce more locally-based talent who are skillfully trained to work on-set and on productions of studio blockbuster films on Australia‚Äôs road to recovery from COVID-19.

If you are looking to learn the skills needed to be prepared for the industry boom and join the exciting and creative world of filmmaking and entertainment, visit the website to learn more: nyfa.edu.au

Special Thanks:

‚Ä¢ Lynne Benzie, President - Village Roadshow Studios (visit: villageroadshowstudios.com.au)
‚Ä¢ Josh Hale, Presenter - NYFA Australia Alum & Award-winning Writer, Director, Producer (visit: imdb.com/name/nm7019082/)

title: The 20/20 Series with Femi Odugbemi
description:
On July 22, 2020, as part of The 20/20 Series, we welcomed Renowned Nollywood Filmmaker & Producer, Femi Odugbemi, and NYFA‚Äôs Filmmaking & Cinematography Creative Director, Liz Hinlein.

On his experience as a filmmaker and what it means to be a good storyteller, Odugbemi began by saying that ‚Äúall good storytelling is about humanity.‚Äù Odugbemi also commented on his belief that movies should not always highlight a sense of place or culture, but rather the human emotions and experiences that we all share or need to see to understand. ‚ÄúI am not keen on storytellers championing a culture,‚Äù he shares, ‚ÄúI want storytellers to champion human stories.‚Äù

Read more about the event here: https://www.nyfa.edu/nyfa-news/nyfa-welcomes-nollywood-director-and-producer-femi-odugbemi.php#.XzQh-hNKhTa

Joe Piscopo is a well-known actor, comedian, and TV/radio personality with a career spanning the past four decades. In 1980, Piscopo was chosen to join a newly formed ensemble, which included his friend Eddie Murphy, that took on one of the most difficult tasks in TV history‚Äîreplacing the original cast of Saturday Night Live.

title: The 20/20 Series with Randall Dottin
description:
On July 1, 2020, NYFA‚Äôs Filmmaking & Cinematography Creative Director, Liz Hinlein, welcomed Screenwriter, Director & NYFA Screenwriting Chair, Randall Dottin, as part of The 20/20 Series. The conversation was held virtually, allowing individuals to join NYFA and special guests from all over the world.

Randall Dottin grew up in Boston and always knew he wanted to be a storyteller. After working for Spike Lee‚Äôs production company for many years, he decided to finally attend film school. His short film A-Alike, was licensed for a two-year broadcast run by HBO and has won numerous awards. Dottin was also named by INDIEWIRE Magazine as one of their ‚ÄòTop Ten New Voices in Black Cinema,‚Äô and his short film, Lifted, was sponsored by Fox Searchlight‚Äôs program for emerging directors through the Fox Searchlab. His other short film, Fevah, starred Russell Hornsby (NBC‚Äôs Grimm, The Hate You Give and Fences) and LaRoyce Hawkins (Chicago PD).

Read more about the event here: https://www.nyfa.edu/nyfa-news/nyfa-welcomes-screenwriter-and-director-Randall-Dottin.php#.XxmrZJNKh27

title: The 20/20 Series with Ron Simons
description:
On July 8, 2020, as part of The 20/20 Series, we welcomed five-time Tony Award-nominated & four-time Tony Award-winning producer, four-time Sundance Film Festival selected producer and actor of stage, film & Tv, Ron Simons, for a conversation with director, cinematographer, and NYFA‚Äôs Filmmaking & Cinematography Creative Director, Liz Hinlein.

Mr. Simons is one of the leading African-American Tony Award-winning producers of all time, cementing him as a leading Broadway producer, who continues to bring diverse stories to the stage. Simons, who also is the CEO of SimonSays Entertainment, suggested filmmakers stay constantly engrossed in what is trending or being well-received by moviegoers. As a producer, commercial viability is essential as it is part of the producer‚Äôs job; making sure a film can be made to the highest standard with the budget it has while also making a profit because, at the end of the day, in order to make more movies there needs to be money.

Read more about this event here: https://www.nyfa.edu/nyfa-news/nyfa-welcomes-ron-simons-producer-and-ceo-simonsays-entertainment.php#.XyHeB_hKg1L

title: NYFA Guest Speaker Series: Juanjo Gimenez
description:
Juanjo Gimenez brought his Oscar-nominated and Palm d‚ÄôOr winning short ‚ÄúTimecode‚Äù to the NYFA Los Angeles campus in 2017. The writer and director stayed after the screening to discuss his short shoot schedule, the difference between features and shorts, and what he has planned for the future. 

Read more about this event at NYFA Los Angeles here: https://www.nyfa.edu/film-school-blog/juanjo-gimenez-screens-palm-dor-winning-short-timecode-nyfa-la/

title: NYFA Filmmaking Spotlight: Li Cheng
description:
New York Film Academy alum Li Cheng discusses his career and his film 'Jos√©,' which won the Queer Lion Award at the 75th Venice Film Festival.

'Jos√©' was written and produced by Cheng, and was shot in Guatemala with a non-industry artist and academic crew, making it the first major LGBTQIA+ film to come from the nation. 

Read more about Cheng and how his powerful film continues to resonate with audiences on NYFA's blog: https://www.nyfa.edu/film-school-blog/alum-li-cheng-queer-lion-award-venice-film-festival/

title: The 20/20 Series with Nicholas Simon
description:
On June 24, 2020, as part of The 20/20 Series, we welcomed film producer Nicholas Simon for a conversation with director, cinematographer, and NYFA‚Äôs Filmmaking & Cinematography Creative Director, Liz Hinlein.

Nicholas Simon is an American-Hungarian citizen living in Bangkok, Thailand and he is the Founder and CEO of Indochina Productions. His vast Asian filmmaking experience dates back to the early ‚Äò90s, with Indochina Productions being the only company in South East Asia to produce and service big-budget Hollywood studio films and Fortune 500 advertising commercial needs. Simon pioneered big-budget filmmaking in Vietnam with Warner Brothers/Legendary Films‚Äô Kong: Skull Island starring Samuel L. Jackson and in Bangladesh with Netflix‚Äôs Extraction, starring Chris Hemsworth. His recent productions include Spike Lee‚Äôs Da 5 Bloods starring Chadwick Boseman and A24‚Äôs A Prayer Before Dawn, starring Peaky Blinders‚Äô Joe Cole. 

Read more about the event here: https://www.nyfa.edu/nyfa-news/nyfa-welcomes-ceo-of-indochina-productions-and-producer-nicholas-simon.php#.XwS5mJNKg1K

title: The 20/20 Series with Laura Belsey
description:
On June 17, 2020, as part of The 20/20 Series, we welcomed Director Laura Belsey for a conversation with director, cinematographer, and NYFA‚Äôs Filmmaking & Cinematography Creative Director, Liz Hinlein.

Trained in the martial arts and known for tackling shows with action and violence like Arrow, The Flash, and The Walking Dead, Belsey shared that there is ‚Äúnever a one size fits all for action.‚Äù She revealed that prepping for an action sequence requires a lot of your own planning in your head with the stunts and editing.

Read more about the event here: https://www.nyfa.edu/nyfa-news/nyfa-welcomes-vice-president-of-directors-guild-and-director-laura-belsey-liz-hinlein.php#.Xvot5ZNKg1K

title: The 20/20 Series with Brett Leonard & Edward Button
description:
On June 10, 2020, as part of The 20/20 Series, we welcomed Director Brett Leonard and Cinematographer Edward Button, for a conversation with director, cinematographer, and NYFA‚Äôs Filmmaking & Cinematography Creative Director, Liz Hinlein.

Hinlein kicked off the conversation by asking both Leonard and Button about Leonard‚Äôs feature, Hollywood Rooftop (unreleased), which was shot in both 2D and VR. ‚ÄúIt was an experiment,‚Äù Leonard explained. ‚ÄúWe were combining things [2D and the immersive experience] in a way that hadn‚Äôt been done before as an entire feature.‚Äù Button continued, ‚ÄúBy doing both mediums, we elevated the process by working with the actors to incorporate both elements of the future and the past.‚Äù

Read more about the event here: https://www.nyfa.edu/nyfa-news/nyfa-welcomes-director-brett-leonard-and-cinematographer-edward-button-liz-20-20-series.php#.XvOPipNKg1K

description:

Learn more about NYFA's Acting for Film programs here: https://www.nyfa.edu/acting-school/

title: NYFA Guest Speaker Series: Brian Podnos
description:
New York Film Academy (NYFA) welcomed President and co-founder of DDreps, Brian Podnos, for a special guest lecture and Q&A at NYFA‚Äôs New York campus as part of NYFA‚Äôs monthly photography guest speaker series.

DDreps is a creative agency designed around elevating the production value of photography (and more) in the Real Estate industry. Originally a company of two, Brian has grown DDreps to include 7 photographers and 20 team members total over multiple services in only three years. This rapid growth is attributed to Brian spearheading an industry shift in how real estate is marketed, from just pictures of a space to a storytelling experience focusing on high-end compositions. 

Learn more about the Photo Arts Conservatory at NYFA here: https://www.nyfa.edu/photography-school/

title: NYFA Guest Speaker Series: Oliver Wasow
description:
New York Film Academy (NYFA) welcomed Oliver Wasow, a fine art photographer currently living and working in Rhinebeck, NY for a special guest lecture and Q&A at NYFA‚Äôs New York campus as part of NYFA‚Äôs monthly photography guest speaker series.

Wasow's photographs are included in a number of private collections and are also represented in various prominent public collections, including The Metropolitan Museum of Art, The Whitney Museum of Art, The Museum of Modern Art in New York City, and The Milwaukee Art Museum. Reviews of his work have been featured in most major art publications, including, among others, Art Forum, ArtNews, and The New York Times.

Learn more about the Photo Arts Conservatory at NYFA here: https://www.nyfa.edu/photography-school/

title: The 20/20 Series with Piper Perabo & Stephen Kay
description:
On May 27, 2020, as part of the 20/20 Series, we welcomed actress Piper Perabo and director Stephen Kay for a conversation with director, cinematographer, and NYFA‚Äôs Filmmaking & Cinematography Creative Director, Liz Hinlein.

Hinlein kicked off the conversation by asking both Kay and Perabo about what it can be like directing or acting on a television set versus a film set. ‚ÄúYou‚Äôre working within an assigned series of limitations, which is great,‚Äù Kay responded. He recalled that episodes of 'The Shield,' and 'Friday Night Lights,' for example, were set up to be shot in a way that matched his style. Though, when directing television, it doesn‚Äôt always turn out that way. For an actor, Perabo notes, television can be tricky because ‚Äúyou don‚Äôt know the end of the story.‚Äù For films and plays, you can easily have an idea of where your character is headed and how to take them there. On a TV show, ‚Äúthings get thrown at you that you don‚Äôt always craft into your original performance.‚Äù

Read more about the event here: https://www.nyfa.edu/nyfa-news/nyfa-welcomes-actress-piper-perabo-director-stephen-kay-liz-hinlein-2020-series.html#.XuKlk2pKh26

title: The 20/20 Series with Anka Malatynska
description:
On May 20, 2020, as part of The 20/20 Series, we welcomed Cinematographer Anka Malatynska for a conversation with director, cinematographer, and NYFA‚Äôs Filmmaking & Cinematography Creative Director, Liz Hinlein.

Malatynska joined the conversation from Nicaragua while Hinlein joined virtually from New York. The conversation began with Hinlein asking Malatynska to elaborate on her global career, traveling to all corners of the globe as a DP (Director of Photography). ‚ÄúFilmmaking is always a journey. [The film/television crew] We‚Äôre like a wild traveling circus that‚Äôs creating these beautiful, artistic human storytelling experiences,‚Äù and continued by saying that the camera is a tool to ‚Äúsee, understand, and tell stories‚Äù in a way that she would otherwise never know.

Read more about the event here: https://www.nyfa.edu/nyfa-news/nyfa-welcomes-cinematographer-anka-malatynska.php#.XtlPrZ5Kgnd

title: The 20/20 Series with Mark Pellington & Sarah Pirozek
description:
On May 13, 2020, as part of The 20/20 Series, we welcomed director and producer, Mark Pellington, and writer/director/producer, Sarah Pirozek, for a conversation with Liz Hinlein, director, cinematographer, and NYFA‚Äôs Filmmaking & Cinematography Creative Director.

Hinlein, began the Q&A by asking both Pirozek and Pellington how they feel about ‚Äúbeing called an artist.‚Äù Pellington remarked, ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt think I called myself an artist until somebody else did.‚Äù He noted that being an artist meant that you were doing many different things, and not always for yourself. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm here to create and sometimes it‚Äôs to make people feel less alone, sometimes it‚Äôs to sell something, sometimes it‚Äôs to entertain, or, sometimes, it‚Äôs some combination [of all].‚Äù

Read more about the event here: https://www.nyfa.edu/nyfa-news/nyfa-welcomes-director-and-producer-mark-pellington.php#.Xs03TxNKgnd

description:
On April 29, 2020, as part of The 20/20 Series, we welcomed Emmy Award-winning and Academy Award-nominated filmmaker Joe Berlinger, for a conversation with director, cinematographer, and NYFA‚Äôs Filmmaking & Cinematography Creative Director, Liz Hinlein. 

Special guest Joe Berlinger is known for his landmark documentaries Brother‚Äôs Keeper, Metallica: Some Kind of Monster, and the Paradise Lost Trilogy. Other notable films include Crude, Under African Skies, and the immensely popular Netflix Original documentary Tony Robbins: I Am Not Your Guru. In 2019, Berlinger did an extraordinary feat by creating two Ted Bundy-focused projects simultaneously; the Netflix docu-series Conversations With a Killer: The Ted Bundy Tapes and the narrative feature film Extremely Wicked, Shockingly Evil and Vile, starring Zac Efron and Lily Collins, which premiered at the Sundance Film Festival.

title: NYFA Cinematography Crane Workshop - 2020
description:
Every semester, Cinematography students from New York Film Academy (NYFA) learn to shoot footage with a large, professional crane. These workshops take place in a park near our Burbank-based campus and are overseen by NYFA-LA Chair of Cinematography Anthony B. Richmond, ASC, BSC, and veteran director Gil Shilton. 

Watch the amazing crane video set our MFA Cinematography students worked on while on campus earlier this year.

Learn more about NYFA's Cinematography School here: https://www.nyfa.edu/cinematography-school/

title: NYFA Guest Speaker Series: Ida Garland
description:
New York Film Academy (NYFA) welcomed Ida Garland, for a special guest lecture and Q&A at NYFA's New York campus as part of NYFA's monthly photography guest speaker series.

Ida Garland is a visuals editor, photo agent, producer, and designer. She began her career at Hearst publications. From there, she moved throughout the editorial world working at Popular Mechanics, Cosmopolitan, Seventeen magazine, Redbook, Oprah, and Entertainment Weekly. After her editorial run, Ida moved into the position of Junior Agent/Producer at Apostrophe Reps.

Learn more about the Photo Arts Conservatory at NYFA here: https://www.nyfa.edu/photography-school/

title: The 20/20 Series with Denis O'Hare and Sarah Pirozek
description:
Presented by New York Film Academy and created by Liz Hinlein.
