title: NYFA Guest Speaker Series: Chester Higgins
description:
New York Film Academy (NYFA) welcomed Chester Higgins, a recently retired New York Times staff photographer, for a special guest lecture and Q&A at NYFA's New York campus as part of NYFA's monthly photography guest speaker series.

Higgins is the author of countless stunning photo collections, his work has not only appeared in ArtNews, New York Times Sunday Magazine, Life, Newsweek, Fortune, or The New Yorker, but his work is the topic of two PBS films, "An American Photographer: Chester Higgins Jr.," and "Brotherman".

Learn more about the Photo Arts Conservatory at NYFA here: https://www.nyfa.edu/photography-school/

title: Study Abroad with NYFA üåé
description:
The New York Film Academy is a global film school offering campuses around the world to broaden the educational opportunities for its students and featuring programs in various and diverse locations, including Florence, Italy; Paris, France; Gold Coast, Australia; Beijing and Shanghai, China; and more. NYFA's quality educational programs have achieved a global presence, each location provides a different educational and cultural experience for students by offering a variety of workshops with hands-on, intensive courses, while all still maintaining NYFA's core principle of learning by doing. 

With New York Film Academy's study abroad programs, students become more than just tourists in a foreign city, fully immersing themselves in their new cultural surroundings. The rich cultures of each of NYFA's locations abroad, coupled with NYFA's already diverse student body, exposes its students to a variety of different perspectives. 

Learn more about New York Film Academy College of Visual & Performing Arts' International Division here: https://www.nyfa.edu/locations/

title: NYFA Guest Speaker Series: Ellen Kahn
description:
New York Film Academy (NYFA) welcomed Ellen Kahn, an early pioneer in video and performance art for a special guest lecture and Q&A at NYFA‚Äôs New York campus as part of NYFA‚Äôs monthly photography guest speaker series.

Khan is a former Governor for the Emmys and is currently on the Executive Committee for the Motion and Title Design Peer Group of the Television Academy. 

Learn more about the Photo Arts Conservatory at NYFA here: https://www.nyfa.edu/photography-school/

title: NYFA Guest Speaker Series: Hayden Szeto
description:
In 2017, New York Film Academy alum Hayden Szeto returned to the Los Angeles campus to share his then latest hit, ‚ÄúThe Edge of Seventeen.‚Äù 

During the event, hosted by Director of Industry Lecture Series Tova Laiter, Szeto spoke to NYFA students about his plans on taking up roles that deal with Asian American issues. Today, the highly anticipated American drama written and directed by Alan Yang, Tigertail, is available on Netflix, and NYFA Alum Hayden Szeto is solidifying his mark in Hollywood as he stars as Eric.

title: NYFA Guest Speaker Series: Derek Kolstad
description:
Derek Kolstad, creator, and writer of the iconic action franchise starring Keanu Reeves, John Wick, spoke with students at a special event at New York Film Academy moderated by Director of Industry Lecture Series, Tova Laiter.

Kolstad spoke about how he got started in the business and how that led to his success as a screenwriter. Filmmaking students also had the opportunity to ask Kolstad why he thinks the John Wick franchise stands apart from other action movies in the market. Watch the video to learn who the John Wick creator credits the success of the franchise to.

title: NYFA Guest Speaker Series: Rachel Bloom
description:
New York Film Academy welcomed Golden Globe-winning and Emmy-nominated writer, producer, Rachel Bloom, for a Q&A with NYFA‚Äôs Director of Industry Lecture Series, Tova Laiter.

Rachel Bloom is best known as the star of the CW musical dramedy Crazy Ex-Girlfriend, which she co-created and executive produced alongside Aline Brosh McKenna. 

Fits of laughter echoed in and out of the theater at NYFA‚Äôs Los Angeles campus, where Bloom spoke with students about how to develop the skills necessary to be discovered, check it out!

title: NYFA Guest Speaker Series: Jane Jenkins
description:
Get to know Jane Jenkins, the casting director behind classic films and fan favorites like The Princess Bride, Jurassic Park, Ferris Bueller's Day Off, A Beautiful Mind, When Harry Met Sally, Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone.

New York Film Academy students enjoyed a special screening of The Princess Bride with Queens-born casting director Jane Jenkins. Held in March 2011 for New York Film Academy‚Äôs Los Angeles campus, Jenkins answered questions from the students about the casting process and her experience in the film industry. The Q&A was moderated by Tova Laiter, NYFA Director of the Q&A Series.

This Q&A is also available on NYFA's Podcast, The Backlot: https://www.nyfa.edu/podcasts/jane-jenkins/

title: NYFA Guest Speaker Series: Sandy Skoglund
description:
New York Film Academy (NYFA) welcomed Sandy Skoglund, an American photographer and installation artist originally from Weymouth, Massachusetts for a special guest lecture and Q&A at NYFA‚Äôs New York campus as part of NYFA‚Äôs monthly photography guest speaker series. 


Learn more about the Photo Arts Conservatory at NYFA here: https://www.nyfa.edu/photography-school/

title: NYFA Guest Speaker Series: Steven Rudin
description:
New York Film Academy (NYFA) welcomed Steven Rudin, a psychiatrist turned visual collage artist, for a special guest lecture and Q&A at NYFA‚Äôs New York campus as part of NYFA‚Äôs monthly photography guest speaker series. 

Led entirely by Rudin, the special lecture entitled ‚ÄúPsychology of Collage‚Äù explored the aesthetics of memory and identity for which his collages are a metaphor. Rudin encouraged students to reflect on the ways in which stories emerge and are altered by the arrangement of our memories, similar to the way that films navigate through past, present, and future narratives. 

Learn more about the Photo Arts Conservatory at NYFA here: https://www.nyfa.edu/photography-school/

title: Rainer On Film, Episode 3: From the 80s to the 90s
description:
In the third episode of "Rainer On Film," New York Film Academy instructor Peter Rainer discusses films from the 1980s to the 1990s. 
He discusses the rise of technology with films like Toy Story and Jurassic Park that really utilize the technology in a way that hadn't existed before. Rainer also notes the indie movement and how filmmakers of the '90s had a path to exhibition that didn't exist before, namely the festival circuit. Ultimately, the film critic analyzes the increasing importance of videos and DVDs that allowed less popular films to become embraced more at home. 

Learn more about NYFA Faculty Member & Award-Winning Film Critic, Peter Rainer, here: https://www.nyfa.edu/student-resources/peter-rainer-nyfa/

title: NYFA Student Spotlight: Mia Redwine
description:
Check out this spotlight on NYFA BFA Filmmaking alum Mia Redwine as she recounts her experiences at New York Film Academy Los Angeles, and how important collaboration is when on set. Redwine was always fascinated by the idea of telling her stories through the camera - and in just three years - she completed her degree at NYFA. 

Learn more about NYFA's Filmmaking degrees here: https://www.nyfa.edu/film-school/

title: New York Film Academy Workshops in Paris, France
description:
Paris is an incredibly exciting place in which to live and make films in. It is the birthplace of the movies and the city that still loves movies the most.

Take a look at New York Film Academy's workshops in Paris, and learn more about the set of skills and aesthetic criteria that you‚Äôll get at NYFA and that will set you above everybody else.

The NYFA Paris program conducts its filmmaking and acting for film workshops at the National Film School of France (La F√©mis), one of the world‚Äôs most prestigious film institutes.

Are you interested in Film or Acting? More info on NYFA's workshops in Paris here: https://www.nyfa.edu/paris/

title: NYFA Student Spotlight: M'J MILLIGAN
description:
Check out this spotlight on NYFA BFA Acting for Film alum M'J Milligan as he reflects on his experience in the Acting for Film program at New York Film Academy Los Angeles, and the transition to civilian life when getting out of the Army.

Learn more about NYFA's Acting School here: https://www.nyfa.edu/acting-school/

title: NYFA Guest Speaker Series: Matt Kaplan
description:
Following a screening of the Netflix all-time most-viewed original film, "To All the Boys I‚Äôve Loved Before," NYFA hosted an exclusive Q&A with esteemed producer Matt Kaplan for our high school campers. Tova Laiter, Director of the NYFA Q&A Series, curated and moderated the event.

Matt Kaplan is the founder and CEO of Ace Entertainment, focused on making feature films, tv series, and digital content for youth audiences. Kaplan related how he started making short form content right after graduating film school and how his YouTube videos earned him an assistant position at Lionsgate, as well as discussed the sequel "To All the Boys: P.S. I Still Love You"

The highly anticipated sequel of the breakout teen franchise starring #NYFAAlum Lana Condor, is, as of today, available on Netflix!


Read more about Matt Kaplan's visit to NYFA Los Angeles on our website: http://bit.ly/2Z9w8E5

title: NYFA Guest Speaker Series: Tory Rust
description:
Brooklyn-based photographer and director Tory Rust joined NYFA for a guest lecture at the New York campus. Raised in Fargo, North Dakota, Rust shared stories of her experiences working as a photographer and offered an inside look at some of her recent photography and video projects, including a NYLON Magazine digital cover, GLAMSQUAD product launch, BUSTLE x Calvin Klein branded content, and an in-depth DJ shoot at this year‚Äôs Coachella music festival.

Rust's work accurately represents her obsession with saturated colors, high energy, and junk food, check it out here: http://bit.ly/2kcEHPS

title: Game Deconstruction with Scott Rogers: God of War
description: As part of NYFA‚Äôs Masters of Game Design guest speaker series, instructor Scott Rogers hosted students for a game deconstruction guest lecture on action-adventure game franchise God of War.

title: NYFA Guest Speaker Series: Voldi Way
description: As part of NYFA‚Äôs Masters of Game Design guest speaker series, NYFA welcomed well-known programmer, producer, composer and audio designer on over 60 games, Voldi Way. Check out the Q&A to learn more about the seasoned game designer as he joins NYFA instructor Scott Rogers for a discussion on the game industry and his experience founding Way Forward - one of the video game industry‚Äôs oldest independent development studios.

title: NYFA Guest Speaker Series: Kevin Feige
description:
New York Film Academy welcomed President of Marvel Studios and Chief Creative Officer of Marvel, Kevin Feige, for a Q&A with NYFA‚Äôs Director of Industry Lecture Series, Tova Laiter.

Feige has been the driving creative force behind several billion-dollar franchises and an unprecedented number of blockbuster feature films, all connected to create the Marvel Cinematic Universe. Check out what Marvel producer and president shared with students about Stan Lee and Jack Kirby, as he discussed the key to the success of the MCU.

title: NYFA Guest Speaker Series: Ted Field
description: New York Film Academy welcomed producer and media mogul Ted Field for a Q&A with NYFA‚Äôs Director of Industry Lecture Series, Tova Laiter. Check out what the Jumanji producer and Interscope Records co-founder shared with students as he discussed his career and the changing landscape of the producing profession.

title: NYFA Australia Alum Spotlight: Josh Hale
description: Check out this spotlight on director, producer and NYFA Australia alum Josh Hale. Learn about his success in the film industry following his graduation from NYFA Australia‚Äôs Advanced Diploma of Screen and Media - Filmmaking.

title: NYFA Guest Speaker Series: Dolph Lundgren & Steven Caple Jr.
description: New York Film Academy welcomed actor Dolph Lundgren and director, producer and writer Steven Caple Jr. for a Q&A with NYFA‚Äôs Scott Rogers. Check out the video to learn more about their work on the wildly popular franchise film Creed II, and what‚Äôs next for the veteran actor and rising directorial talent in Hollywood.

title: NYFA Guest Speaker Series: Tony Barnes
description: As part of NYFA‚Äôs Masters of Game Design guest speaker series, NYFA welcomed veteran game designer Tony Barnes for a conversation with instructor Scott Rogers. Check out the Q&A to watch as they discuss his career creating AAA video games and the keys to finding success in the gaming industry.

title: Game Deconstruction with Scott Rogers: Red Dead Redemption II
description: To kick off NYFA‚Äôs Masters of Game Design guest speaker series, NYFA Game Design instructor Scott Rogers hosted a lively lecture for students, discussing game deconstruction and highlighting Red Dead Redemption II, the fastest grossing video game of all time.

title: NYFA Guest Speaker Series: Andy Ashcraft
description: As part of NYFA‚Äôs Masters of Game Design guest speaker series, NYFA welcomed game designer and Giantsdance Games founder Andy Ashcraft for a conversation with instructor Scott Rogers. Check out the Q&A to watch as Ashcraft shares with students his experience designing digital games for console, computer, mobile and toys for Sony, THQ and more.

title: NYFA Guest Speaker Series: Carl Weathers
description:
Dive into Hollywood with Carl Weathers! Join us as we welcome acclaimed actor, director, and producer to our Los Angeles campus for an exclusive panel discussion curated by NYFA instructor Kim Ogletree and featuring prominent editors and actors. Weathers most recently starred in Jon Favreau‚Äôs The Mandalorian, a new Star Wars spin-off series that launched on Disney‚Äôs new streaming service, Disney+.

NYFA‚Äôs Industry Lab offers students real-world experiences, working on major productions for professional clients. Learn more about it here: https://bit.ly/NYFA_IndustryLab

title: NYFA Guest Speaker Series: Craig Caton
description: Check out this interactive Q&A with NYFA Chair of Animation and VFX Craig Caton and NYFA instructor Eric Conner to learn about Caton‚Äôs decades of experience as a VFX artist on films such as Jurassic Park, Strange Days, Total Recall and more.

title: NYFA Spotlight: Producing Unscripted TV
description: Check out this spotlight on producing unscripted television with NYFA instructor Beth Bigler, as she navigates the world of unscripted TV production and explores the projects and skills you‚Äôll develop in unscripted television producing courses at NYFA.

description: Check out this spotlight on NYFA alum Ashton Brooks as he reflects on his experience in the Filmmaking and Producing programs at NYFA, and his professional experience as an associate producer on New York Emmy-Award winning projects.

description: As part of NYFA‚Äôs Masters of Game Design guest speaker series, NYFA welcomed award-winning independent video game developer Asher Vollmer for a conversation with NYFA instructor Scott Rogers. title: NYFA Guest Speaker Series: John Zuur Platten
description: As part of NYFA‚Äôs Masters of Game Design guest speaker series, NYFA welcomed entertainment industry veteran & NYFA faculty member John Zuur Platten. The game designer, story writer and narrative designer joined NYFA instructor Scott Rogers for an in-depth conversation on his favorite games, understanding characters succeeding in the industry.

description: As part of NYFA‚Äôs Masters of Game Design guest speaker series, NYFA welcomed game designer and programmer Jonathan Ackley for a conversation with instructor Scott Rogers. title: NYFA Guest Speaker Series: Ted Price
description: As part of NYFA‚Äôs Masters of Game Design guest speaker series, NYFA welcomed game designer Ted Price for a conversation with instructor Scott Rogers. title: NYFA Guest Speaker Series: J.A. Bayona
description: New York Film Academy welcomed Spanish director, producer and writer J.A. Bayona for a Q&A with NYFA‚Äôs Director of Industry Lecture Series, Tova Laiter. Plus, be sure to keep an eye out for Amazon Studios‚Äô new "Lord of the Rings" TV series, the first two episodes of which he has been tapped to direct.

title: NYFA Guest Speaker Series: Raph Koster
description: For the inaugural Masters of Game Design guest speaker session, NYFA welcomed veteran game designer Raph Koster for a conversation with NYFA Game Design instructor Scott Rogers. Check out the Q&A to watch as Koster discusses his work as a lead game designer, writer, artist, and programmer, and what it‚Äôs like to be considered one of the world‚Äôs top thinkers.

title: NYFA Guest Speaker Series: Ted Sarandos
description: New York Film Academy welcomed Netflix Chief Content Officer Ted Sarandos for a conversation with NYFA Director of Industry Lecture Series, Tova Laiter. Check out the Q&A to watch as Sarandos shares his industry expertise and offers a unique look inside his experience leading content acquisition for Netflix since 2000.

title: NYFA Student Spotlight: EnLin Qing
description: Check out photographer, dancer, psychologist and New York Film Academy Photography alum Enlin Qing for a sneak peek into his world on set as he reflects on his experience at NYFA and where he finds inspiration.

title: NYFA Guest Speaker Series: Anthony Richmond
description: New York Film Academy welcomed renowned Cinematographer and NYFA Los Angeles Cinematography Chair Anthony Richmond (A.S.C., B.S.C.) for a Q&A with screenwriter Howard Rodman. Check out what the film industry veteran shared with students as he reflected on his notable career, which spans well over six decades.

title: NYFA Guest Speaker Series: Neal Baer
description: New York Film Academy welcomed television writer and producer Dr. Neal Baer for a Q&A with NYFA‚Äôs Director of Industry Lecture Series, Tova Laiter. Check out what the ‚ÄúDesignated Survivor‚Äù executive producer shared with students as he discussed his career and all things TV series production ahead of ‚ÄúDesignated Survivor‚Äù season three.

title: NYFA Guest Speaker Series: Assaf Bernstein and Dana Lustig
description: New York Film Academy welcomed director Assaf Bernstein, and producer and NYFA instructor, Dana Lustig, for a discussion moderated by Director of the Los Angeles NYFA campus, Dan Mackler. Check out this video to hear about Bernstein and Lustig's creative processes and their advice for those working in the entertainment industry.

title: NYFA Guest Speaker Series: Anna Serner
description: New York Film Academy welcomed legal professional, public speaker and CEO of the Swedish Film Institute Anna Serner to discuss the challenges that face women in the industry today, the importance of the female voices in storytelling and her hopes for the future. In honor of Women's Equality day, check out this video and hear more about Anna, a powerhouse of the gender equality in film movement.

title: NYFA Guest Speaker Series: Stephen Dorff
description: New York Film Academy welcomed actor, director and producer Stephen Dorff to its L.A. campus for a lively conversation with NYFA Director of Industry Lecture Series, Tova Laiter and Associate Chair of Acting, Christopher Cass. Check out the Q&A for a discussion on Dorff‚Äôs experience in the film industry and his advice for NYFA Filmmaking and Acting for Film students.

title: NYFA Guest Speaker Series: Ayelet Zurer
description: New York Film Academy welcomed award-winning Israeli actress Ayelet Zurer for a Q&A with NYFA's Director of Industry Lecture Series, Tova Laiter. Check out what the "Daredevil"¬†star shared with students as she discussed her transition from Israeli television to mainstream American movies and TV, and the lessons she has learned as an actress.

title: We Are The New York Film Academy!
description:
Over the last two decades, the New York Film Academy (NYFA) has become the most prominent institution of visual and performing arts education. In this video, we introduce you to our programs, our faculty, facilities and worldwide locations. We are NYFA!

Visit our website: https://www.nyfa.edu

title: NYFA Guest Speaker Series: Bill Hader
description: Emmy Award-Winning actor, writer, producer, director and NYFA alum Bill Hader joined NYFA for a Q&A with Director of Industry Lecture Series, Tova Laiter. Check out what the ‚ÄúBarry‚Äù star shared with students at our Los Angeles campus, and tune in to the 71st Emmy Awards to see if he‚Äôll pick up more wins following his nominations for Outstanding Directing, Outstanding Writing and Lead Actor  in a Comedy Series.

title: NYFA Guest Speaker Series: Matthew Rhys
description: Emmy Award-Winning actor, director and producer Matthew Rhys joined NYFA for a Q&A with Creative Director of the Acting for Film Department, Amy Van Horne. Check out what "The Americans" star shared with students at our New York campus!

title: NYFA Spotlight: 3D Animation and Visual Effects
description: Check out our spotlight on Craig Caton-Largent, NYFA‚Äôs Chair of 3D Animation & Visual Effects, as he highlights student work and discusses the art of animation and visual effects.

title: NYFA Guest Speaker Series: Cedric The Entertainer
description: Popular actor, comedian, and game show host Cedric the Entertainer joined NYFA for a screening of "Barbershop", followed by a Q&A with Director of Industry Lecture Series, Tova Laiter. Check out what one of the "Original Kings of Comedy" shared with our students in Los Angeles!

title: NYFA Guest Speaker Series: Chad Stahelski
description: Popular film director and stuntman Chad Stahelski joined New York Film Academy's Los Angeles campus to discuss his extensive work as a stuntman in Hollywood and his journey to directing major motion pictures. Hollywood Producer, NYFA Director of Industry Lecture Series, Tova Laiter, and Screenwriting Faculty member Eric Connor hosted the Q&A.

title: Rainer on Film: 2019 Oscars Recap
description: From best picture nods to commentary on the overall culture of awards season, check out film critic and NYFA faculty Peter Rainer's recap of the 2019 Academy Awards. If you haven't had a chance to watch some of the year's major nominees, be sure to take a look ahead of the MTV Movie Awards on June 17th, featuring nominations from within the NYFA community, including NYFA alum Lana Condor of "To All the Boys I've Loved Before."

title: Rainer On Film, Episode 2: The 80s
description: In the second episode of "Rainer On Film," New York Film Academy instructor Peter Rainer discusses film of the 1980s. He notes that this was a director-driven era that witnessed films failing financially, while major film studios simultaneously underwent corporatization and the franchise mentality developed.

title: NYFA Travels to Saudi Arabia
description: In collaboration with the Saudi Arabian Society for Culture and Arts, King Saud University and the United States Mission to the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia, the New York Film Academy traveled to Saudi Arabia to participate in an educational and cultural exchange, providing hands-on film workshops to prepare the new generation of Saudi filmmakers to share their stories with the world.

title: NYFA Student Spotlight: Kanji Suto
description: Check out NYFA Los Angeles Filmmaking student Kanji Suto and learn about his time as a NYFA student with nearly 13 years of experience as a director of music videos, commercials and short films.

title: Broadcast Journalism Student Covers Game of Thrones
description: In anticipation of the upcoming and final season of the worldwide phenomenon Game of Thrones, fans searched across the globe for six iron thrones hidden by HBO. Check out NYFA Broadcast Journalism student Nicole Abebe as she reports from Fort Totten Park in Queens, NY, where an iron throne was found.

title: NYFA Student Spotlight: Kanji Suto
description: Check out NYFA Los Angeles Filmmaking student Kanji Suto and learn about his time as a NYFA student with nearly 13 years of experience as a director of music videos, commercials and short films.

title: NYFA Spotlights Filmmaking Graduate Yuk Hong Law
description: New York Film Academy spotlights BFA Filmmaking graduate Yuk Hong Law and his journey to earn a degree through his studies in Shanghai and Los Angeles. Through NYFA's hands-on BFA Filmmaking program, Yuk Hong Law learned practical skills in cinematography, allowing him to recognize his ultimate dream of becoming a Director of Photography on set. Watch now to hear more about Yuk Hong Law's experience at NYFA.

title: NYFA Congratulates Guest Speaker Timothy Olyphant
description: NYFA Congratulates Drew Barrymore and Guest Speaker Timothy Olyphant on the third Season of Santa Clarita Diet, streaming now on Netflix!

title: New York Film Academy Australia
description:
ABN: 36 148 922 936 | CRICOS Code: 03366A | RTO Provider Number: 32484

Our innovative "learning-by-doing" approach to teaching in the creative paradise of Gold Coast, Australia is aligned with the philosophy of our renowned New York Film Academy. Since 1992, the New York Film Academy has built a reputation as one of the premier hands-on intensive film and acting schools in the world. Additional NYFA campuses are also located in Los Angeles, and South Beach, Miami, with a year-round location in Florence, Italy.

In the heart of the innovative Queensland film industry, NYFA Australia students find themselves completely immersed in their course of study from day one, surrounded by award-winning faculty and working with state-of-the-art equipment and facilities, and access to production sets on the world-famous Village Roadshow Studios. The project-based curriculum in our film school and acting schools are designed to reflect a real-world environment while encouraging students to explore their own creativity and passion.

Learn more on our website https://www.nyfa.edu.au/

title: NYFA Cinematography Crane Workshop
description: Check out the NYFA Cinematography department's recent Advanced Camera Movement Workshop with instructor Anthony Richmond ASC, BSC and Anthony Cook, where students learned to operate a telescoping crane arm and remote head.

title: NYFA Photography: Location Photoshoots
description: Check out the NYFA student work from location photoshoots from NYFA's Photography Department showcasing the world of fashion photography.

title: Mumbai Workshop with NYFA
description: New York Film Academy brings its world-renowned filmmaking and acting for film workshops to Mumbai. The centre of the world‚Äôs largest film industry and the home of Bollywood, Mumbai is the birthplace of Indian cinema. The city‚Äôs passion for film is undeniable.

title: NYFA Across the Globe in 2018
description: From graduations and guest speaker series to shooting on the Universal Backlot, the New York Film Academy takes a look back at the phenomenal year that NYFA students had at our campuses across the globe.

description:

This year, craft yours through the creative process of filmmaking and acting for film in a city that has inspired and nurtured artists for centuries. title: NYFA for Strings City Florence
description: The New York Film Academy in Florence collaborates with Strings City to produce a video capturing the popular festival of music, art and beauty in some of the most evocative places of culture in the city

title: Inhale/Exhale Starring Amy Yakima & CorBen Williams
description:
Watch The Professional Conservatory of Musical Theatre at New York Film Academy's Release of "Inhale/Exhale," starring ‚ÄòSo You Think You Can Dance‚Äô Winner Amy Yakima and Musical Theatre School alum CorBen Williams. 

Directed by Chair of Short-term Intensive Programs Jonathan Whittaker, edited by Sean Robinson, and produced by actress and Musical Theatre School Creative Director Kristy Cates, the video showcases the talents of both performers after a chance encounter in downtown Manhattan.

title: NYFA Remembers Penny Marshall
description: The New York Film Academy remembers Penny Marshall. The filmmaker, actress, and producer starred for eight seasons on the beloved ABC show 'Laverne & Shirley', created by her late brother and NYFA Guest Speaker Garry Marshall. She also directed such films as 'Big,' 'A League of Their Own', and 'Awakenings,' breaking records as the first woman in Hollywood to direct a top-grossing film.

title: NYFA Guest Speaker Series: Eric Goldberg
description: As part of our guest speaker series and ahead of the upcoming release of Disney's Mary Poppins Returns, New York Film Academy Los Angeles sits down with animator, director and voice actor Eric Goldberg to discuss his long history of work with Walt Disney Animation Studios and Warner Bros Animation and praise hand-drawn animation in an increasingly digital world.

Every New Yorker expresses their frustrations about the MTA in their own way, but most of us haven't sung a song about it. Watch the latest video from the Professional Conservatory of Musical Theatre at NYFA: a new musical response to the MTA's proposed fare hike, performed by Broadway actress and NYFA Musical Theatre Creative Director Kristy Cates.

description:
New York Film Academy high school summer camps are like no other in the world.

https://www.nyfa.edu/summer_camp/

title: NYFA LA Graduation Highlights 2018
description: The New York Film Academy Los Angeles recently celebrated its newest graduating¬†class. From Acting for Film to Filmmaking and many other disciplines, take a look at some of the highlights from the graduation ceremonies, and learn more about our programs on our website:¬†https://www.nyfa.edu/programs/

title: Nicolas Roeg Memoriam Video
description: Nicolas Roeg was an iconic director and filmmaker. This memoriam video offers commentary from close friend and fellow cinematographer Tony Richmond, as he reflects on his time spent making films with Nicolas through the years.

title: Guest Speaker Series: Amy Smeed (Head Animator for Walt Disney Animation Studios)‚Äã
description:
Head of Animation for Walt Disney Studios Amy Lawson Smeed gave a rousing Q and A at the Los Angeles campus of the New York Film Academy, after a screening of her latest work ‚ÄúMoana.‚Äù Smeed‚Äôs work includes ‚ÄúTreasure Planet,‚Äù ‚ÄúPaperman,‚Äù ‚ÄúFrozen,‚Äù ‚ÄúTangled,‚Äù ‚ÄúMoana‚Äù and both installments of the Wreck-It Ralph film series "Wreck-It Ralph" and "Ralph Breaks the Internet." The event was moderated by NYFA Chair of Animation Craig Caton.

For more information on 3D Animation & VFX programs at NYFA, visit nyfa.edu/animation-school/

title: NYFA Guest Speaker Series: Claudia Castellow & Michael P. Shawner - Editors of the Film Creed
description:
Following a screening of Creed (starring Michael B. Jordan & Sylvester Stallone), New York Film Academy welcomed the film editors Claudia Castellow & Michael P. Shawner for a Q&A. Claudia Castellow is also a NYFA Alum, having completed her editing program at the New York Film Academy. This was moderated by NYFA's Joshua Eiserike.

Check out the full NYFA guest speaker series here: https://www.nyfa.edu/videos/category/guest-speaker-series/

title: NYFA Guest Speaker Series: Dolph Lundgren
description:
New York Film Academy Los Angeles welcomed actor Dolph Lundgren to an exclusive screening of "Rocky IV" at theater 12 on the Warner Bros. lot. The screening was followed with Lundgren‚Äôs Q&A, moderated by NYFA's Chris Devane.

Perhaps best known from his iconic role as Ivan Drago in "Rocky IV," Lundgren said, "Drago is the Frankenstein myth created by the system. Dr. Frankenstein is the bad guy and the monster is just the creation. That‚Äôs why I think this character resonates."

Check out the full guest speaker series at NYFA here: https://www.nyfa.edu/videos/category/guest-speaker-series/

title: NYFA Photography Alum Spotlight: (Emmanuel) Ogheneawore Esseh
description:
MFA Photography alum from Nigeria, (Emmanuel) Ogheneawore Esseh, discusses his body of work that he created during his time at the New York Film Academy, completely inspired by his culture. His experience working in a dark room allowed him to experiment with different ways of developing photos which then inspired another series of work.

To learn more about NYFA's photography program and degrees, check out our website: https://www.nyfa.edu/photography-school/

title: Guest Speaker Series: Cinematographer Julio Macat
description:
New York Film Academy welcomed Julio Macat, a cinematographer known for his work on comedies such as the Home Alone series, Wedding Crashers, and Pitch Perfect, for a Q&A after screening Horrible Bosses 2. Horrible Bosses 2 features an ensemble cast of Jason Bateman, Jason Sudeikis, Charlie Day, Jennifer Aniston, Jamie Foxx, Christoph Waltz, and Chris Pine. The discussion was moderated by Dean of Students Eric Conner and Associate Chair of the Cinematography Department Mike Williamson.

See more of the guest speaker series here: https://www.nyfa.edu/guest-speakers

title: New York Film Academy in South Beach, Miami
description:
Located in the heart of gorgeous South Beach, New York Film Academy in Miami offers a wide range of degree, conservatory, and workshop programs designed for students to achieve their learning goals in the amount of time that is right for them.

https://miami.nyfa.edu/

title: Guest Speaker Series: Matt Ross
description:
Actor, director, and screenwriter Matt Ross visited the New York Film Academy in Los Angeles. His latest work, ‚ÄúCaptain Fantastic‚Äù stars Viggo Mortensen as Ben Cash, a man who raises his six children in the wilderness with his wife. The family has shunned all technology, but when Ben‚Äôs wife dies, he has to take his children out into the world.

Read more about his visit on our blog: https://www.nyfa.edu/film-school-blog/nyfa-hosts-actor-matt-ross-guest-speaker-series/

title: PCMT at NYFA presents "I Know Him So Well" from the musical, Chess
description: PCMT Grad Alexia Sielo, Instructor & Broadway Performer Arbender Robinson and Music Supervisor Anna Ebbesen perform "I Know Him So Well" from the musical, Chess.

title: Fulbright Scholars at New York Film Academy
description:
The New York Film Academy is proud to have been the college of choice by dozens of Fulbright international students, who aim to achieve their artistic and educational goals.

To learn more about our Fulbright students, please visit: https://www.nyfa.edu/special-projects/fulbright.php

title: NYFA Photography at Dromedary Urban Tiki Bar in Brooklyn
description:
Dromedary Bar is a watering hole located in the ever-changing, old-New York neighborhood of Bushwick, Brooklyn that offers precisely executed tiki-style cocktails in a relaxed island-meets-industrial space; what we like to refer to as "Urban Tiki".

Learn more about our Photography program on the NYFA website https://www.nyfa.edu/photography-school/

title: Rainer On Film, Episode 1: The 60s and 70s
description: In the debut episode of "Rainer On Film," New York Film Academy instructor Peter Rainer discusses film of the 1960s and '70s. The longtime film critic points to the war in Vietnam and other tragedies and anxieties of the decades that led to the films that were produced during this time.

title: NYFA Filmmaking 2018
description: Beyond the theory and history of cinema, the New York Film Academy places an emphasis on hands-on experience. Students gain invaluable experience directing and shooting their own films and serving as integral crew members on other students' films. In their numerous projects, students take on roles such as director, cinematographer, writer and editor and experience first-hand what it's like to be a part of a film production. This hands-on experience in writing, directing, shooting, and editing is a large part of what makes the New York Film Academy the best film school for so many students.

title: Guest Speaker Series: Allan Heinberg
description:
Allan Heinberg has written for "Party of Five," "Sex in the City," "The OC," "Grey‚Äôs Anatomy", and "Gilmore Girls." He is also the creator and showrunner of The Catch. Outside of television, Heinberg has worked for DC comics, writing The Young Avengers, Justice League, and the 2005 reboot of Wonder Woman.

Heinberg regaled students with the tale of how he was hired to write the Wonder Woman film. He first saw the character of Wonder Woman, aka Diana Prince, on an episode of Super Friends. He was seven. A few years later, when Linda Carter burst on television screens in the 1970s, Heinberg was hooked. The very first play he wrote after graduating college featured Wonder Woman.

title: NYFA Acting For Film
description:
Designed equally for beginning actors as well as those with experience, NYFA's acting school provides actors with intensive training in screen acting, modern on-camera acting techniques, and supporting acting classes, which contribute to the creation of a filmed performance and have helped place NYFA amongst the top acting schools and best colleges for acting.

Unlike other acting colleges, the emphasis at the New York Film Academy‚Äôs acting school is on providing practical experience and hands-on education to our students so that not only do they develop their craft as actors, but excel at acting in front of the camera. Our Acting for Film instructors are all professional, working actors, writers, directors, and producers‚Äîveterans of Hollywood, independent film, and television‚Äîwho give each student a personal focus in every acting class and teach the rigorous discipline necessary for launching a career in film and television.

Learn more about our Acting for Film programs on our website: https://www.nyfa.edu/acting-school/

title: NYFA Photography Portfolio Spotlight on Tanya Gawdi
description:
Photography graduate Tanya Gawdi attended NYFA Los Angeles in 2015. Of her art, she says, "You have to have a story behind your work. You have to have meaning behind your work." Her work mostly deals in surrealism and often incorporates her pet dog.

Check out her full portfolio on her website https://www.tanyagawdi.com

title: NYFA Fashion Photography Shoot
description:
This video documents the final projects of students from NYFA's 4-Week Fashion Workshop. Our 4-week fashion photography classes are part of a full-time intensive immersion program. Students will learn all aspects of a professional fashion shoot ‚Äî including casting, working with both natural and artificial light, working with models and hair/makeup/stylists, as well as editing and retouching images into a final story.

Learn more about the program on our website: https://www.nyfa.edu/photography-school/workshops/4-week-fashion-photography.php

title: NYFA Cinematography Alumni Spotlight on Manuel Vel√°squez Isaza
description:
New York Film Academy Cinematography grad Manuel Vel√°squez Isaza hails from Colombia and has worked on many films including "A Scream That's Trapped Inside," "Deserted," and "Un Regalo Esencial."

Of the program, Isaza says, "There are incredible instructors. I think New York Film Academy has something very special which is the multiculturality." 

Learn more about the program: https://www.nyfa.edu/cinematography-school/

title: Guest Speaker Highlights
description:
From Steven Spielberg to Henry Winkler to New York Film Academy alum Aubrey Plaza, NYFA has had no shortage of guest speakers with star power. Take a look at some of our guest speaker highlights over the years.

Then check out the many guest speakers the New York Film Academy has had on our Guest Speaker Hub https://www.nyfa.edu/nyfa-news/guest-speakers/

title: Guest Speaker Series: Sherry Lansing & Stephen Galloway
description:
NYFA students at the Los Angeles campus were invited to an exclusive Q & A event featuring former Paramount Pictures chairman Sherry Lansing and Hollywood Reporter writer Stephen Galloway, who penned Sherry Lansing‚Äôs recent biography, ‚ÄúLeading Lady: Sherry Lansing and the Making of a Hollywood Groundbreaker.‚Äù Director of Q&A series Tova Laiter hosted the evening.

Read about their visit to the Los Angeles campus on our blog https://www.nyfa.edu/film-school-blog/nyfa-welcomes-sherry-lansing-and-stephen-galloway-as-guest-speakers/

title: NYFA Portfolio Spotlight on Tanne Willow
description:
Tanne Willow is a graduate of the New York Film Academy MFA Photography program. Willow is from Sweden and her photography has been featured in Profoto, the renowned Swedish brand. Her photography displays bold artificial lighting and a knack for combining flash with ambient light.

Read a Q&A with the NYFA alum under our Student Resources: https://www.nyfa.edu/student-resources/new-york-film-academy-photography-conservatory-student-tanne-willow-talks-going-back-to-school-and-creating-a-new-professional-identity/

title: NYFA Guest Speaker Series: Paul Feig
description:
Famed comedy director, Paul Feig, came to the New York Film Academy‚Äôs Los Angeles campus to celebrate the fifth anniversary of his beloved film Bridesmaids. Feig‚Äôs prolific film and television directing credits include Spy, Ghostbusters (2016), The Heat, The Office, Nurse Jackie, Freaks and Geeks, and Arrested Development. NYFA‚Äôs Director of Industry Lecture Series and successful Hollywood producer, Tova Laiter (Varsity Blues, Glory) hosted the event.

Read more about Paul Feig's visit to NYFA LA on our blog: https://www.nyfa.edu/film-school-blog/comedy-director-paul-feig-screens-bridesmaids-at-nyfa-los-angeles/

title: Portfolio Spotlight on Photography Alum Monika Sedziute (Fulbright Scholar)
description:
New York Film Academy Photography alum Monika Sedziute discusses her work in this spotlight video. Read about Photoville 2018, which Monika is a part of, on our blog:
https://www.nyfa.edu/film-school-blog/photoville-2018/

title: NYFA Los Angeles Campus Hyperlapse
description:
Located in the heart of Hollywood, New York Film Academy Los Angeles offers acting, film and media degrees, programs and workshops in a variety of visual storytelling disciplines, providing students with endless opportunities to master the basics of the film and entertainment industries. Surrounded by the best film studios in Los Angeles ‚Äî Universal and Warner Bros. ‚Äî students participate in hands-on production workshops, shooting their projects on the prestigious Universal Studios backlot. 

Learn more about the New York Film Academy in Los Angeles on our website: https://www.nyfa.edu/los-angeles/

title: Rainer's Roundtable Episode 103
description:
The third and final episode of the series entitled "Rainer's Roundtable" hosted by film critic and NYFA LA instructor Peter Rainer. The writer has written about films for NPR, Christian Science Monitor, New York Magazine and many other publications. In this series, he sits down with NYFA students and discusses film production, critique, and various processes in the film industry.

Read about Rainer joining the faculty at NYFA on our website: https://www.nyfa.edu/nyfa-news/award-winning-film-critic-peter-rainer-joins-nyfa-la-faculty.php#.W47P6K2ZO7g

title: NYFA Australia Study Abroad Spotlight on Students Ryan Padilla and Eric Posey
description:
The New York Film Academy in Gold Coast, Australia features access to the world famous Village Roadshow Studios. The project-based curriculum at our film and acting schools are designed to reflect a real-world environment while encouraging students to explore their own creativity and passion.

Australia Study Abroad student Eric Posey says, "My favorite part of the program is actually going to the actual Village Roadshow Studios and filming there." Adds Ryan Padilla, "New York Film Academy Australia is a great experience. I would definitely recommend it."

Learn more about our Australia campus on our website: https://www.nyfa.edu.au

title: NYFA Faculty Spotlight on Tony Richmond
description:
New York Film Academy Los Angeles Cinematography Chair Anthony Richmond is a veteran of the film industry. He has worked as Director of Photography on many acclaimed films over the years including The Sandlot, Cinderella Story, Legally Blonde, and many others.

Read about a course of Mr. Richmond's on our blog: https://www.nyfa.edu/film-school-blog/anthony-richmond-leads-production-design-practicum-at-laurel-canyon-stages/

title: 2018 NYFA Photography Workshop in Florence, Italy
description:
The New York Film Academy Photography department took a trip to the picturesque city of Florence to capture the landscapes, architecture, food, and people of the Italian city.

Read a blog about the trip here: https://www.nyfa.edu/film-school-blog/photography-trip-to-florence-italy-inspired-by-light-travel-and-art/

To learn more about our Photography programs, visit our program page: https://www.nyfa.edu/photography-school/

To learn more about studying at NYFA Florence, visit our Florence website: https://www.nyfa.edu/florence/

title: Rainer's Roundtable Episode 102
description: The second episode in the series entitled "Rainer's Roundtable" with film critic and NYFA LA instructor Peter Rainer. The longtime critic has written about films for NPR, Christian Science Monitor, New York Magazine and many other publications. In this series, he sits down with NYFA students and discusses film production, critique, and various processes in the film industry.

title: NYFA Guest Speaker Series: Seth Rogen
description:
Popular actor, writer, producer, and director Seth Rogen stopped by the New York Film Academy Los Angeles campus on Wednesday, August 17th to show his new R-animated movie Sausage Party and talk about his long acting career. Hollywood Producer, NYFA Director of Industry Lecture Series, Tova Laiter, hosted the Q&A.

Read about his visit on the blog: https://www.nyfa.edu/film-school-blog/seth-rogen-screen-sausage-party-new-york-film-academy/

title: NYFA Guest Speaker Series: Gordon Smith
description:
"Breaking Bad" and "Better Call Saul" writer visited New York Film Academy in Los Angeles to discuss his career with Screenwriting instructor David O'Leary.

Read more about his visit on our blog: https://www.nyfa.edu/film-school-blog/discussion-with-better-call-saul-writer-gordon-smith/

title: NYFA Spotlight on Game Design Graduate Junliang Zhang (Chinese with English subtitles)
description:
Chinese Bachelor of Fine Arts Game Design student Junliang Zhang discusses his time at the New York Film Academy. "Throughout my time at NYFA, I learned a lot about programming and artistic design. Then I could combine these things to create my vision."

Before graduating, Junliang secured an internship in Los Angeles and immediately began work full-time upon graduation. Learn more about NYFA's Game Design program on our website: https://www.nyfa.edu/game-design-school/

This video is in Chinese language with English subtitles.

title: Rainer's Roundtable Episode 101
description:
The pilot episode of Rainer's Roundtable with acclaimed film critic and NYFA LA instructor Peter Rainer. The longtime critic has written about films for NPR, Christian Science Monitor, New York Magazine and many other publications. In this series, he sits down with NYFA students and discusses film production, critique, and the filmmaking process.

Learn more about Peter Rainer's career on our blog: https://www.nyfa.edu/film-school-blog/pulitzer-prize-nominee-peter-rainer-discusses-film-critique/

title: NYFA Guest Speaker Series: Adam Driver
description:
Following a screening of his film "Paterson," Adam Driver participated in a Q&A with producer Tova Laiter. Driver discussed his career from military to film. He talked to students about the importance of the collaboration and contribution of everyone involved -- including the director, cinematographer, and, set designer. He addressed the questions about preparation by stressing the importance of rehearsal, knowing your lines, and the lines of other actors‚Äô in the scenes

Read more about Adam Driver's visit to NYFA New York on our website: https://www.nyfa.edu/nyfa-news/adam-driver-speaks-with-new-york-film-academy-students.php#.W05VadhKhu0

title: NYFA Guest Speaker Series: Bryan Cranston
description:
Following a screening of his film "Trumbo," Bryan Cranston participated in a Q&A with producer Tova Laiter. Cranston spoke of the journey to becoming an actor. He counseled students from all disciplines with words of wisdom such as, "Don‚Äôt put yourself in a position of need. You‚Äôre there to give them something."

Read more about Bryan Cranston's visit to NYFA LA on our blog: https://www.nyfa.edu/film-school-blog/trumbo-screening-emmy-award-academy-award-winning-actor-bryan-cranston/

title: NYFA Guest Speaker Series: Rob Cowan
description: As a part of our Guest Speaker Series, New York Film Academy LA sat down with Producer Rob Cowan who has worked on "San Andreas," "The Conjuring," and the upcoming "Aquaman."

title: NYFA Guest Speaker Series: Manuel Garcia-Rulfo
description:
As a part of our Guest Speaker Series, New York Film Academy LA sat down with Acting for Film alum Manuel Garcia-Rulfo who has acted in "Magnificent Seven," "Sicario: Day of the Soldado," "Murder on the Orient Express," and an array of other films.

Read more about the NYFA alum's visit back to campus on our blog: https://www.nyfa.edu/film-school-blog/nyfa-alumnus-manuel-garcia-rulfo-screens-magnificent-7-los-angeles-campus/

title: NYFA Guest Speaker Series: David Madden
description:
As a part of our guest speaker series, New York Film Academy LA sat down with President of Entertainment at AMC, Sundance TV & AMC Studios (formerly Fox) who has been involved in "Burn Notice," "The Killing," "The Americans" and many other television shows and films. "My job is simple to make the shows" he succinctly told students.

Read more about his visit on our blog: https://www.nyfa.edu/film-school-blog/nyfa-welcomes-president-of-entertainment-at-fox-broadcasting-david-madden/

title: NYFA Guest Speaker Series: Christopher Meloni
description:
As a part of our guest speaker series, New York Film Academy LA sits down with actor Christopher Meloni, of "Oz," "Law & Order: SVU," "Wet Hot American Summer" and many other television shows and films.

Read more about his visit on our blog: https://www.nyfa.edu/film-school-blog/nyfa-welcomes-versatile-actor-christopher-meloni/

title: NYFA Graduate Spotlight on Gary Bencheghib
description:
New York Film Academy Documentary alum Gary Bencheghib discusses his career and time at NYFA. The Indonesian filmmaker took the One-Year Documentary program at NYFA.

Learn more about Bencheghib's career after NYFA on our blog: https://www.nyfa.edu/film-school-blog/nyfa-doc-grad-raises-awareness-environment-recycled-mississippi/

title: NYFA Guest Speaker Series: Eric d'Arbeloff
description:
New York Film Academy LA sits down with Producer Eric d'Arbeloff, cofounder of Roadside Attractions as part of our guest speaker series.

Read more about his visit on our blog: https://www.nyfa.edu/film-school-blog/roadside-attractions-eric-darbeloff-screens-manchester-sea-nyfa-la/

title: NYFA Guest Speaker Series: Kelly Fremon Craig
description:
New York Film Academy LA sits down with Writer, Director, and Producer Kelly Fremon Craig as part of our guest speaker series.

Read about the writer of The Edge of Seventeen on our blog: https://www.nyfa.edu/film-school-blog/nyfa-los-angeles-welcomes-kelly-fremon-craig-of-the-edge-of-seventeen-as-guest-speaker/

title: NYFA Guest Speaker Series: Matty Cardarople
description:
New York Film Academy LA sits down with actor and NYFA alum Matty Cardarople as part of our guest speaker series.

Read about the Acting for Film grad‚Äôs role on Stranger Things on our blog: https://www.nyfa.edu/nyfa-news/nyfa-acting-for-film-alumnus-matty-cardarople-is-in-season-two-of-stranger-things.php

title: Guest Speaker Series: Discussion with Eddie Huang
description: New York Film Academy in Los Angeles hosted a Q&A with actor, director, writer, and producer Eddie Huang, as part of our guest speaker series.

title: NYFA Wild West Fashion Photoshoot
description:
At the New York Film Academy, students have the rare opportunity to learn fashion photography hands-on from prep to post in one of the fashion capitals of the world: New York City. NYFA‚Äôs four-week photography workshop will take students behind the scenes to focus on the art of fashion photography in an exciting cosmopolitan city where they will have premier, industry-standard equipment and essential elements at their disposal: beautiful models, hair and makeup artists, wardrobe stylists, a professionally equipped photo studio, and fantastic locations with full production vehicles from which to work.

Learn more about our Fashion Photography program on our website: https://www.nyfa.edu/photography-school/workshops/4-week-fashion-photography.php

title: Riverdale Q&A at NYFA with Ashleigh Murray & Casey Cott
description:
The New York Film Academy hosted two stars from the hit CW series Riverdale. Ashleigh Murray (who plays Josie McCoy) and Casey Cott (Kevin Keller) stopped by NYFA's New York campus for an exclusive pre-screening of "A Night To Remember," which was episode 8 in season two. They then stuck around for an hour-long Q&A with former NYFA Acting chair Peter Allen Stone.

Read more about the event in our headline piece: https://www.nyfa.edu/nyfa-news/riverdale-sneak-peek-with-ashleigh-murray-and-casey-cott-at-nyfa.php#.Wv3s462ZNu0

title: Musical Theatre Faculty Spotlight: Nick Cartell from Les Mis√©rables
description: The Professional Conservatory of Musical Theatre at the New York Film Academy faculty member Nick Cartell, is a talented Broadway performer is now portraying Jean Valjean on a national tour of Les Mis√©rables. Learn more about his story.

title: NYFA Graduate Spotlight on Christopher Lee Viljoen
description:
New York Film Academy Musical Theatre alum Christopher Lee Viljoen discusses his career and time at NYFA. The South African actor is currently on the national tour for "Les Miserables." Chris took the Two-Year Conservatory program at the Professional Conservatory (PCMT) during his time at NYFA.

Learn more about the PCMT at NYFA on our website: https://www.nyfa.edu/musical-theatre/

title: NYFA Graduate Spotlight on Tony Kelly
description:
The New York Film Academy catches up with Actor, Comedian, Writer and NYFA alum Tony Kelly. The Screenwriting graduate attended NYFA, based in part, on a recommendation from musician, fellow Irishman, and NYFA alum Glen Hansard, who said he couldn't recommend the school enough.

Kelly created the television series "The Hurler," for which he also writes and acts. Learn more about his career on our blog: https://www.nyfa.edu/film-school-blog/star-of-writing-home-is-comedian-and-new-york-film-academy-grad-tony-kelly/

title: Here's Where We Stand in Support of #MarchForOurLives
description:
As students from around the country join together to protest in keeping our communities safe from gun violence for #MarchForOurLives, New York Film Academy's (NYFA) Professional Conservatory of Musical Theatre (PCMT) drops a powerful rendition of the movie musical Camp‚Äôs smash hit Here‚Äôs Where I Stand. 

All proceeds from the digital downloads will be donated to Everytown for Gun Safety. Download are available on iTunes, Google Play, Bandcamp and most music download apps. See links below or search for "Here's Where I Stand NYFA" in your music app.

Read more on our blog: bit.ly/2I1aucY

Google Play Download: https://bit.ly/2ui7FCg

title: NYFA's High School Summer Program in Los Angeles
description:
Gain film, acting, screenwriting, and photography experience on the backlot of Universal Studios

All Camp Programs are solely owned and operated by the New York Film Academy and are not affiliated with Universal Studios.

In June 2017, the New York Film Academy brought its Teen Summer Camps to California for our nineteenth summer. Offering camps in Filmmaking, Acting for Film, Photography, Screenwriting, Documentary Filmmaking, 3D Animation, and Game Design, teens eager to get an introduction or continue their studies in their chosen craft do so against the rich surroundings of Los Angeles.

For more information, check out our website: https://www.nyfa.edu/summer-camps/locations/los-angeles/teens/

title: NYFA's High School Summer Program at Harvard
description:
Each summer, the New York Film Academy holds its programs at Harvard University, perhaps the most famous learning institution in the world.

Located in the charming, dynamic city of Cambridge, just minutes away from Boston, the ‚Äúcapital‚Äù of New England, Harvard charges the city with a unique and intellectually invigorating atmosphere. This of academic and creative activity challenges our students to achieve at the highest level.

Harvard University, founded 16 years after the arrival of the Pilgrims at Plymouth Rock, celebrated its 350th anniversary in 1986. Six presidents of the United States‚Äîincluding John Quincy Adams, Franklin Delano Roosevelt, and John Fitzgerald Kennedy‚Äîgraduated from Harvard. Its faculty have produced more than 30 Pulitzer Prize winners and 30 Nobel Laureates.

Learn more about NYFA's programs at Harvard here: https://www.nyfa.edu/harvard/

title: NYFA's High School Summer Program in NYC
description:
Our summer camps are like no other in the world. Whether you enroll in our Filmmaking, Acting for Film, Screenwriting, Broadcast Journalism, Photography, Musical Theatre, Game Design, Music Video, Documentary Filmmaking, or 3D Animation programs, you will gain intensive study in your discipline. Students develop new skills, make lasting friendships, develop their portfolios, and grow as artists.

Since 1996, thousands of teenagers and kids from all over the world have taken part in our intensive day and weekend camps in New York City; Los Angeles, CA; South Beach in Miami, FL; Harvard University in Cambridge, MA; Paris, France; Florence, Italy;  and the Gold Coast, Australia. 

Learn more here: https://www.nyfa.edu/summer-camps/

title: NYFA Celebrates Black History Month, Part IV of IV
description: NYFA continues to Celebrate Black History Month with Part IV of IV. The final part features editor Lillian Benson, sound mixer Willie D. Burton, and graphic designer Aaron Douglas.

title: NYFA Spotlight on MFA Documentary Pedro Peira (Fulbright Scholar)
description: New York Film Academy Documentary student and Fulbright Scholar Pedro Peira. He summarizes documentary filmmaking as such: "I think you want to make documentaries to entertain, and then inform at the same time, and hopefully make a change."

title: NYFA Animation Student Film "Kaetharos"
description: A short film by New York Film Academy 3D Animation & Visual Effects alum Oltion Zepishta for his final project.

title: NYFA Celebrates Black History Month, Part III of IV
description: NYFA continues to celebrate Black History Month with part III of IV. Featuring documentarian Madeline Anderson, animator Floyd Norman, and writer Lorraine Hansberry.

title: NYFA Photography Trip to Taste Restaurant
description: The Photography department at the New York Film Academy took a recent trip to Taste Restaurant to help with a full rebrand of the Pacific Palisades restaurant. The on-location lifestyle shoot gave students real world experience and prepared them for what lies ahead in their careers.

title: NYFA Celebrates Black History Month, Part II of IV
description: NYFA continues to celebrate Black History Month with Part II of a IV part series. This part features producer William D. Foster, journalist Alice Allison Dunnigan, and game designer Jerry Lawson.

title: NYFA Celebrates Black History Month, Part I of IV
description: In part one of a four part series, NYFA celebrates the essential African-Americans have done in art and film. Featured are photographer James Van Der Zee, actress Nina Mae McKinney, and director Julie Dash.

title: NYFA Student Spotlight on Actress Natasha Thahane
description: South African actress Natasha Thahane discusses her decision to move to New York to study Acting for Film at New York Film Academy.

description: A student short by New York Film Academy Filmmaking alum Yi Pan.

title: NYFA Movie Musicals: "The Legion of Grads" Trailer
description: A trailer for one of the New York Film Academy's Musical Theatre movie musical productions. "The Legion of Graduates" was produced/directed by NYFA alum Kevin Duda.

By New York Film Academy Filmmaking student Muzappar Osman. About greed, money, and human nature.

description: "My Baby, My Enemy" by New York Film Academy Filmmaking student Hawar Karim who submitted this as his thesis film.

title: A Look at New York Film Academy Florence, Italy
description:
As a cultural epicenter, Florence is the perfect hub for the New York Film Academy in Europe. While studying in Florence, students deepen their understanding of and connection to Italian culture and cinema by participating in NYFA's filmmaking and acting for film programs. Florence breathes inspiration and innovation through its rich history, beautiful scenery, authentic architecture, and cultural influence.   

The New York Film Academy offers its world-renowned filmmaking and acting for film programs in a newly renovated but classical-feeling Renaissance-era building overlooking the Piazza San Lorenzo. Located in the heart of the historic center of Florence, NYFA's Florence campus is steps away from the famous Piazza del Duomo, Santa Maria Novella, Galleria, and many other historical landmarks. Surrounded by this immensely cultural setting, students are provided with the ideal location to foster their creativity. NYFA's programs in Florence allow students to interact with the city's age-old surroundings, serving as the perfect location for filmmaking and acting for film programs while simultaneously allowing them to develop professional-level skills. The Tuscan landscape provides ideal open-air sets for shooting films, while Florence's classic architecture is a gorgeous backdrop for any film.    

Apply now for our upcoming workshops in Florence, Italy ‚û° https://bit.ly/YT2023_1


#NYFA #Florence #Filmmaking #Acting

title: Broadcast Journalism at New York Film Academy
description:
The New York Film Academy's Broadcast Journalism School was founded in collaboration with NBC News. Like all of the New York Film Academy's programs, the curriculum melds academic learning with practical, hands-on training. NYFA is considered a leading broadcast journalism school, emphasizing a professional mix of skills that allow students to become competitive in an always-challenging industry while at the same time instilling an appreciation of the ethical concerns that differentiate journalism from other professions.

Learn more on our program page: https://www.nyfa.edu/broadcast-journalism-school/

title: NYFA in Florence, Italy 2017
description:
Florence is the hub of the New York Film Academy in Europe. In 2008, the Government of Tuscany and the Tuscan Film Commission invited NYFA to offer our world-renowned programs in a newly renovated Renaissance-era building overlooking the Piazza San Lorenzo, in the heart of the historic center of Florence. This facility is across from the Basilica di San Lorenzo, one of the most famous churches in Florence, which houses the Medici Chapels, the burial place of the principal members of the Medici family. It is also steps away from the famous Piazza del Duomo, Santa Maria Novella, Ponte Vecchio, and the Galleria, which houses Michelangelo‚Äôs David. NYFA is also just one block away from the celebrated central market. 

NYFA Florence‚Äôs programs challenge students to interact with their surroundings while developing professional-level skills. Filmmaking students find themselves directly intermingling with the Italian people and culture, putting their knowledge to work as they make a series of short films. Acting for Film students perform in films shot on location, bringing stories and characters to life that reflects the culture and history of Florence. As students write, direct, shoot, edit and act in their own films, they acquire a deep understanding of Italian culture. Italy‚Äôs inhabitants become the characters in their stories. Italy‚Äôs traditions and customs shape their scripts, and Italy‚Äôs unique locations provide striking environments for original student films. Learn more on our website: https://www.nyfa.edu/florence/

title: New York Film Academy Movie Musical Highlight Reel
description:
The New York Film Academy's musical theatre school offers aspiring musical theatre actors a one-of-a-kind opportunity to develop their skills as triple threat performers by studying with Broadway level faculty. Students enrolling in the musical theatre school work directly with instructors who have appeared in numerous Broadway and touring productions, top-rate regional theatre, opera, hit movie musicals, and television shows. They receive real world training that prepares them to achieve success in the industry, creating an educational experience few other musical theatre colleges can offer. 

Attracting aspiring musical theatre actors from around the world, the New York Film Academy's musical theatre school gives students the opportunity to study their craft in the central hub for launching musical theatre careers‚ÄîNew York City. Students learn and hone their skills in acting, singing, and dancing in world-class facilities that include voice practice rooms, state-of-the-art dancing studios, and professionally equipped recording and shooting studios.

Along with this unparalleled training, we offer the chance to ‚Äúbe seen‚Äù by other professionals in the business (agents, casting directors, choreographers, composers, directors, producers) in the number one musical theatre market in the world. We offer two ‚Äúmain stage‚Äù productions each year, along with both a Summer and Winter New Reading Series and multiple masterclasses each semester. If you join us for our two-year program, you will graduate with numerous on-camera clips, a voiceover reel, and extensive on-screen experience.

To learn more about our Musical Theatre School, check out our website: https://www.nyfa.edu/musical-theatre/ or the Showcase Page https://www.nyfa.edu/student-works/musical-theatre.php

title: NYFA Student Spotlight: Mridul Sen
description:
Mridul Sen, a 1-Year Cinematography student from Bombay, India, discusses her background in Bollywood film and how NYFA's Cinematography school helped refine her craft. Mridul sums it up as such: "It just hit me that I don't want to be anything else but a cinematographer."

New York Film Academy's philosophy of learning by doing means that our one-year cinematography students develop their technical skills and artistic identities through a dynamic combination of classroom experience, practical hands-on workshops, individual and collaborative projects, and instructor-led productions. Cinematography students collaborate with their peers on active film sets and are encouraged to develop their networking skills by seeking out additional project work with their peers in the filmmaking program.

This is a rigorous program of classroom study, self-directed projects, and instructor-led workshops. Upon graduation, students will be proficient with many state-of-the-art camera systems and able to confidently supervise the creation of sophisticated lighting schemes. Most importantly, they will be able to effectively harness the visual tools of cinema to tell meaningful stories.

The New York Film Academy is dedicated to training new and aspiring cinematographers. To learn more about the New York Film Academy's 1-Year Conservatory Cinematography program, check out our website: https://www.nyfa.edu/cinematography-school/1year.php

title: #YouAreWelcomeHere at New York Film Academy
description:
#YouAreWelcomeHere celebrates inclusiveness and diversity at the New York Film Academy. Our community is built by individuals from over 120 countries and all backgrounds who seek to create a better life and a stronger world through the visual and performing arts.

At New York Film Academy, we‚Äôre proud to welcome people from all over the world who are driven to seek out the best educational opportunities possible as they pursue their dreams. We firmly believe in the unifying power of storytelling, and in the importance of fostering voices from every corner of the globe and every walk of life.

Following expressions of apprehension by some international students about studying in the U.S., American colleges and universities have come together to make students feel welcome through a marketing and social media campaign featuring the message #YouAreWelcomeHere. More information here: https://www.youarewelcomehereusa.org

To learn more about diversity at NYFA, check out our website: https://www.nyfa.edu/about/nyfa-diversity.php

To learn more about NYFA's filmmaking program and degrees, check out our website: https://www.nyfa.edu/filmmaking/

title: NYFA Spotlight on "Call of the Wolf"
description:
New York Film Academy alumni R.D. Womack, Aleksander Ristic, and Radhika Womack discuss the story behind R.D.'s thesis film "Call of the Wolf" and how NYFA helped prepare them to become successful professional filmmakers. 

Whether it be learning Meisner or taking a feature track program, NYFA's students are prepared for their professional fields by some of the best in the business. As Ristic put it: "By the time you graduate you're going to have a wealth of experience." 70% of the cast and crew on the Gravitas Ventures film were NYFA alumni proving the filmmakers' experience at NYFA was essential.

Read more about R.D. and Radhika Womack in this blog piece: https://www.nyfa.edu/film-school-blog/producing-couple-finds-love-and-distribution-from-nyfa-thesis-film/

title: NYFA MFA Acting Alumni Spotlight: Jongman Kim
description:
New York Film Academy MFA Acting Alumni Jongman Kim discusses how NYFA helped him become a successful actor. Kim stars in the Netflix romantic comedy series "Love" created by Judd Apatow and featuring Gillian Jacobs, Paul Rust, Claudia O'Doherty and others.

Transcript:
Hello! My name is Jongman Kim. I'm an alumni from New York Film Academy.

I'm on "Love" on Netflix, season 2 in episodes 10 and 11. My character is Victor. He's a famous action movie director. It's incredible. This is based on my experience from NYFA. NYFA teachers, they taught me a lot. Audition Technique, Acting for Film, Meisner Technique.

The great thing is they're working actors. They're not going to teach you just theory. They're going to teach you how you can use this theory or technique on set. We shot at the Universal Studios Backlot. We had a lot of chances to be in front of camera.

That experience in itself, that gave me my foundation of what I need to do to be an actor in Hollywood.

title: NYFA in South Beach
description:
New York Film Academy South Beach, Florida offers an education in film, acting, and photography unlike any other. Through our philosophy of ‚Äúlearning by doing,‚Äù students do not simply study the theory of their craft, but receive hands-on instruction in creating films, acting on screen, and capturing images throughout Miami.

Located in the heart of gorgeous South Beach, New York Film Academy in Miami offers a wide range of degree, conservatory, and workshop programs designed for students to achieve their learning goals in the amount of time that is right for them. 

Unlike other film schools, acting schools, and photography schools, students at New York Film Academy South Beach, Florida, achieve more in less time through our intensive, project-based curriculum.

To learn more about NYFA's South Beach programs, check out our website https://miami.nyfa.edu

The New York Film Academy‚Äôs Game Design School prepares students to achieve professional success. NYFA is proud to welcome a diverse range of students from Latin America at all of its United States campuses, located in New York, Los Angeles, and South Beach, Miami.

Check out NYFA's diversity page to learn more about our commitment to diversity and our initiatives to promote it in our programs: https://www.nyfa.edu/about/nyfa-diversity.php

title: Anna Serner: Women in Film Lecture Highlights
description: New York Film Academy students, faculty and staff were invited to attend a special lecture and discussion with Anna Serner, CEO of the Swedish Film Institute, to hear a presentation on a topic very much in the forefront here and abroad. That topic is gender equality in the film industry. Much has been said and written about the significant pay and role disparity in the acting field and the fact that women are under represented in the directing profession both qualitatively and quantitatively.

title: "Recycled Mississippi": Episode 2
description:

title: High School 16mm Camera Workshop
description: As a part of Six-Week 16mm & HD New York Film Academy Filmmaking Camp our students learn how to actually shoot on film. Why, you may ask? Well, regardless of the fact that nowadays digital imaging is equivalent or maybe even surpassing the technical capabilities of film, many productions are still shot on film. This means that knowing how to work with 16mm is still a precious skill in the industry.

Nour came to NYFA to make a major career change. After being stranded in New York by the ongoing civil war in her homeland of Syria, she set out to ‚Äúreinvent‚Äù herself as a broadcast journalist. Her goal was to learn skills that would allow her to be competitive in an always-challenging job environment.

title: Admissions Spotlight with Chris Devane
description:
New York Film Academy Admissions Representative Chris Devane has been in the business since 1974. He started as a child actor and has worked on such shows as ‚ÄúThe Rockford Files,‚Äù The Love Boat," and ‚ÄúChip‚Äôs‚Äù to name a few. He then moved behind the camera in 1987 as an agents assistant. 

After working at a talent agency he began working as a personal manager and worked with such actors as Christian Bale, Eric Balfore, Brittany Murphy, Corey Feldman and many many more in the 1980's.. After working as a manager for several years he moved into casting in 1990. 

He has worked on over 4,000 professional projects in his career and seen more than 3,000,000 actors in Los Angeles. Casting has been his love ever since. Commercial‚Äôs Film & Television are the areas he has worked in Casting. Casting is the first process to take what is on paper and put it on screen. 

This gives the client the opportunity to see their storyboards in action. This process is one of the most important in commercials and filmmaking pre-pro.  

The audition process is as complex as it is difficult. He has been teaching this process to actors, producers, and directors for well over a decade and has a great working relationship with over 300 Los Angeles based talent agents, producers, directors, and PR companies.

https://www.nyfa.edu

title: NYFA Movie Musical Highlights 2016
description:
The New York Film Academy's musical theatre school offers aspiring musical theatre actors a one-of-a-kind opportunity to develop their skills as triple threat performers by studying with Broadway level faculty. Students enrolling in the musical theatre school work directly with instructors who have appeared in numerous Broadway and touring productions, top-rate regional theatre, opera, hit movie musicals, and television shows. They receive real world training that prepares them to achieve success in the industry, creating an educational experience few other musical theatre colleges can offer. 

Attracting aspiring musical theatre actors from around the world, the New York Film Academy's musical theatre school gives students the opportunity to study their craft in the central hub for launching musical theatre careers‚ÄîNew York City. Students learn and hone their skills in acting, singing, and dancing in world-class facilities that include voice practice rooms, state-of-the-art dancing studios, and professionally equipped recording and shooting studios.

Along with this unparalleled training, we offer the chance to ‚Äúbe seen‚Äù by other professionals in the business (agents, casting directors, choreographers, composers, directors, producers) in the number one musical theatre market in the world. We offer two ‚Äúmain stage‚Äù productions each year, along with both a Summer and Winter New Reading Series and multiple masterclasses each semester. If you join us for our two-year program, you will graduate with numerous on-camera clips, a voiceover reel, and extensive on-screen experience.

To learn more about our Musical Theatre School, check out our website: https://www.nyfa.edu/musical-theatre/ or the Showcase Page

description:

During a recent guest speaker event at New York Film Academy, Gallagher shared his recently-released horror film, "Smiley," which was released in theaters nationwide.

Max Frye and Dan Futterman who received a nomination in the upcoming Academy Awards for Best Original Screenplay. E. Max Frye won an Edgar Award from WGA for his first screenplay, "Something Wild," directed by Jonathan Demme. 

As a writer on HBO‚Äôs "Band of Brothers," he received a Christopher Award, a Peabody Award and was nominated for an Emmy.

description: Known for his comedic and iconic films, Jay Roach sits down with the New York Film Academy to talk about the business of writing, directing and producing in Hollywood.
