title: Discussion with Actor James Karen at New York Film Academy
description:
New York Film Academy Los Angeles MFA Acting, BFA Acting, BFA Filmmaking and a mixture of other students had a special treat on November 4th when James Karen, a prolific stage and screen performer with over 200 feature film credits, graced our stage. Mark Sawicki, chair of the animation department, invited Karen to speak and had the pleasure and challenge of interviewing this amazing actor who has worked steadily in the industry for an incredible seven decades.

Read more on the NYFA Blog: https://www.nyfa.edu/film-school-blog/a-memorable-evening-with-unforgettable-actor-james-karen/

title: Discussion with Producer Jack Rapke at New York Film Academy
description:
New York Film Academy students in Los Angeles received a special viewing of The Walk (directed by Robert Zemeckis and starring Joseph Gordon-Levitt, Ben Kingsley, and Charlotte Le Bon), which is not yet released to DVD or Blu-ray, and afterwards participated in a Q&A with the movie‚Äôs producer Jack Rapke. 

Read more on the NYFA Blog: https://www.nyfa.edu/film-school-blog/producer-jack-rapke-brings-the-walk-to-nyfa/

title: Discussion with Screenwriter Joseph Michael Straczynski at New York Film Academy
description:
New York Film Academy students gathered recently for a screening of the hit film "Thor" followed by a Q&A with its story writer Joseph Michael Straczynski.

J. Michael Straczynski works in films, television series, novels, short stories, comic books, radio dramas and other media. Straczynski is a playwright, former journalist, and author of The Complete Book of Scriptwriting.

Read more: https://www.nyfa.edu/film-school-blog/prolific-sci-fi-screenwriter-j-michael-straczynski-visits-nyfa/

title: Discussion with Producer Hilary Shor at New York Film Academy
description:
Hilary started at the desk of a talent agency breaking music stars like Phil Collins into movies, and she still manages actors today in addition to producing movies. 

Her producing credits include "Children of Men," directed by Alfonso Cuaron ("Gravity"), the documentary "Beautopia," a deconstruction of the modeling industry, the spy thriller Eye of the Beholder, with Ewan McGregor, and two movies directed by Lee Daniel--"The Paperboy," a crime story with Nicole Kidman and Zac Efron, and "The Butler," a historical drama with Forrest Whitaker and Oprah Winfrey.

title: Discussion with Actor Henry Winkler at New York Film Academy
description: NYFA's Chris Devane sits down with actor Henry Winkler in a Q&A that highlights Winkler's acting career.

title: Discussion with Producer Frank Marshall at New York Film Academy
description:
Together with his future wife Kathleen Kennedy and Steven Spielberg, Frank Marshall co-founded Amblin Entertainment, one of the industry's most productive and profitable production companies. 

As a producer, Marshall has received five Oscar nominations for Best Picture for The Curious Case of Benjamin Button (2008), Seabiscuit (2003), The Sixth Sense (1999), The Color Purple (1985), and Raiders of the Lost Ark (1981).

title: Scorpio Crane Workshop at New York Film Academy
description:
The week-long Crane & Jib Workshop gives students the opportunity to work with a variety of camera movement systems from a broad range of the top manufacturers including J.L Fisher, Chapman/Leonard, and Service Vision. Cinematography department chair Anthony Richmond, ASC, BSC led the class, introducing the students to a range of practical techniques for using both remote cranes and jib arms to construct powerful, dynamic shots. 

Read more: https://www.nyfa.edu/film-school-blog/anthony-richmond-holds-crane-and-jib-workshop/

title: Musical Theatre Spotlight: Kristy Cates
description:
Kristy Cates is a professional voiceover artist, concert soloist and is currently the Creative Director of the Professional Conservatory of Musical Theatre at NYFA.

Cates was a member of the original Broadway cast of "Wicked" (understudy to Idina Menzel). Kristy went on to open the National Tour as Elphaba and played the role for a year in the highly acclaimed Chicago sit-down production. Other Broadway roles include: Grandma Josephine in "Charlie and the Chocolate Factory" and Miss Bassett in "Finding Neverland."

For more information about NYFA's Musical Theatre program, please visit: https://www.nyfa.edu/musical-theatre/

title: 'Freya' Trailer by New York Film Academy Documentary Students
description:
FREYA by Andrew Linga, Rachael Peltzer, William Nestlehutt, Sasha-Gay Lewis, Jimmie Julion, IvoreeMyles, Denis Peres; Produced by Gary Bencheghib, Edited by Andrea Fumagalli

Discovered floating off the coast of Belize, Freya was so badly injured she couldn‚Äôt even dive down to escape the birds pecking at the stump of what had been her front flipper. The endangered sea turtle had survived a serious shark attack and is struggling for her life. The odds are not in her favor, but with a handful of volunteer rescuers working around the clock to save her, Freya at least has a fighting chance.

title: NYFA Alumnus Chris Lofing Directs "The Gallows"
description:
It‚Äôs the dream of every filmmaker who graduates from our programs to have a manager sign you and produce your feature film. That alone is a major accomplishment. In the case of One-Year Filmmaking graduate Chris Lofing, he tackled both feats and, just recently, released his horror feature The Gallows in theaters nationwide! 

In less than a month, his low budget film ($100k production) has already grossed over $35 million. With proof of profits for his investors, Mr. Lofing will have the opportunity to work with almost anyone in Hollywood.

title: Interview with New York Film Academy graduate Karsonya Wise Whitehead (Teaser)
description:
Check out our interview with New York Film Academy graduate & author of 'Notes from a Colored Girl: The Civil War Pocket Diaries of Emilie Frances Davis' - Karsonya 'Kaye' Whitehead. 

Since graduating from NYFA, Dr. Karsonya Wise Whitehead is now an assistant professor of communication and African and African American studies in the Department of Communication at Loyola University Maryland; a Master Teacher in African American History for intermediate, secondary and college teachers; the 2007 Gilder Lehrman Preserve America Maryland History Teacher of the Year; and, a three-time New York Emmy-nominated documentary filmmaker.

title: "The Chronicles of Samurai Stewie" by Andrew Kaufman
description:
Short animated film by 4-Week Animation Student, Andrew Kaufman.

"The four week animation course is an intense experience," says Kaufman. "From day one we delved right into it and learned at an exciting rate. Everyday we covered an enormous amount of material that only an expert in both animation and teaching could properly impart on us. It's amazing that we were taught in such a way that allowed us to understand the material so we could apply it to our own individual projects. The environment was one where students could interact with each other, share knowledge and help each other flesh out project ideas. It was also fun and invigorating to sit in the lab, by my computer working, and just banter with everyone. 

I loved the course. I met people from all over the world, I probably learnt more in a few weeks than I have in my entire college career, and I worked harder and couldn't have been happier doing it. I enjoyed this course so much I plan to come back for the one year animation course. 

Andrew Kaufman 
July 2013 4 week animation student

For more information, visit our Animation website: http://www.nyfa.edu/animation-school/

title: Saviour Okiro
description:
Saviour Okiro created this short animated film during the 4-Week Animation Workshop at the New York Film Academy.

"The 4 week 3D Animation workshop has been very informative," says Okiro. "I got a chance to learn a lot and advance my current knowledge. I am sad these four weeks have come to an end, but it was a great experience with Robert Appleton, he has been very helpful and thorough."

title: 'One Tough Melon" by Tiffany Okel
description:
Animated short created by 4-Week Animation student, Tiffany Okel.

The 4 week animation class at the New York Film Academy was an amazing experience," says Tiffany. "Attempting to learn the entire process of producing a computer animation in such a short time span is considered impossible by some, but this course comfortably achieves just that. "From concept art to final composition and all the steps in between, the entire process is covered by knowledgeable instructors ready to teach. It is true that there is not enough time to go into depth on any specific steps, but for a solid, complete, and accurate understanding of what is necessary for an animation to be created, this course proved to be outstanding. I am very happy with my experience and thrilled about what I was able to achieve through this course. I am excited to see where this experience and knowledge will take me in the future."

For more info about NYFA's Animation Program, visit here: http://www.nyfa.edu/animation-school/

title: Animated Short by NYFA's James Rockwell
description:
This animated short was created by New York Film Academy 4-Week Animation student, James Rockwell. 

"This course was a great experience for me as a beginner." said James. "I felt like I've gotten a good grasp on the basics of Maya and After Effects, and am excited to continue my education by watching tutorials and continuing to practice. I felt like I had a lot of creative freedom in the class, so I was able to make a character and animation the way I wanted to, and the teacher was really helpful in getting the image that I wanted."

For more information on NYFA's 4-Week Animation Program, click here: http://www.nyfa.edu/animation-school/4week.php

description:
The New York Film Academy is listed as a recommended school by the Saudi Arabian Ministry of Higher Education and is considered the best hands-on film school in the world by many of today's top filmmakers. NYFA is honored to be the school of choice for many Hollywood filmmakers, actors, and figures from the entertainment world who have sent a son, daughter or a family member to study with us. They include: Steven Spielberg, Martin Scorsese, Robert Downey Jr., Warren Beatty and Al Pacino.

https://www.nyfa.edu/

title: New York Film Academy Guest Speaker, DP Adam Holender
description:
New York Film Academy in Union Square welcomed cinematographer, Adam Holender. His most notable credit is Director of Photography on the 1969 classic, Midnight Cowboy, starring Dustin Hoffman and Jon Voight. Adam suggested we screen another classic from 1971, starring the then unknown Al Pacino. The Panic in Needle Park is a stark portrayal of life among a group of heroin addicts who hang out in New York City's "Needle Park." 

http://www.nyfa.edu/about/guest_speakers.php

title: Independent Film Discussion - The New Normal?
description:
"The New Normal? Lessons Learned from Toronto, Sundance & More." The discussion examines the current state of independent film production and distribution, the continuing evolution of multi-platforming, and provide attendees with practical tools they can use to capitalize on a resurgent indie film marketplace. 

The symposium, co-sponsored by RAW: Natural Born Artists and Backstage, features guest speakers Steven Beer (Franklin, Weinrib, Rudell & Vassallo, PC), Jerry Dasti (Sloss Eckhouse Law Co), and Emma Marie Riley (Creative Director, RAW: Natural Born Artists Brooklyn).

http://www.nyfa.edu/film-school-blog/the-new-normal-toronto-sundance/

Presented by Latha Duncan and Esq. Productions.  For more info: http://www.esqproductions.com.

title: New York Film Academy Documentary Student Discusses His Experience
description:
New York Film Academy Student discusses his experience in NYFA's Documentary Program.

http://www.nyfa.edu/documentary-school/

title: Director Philip Dorling Q&A - New York Film Academy Graduate
description:
New York Film Academy welcomed back former one year filmmaking graduate, Philip Dorling, to screen his feature film WHY STOP NOW. The film, starring Tracy Morgan, Melissa Leo, and Jesse Eisenberg, debuted at Sundance and was distributed by IFC. 

http://www.nyfa.edu/film-school-blog/philip-dorling-screens-why-stop-now/

title: New York Film Academy Documentary Graduate: An Interview with Andrea Picco
description:
NYFA Documentary 2011 Graduate, Andrea Picco, discusses her experience at the New York Film Academy.

http://www.nyfa.edu/documentary-school/

title: New York Film Academy Filmmaking Student Paquita Hughes
description:
Paquita Hughes spent 8 years in the Navy, and worked as an air traffic controller. She came to Los Angeles to to earn her degrees in Filmmaking and Photography at New York Film Academy.

Visit NYFA's Veterans Benefits site at: http://www.nyfa.edu/veterans/

Interested in learning Filmmaking, Acting, Producing, Photography, 3D Animation, Cinematography, Game Design, Documentary Filmmaking, Broadcast Journalism, Musical Theatre, Screenwriting, or Digital Editing? Visit http://www.nyfa.edu to find out how!

title: Josh Winker - High Stakes
description:
Over a rainy weekend in 2010 Josh and his brother got on a kick of playing Uno. "We must have played 200 hands that weekend", comments Josh . A few games in, and they were taking it very seriously, as if it were a High Stakes match of sorts. After things reached a peak of intensity, Josh realized the ridiculousness of the situation. "That, to me, was funny. I thought it would make a good short film." During the writing process, It was important to Josh to keep all of the dialogue and action serious in tone while maintaining the context of Uno. "I decided to riddle my screenplay with as many clich√©s as I could think of. A High Stakes match in an abandoned warehouse between a young "kid" and the dangerous, and of course, undefeated ringleader of the underground circuit." 

Josh Winker attended the New York Film Academy's 1 year film making course, graduating in August of 2011. High Stakes was his Semester 1 Final Film.

http://www.nyfa.edu/masters/filmmaking/film-media-production.php

title: New York Film Academy: NYFEST Soccer Day 2012
description: New York Film Academy took part in the 2012 Tribeca NY Fest Soccer Day. The event was held on Saturday, April 24 on Pier 40 in New York City to benefit local kids. The entertainment industry tournament boasts well over 40 teams, including Facebook, ESPN, Tribeca Enterprises, The Daily Show, The Colbert Report, Sony Pictures Classics, Focus Features and many more. The celebrities included people from the sports and entertainment industries including Detroit Lions Defensive Back Ndamukong Suh, former US National Team soccer players Claudio Reyna, Jeff Agoos, Brian McBride, Eddie Lewis, Chris Armas, along with a plethora of entertainment talent.  http://www.nyfa.edu/

title: New York Film Academy: AS TEARS GO BY -- A Music Video By Matthew Modine
description: Actor/director and friend of NYFA, Matthew Modine, shares his latest music video featuring Ruby Modine singing the Rolling Stones classic, As Tears Go By

title: New York Film Academy Teams up with Time Warner Cable
description: Time Warner Cable Connect A Million Minds partnered with the New York Film Academy at its Union Square headquarters. Students from East Side Community High School and Marte Valle Secondary School in the Lower East Side participated in a workshop to learn about the significance of science, technology, engineering and math (STEM) skills required in the film industry to bring movies to life. http://www.nyfa.edu/

title: New York Film Academy Master Class - Tony Gerber on James Cameron
description: Emmy winning professor Tony Gerber speaks to NYFA students about working with James Cameron on National Geographic's documentary about the Titanic.

title: New York Film Academy in 30 Seconds!
description: The New York Film Academy is considered one of the most prominent fixtures of film education in the world. Our film school and acting school graduates are working at all levels in the entertainment industry and their projects have screened at all the major festivals and have won many awards.

title: New York Film Academy Boxing Promo
description: This was written, directed, edited, acted, and produced by NYFA students.

title: New York Film Academy: On The Steps of The MET - "The Alexander Mc Queen Show"
description:
At the MET, the incredible Alexander Mc Queen Show brings thousands of people from all over the world. The New York Film Academy is interviewing its fans, waiting for 5 hours in line to get in.

Host: Bianca Zanini Vasconcellos
Camera: Kristin Mendez
Editing: Geoffray Barbier

title: New York Film Academy CASTNYFA
description:
CASTNYFA is a New York Film Academy exclusive* casting service. At a CASTNYFA event New York Film Academy actors can expect to audition for up to 90 New York Film Academy filmmakers and alumni all casting upcoming projects.

CASTNYFA also sends free casting breakdowns to students and alumni in the CASTNYFA database. To learn more, email castnyfa@nyfa.edu.

title: New York Film Academy Graduate Wins Several Film Festival Awards
description: New York Film Academy Filmmaking Conservatory Graduate Gian Franco Morini has been winning several awards for music video "The Hustler" by Cultural Prophet. Check out what he had to say about his time at New York Film Academy, filming the music video, and what comes next.

title: New York Film Academy: Official Hank Music Video Clip
description: A clip from "Feel Good" music video by artist Official Hank. Filmed by teen students at New York Film Academy Summer 2010 Music Video Camp. Edited by NYFA teen student Ed Allerton.

title: New York Film Academy Los Angeles at Universal Studios 35 mm workshop
description:
The New York Film Academy at Universal Studios is located on the back lot of Universal Studios, Los Angeles. 

Students can study filmmaking, acting for film, producing, screenwriting, 3D animation, photography, musical theater, cinematography, broadcast journalism or editing. 

NYFA holds MFA, BFA, AFA programs as well as workshops from one-week, four-week, eight-week and evening workshops. NYFA also has programs for teens (14-17 years old) and tweens (10-13 years old).

title: NYFA High School Film and Acting Camp 2010
description: Clips from our 2010 High School Film and Acting Camps at our New York location.

title: New York Film Academy Los Angeles Student Reel
description:
The New York Film Academy offers an Accelerated Three-year Bachelor of Fine Arts (BFA) degree program in Filmmaking, as well as two-year Master of Fine Arts (MFA) degrees in Filmmaking, Acting for Film, Cinematography, Screenwriting, Producing and Photography, and two-year Associate of Fine Arts (AFA) degrees in Filmmaking and Acting for Film at our Los Angeles campus at Universal Studios. They are structured for students who want intensive training from award winning faculty using professional facilities and equipment starting their first day of classes; better preparing them for a career in motion picture and entertainment industries.

NYFA is honored to be the acting and film school of choice of many Hollywood filmmakers and actors who have sent a son or daughter to study with us. They include Steven Spielberg, Kevin Kline, Al Pacino, Robert Downey Jr., Jamie Foxx, Jodie Foster, Pierce Brosnan, Susan Sarandon and Tim Robbins, Bono(U2), directors Stephen Frears, Peter Bogdonavich, Roger Donaldson, James L. Brooks among others.

title: Gian Franco Morini "Hustler" Music Video
Jorghe - NYFA Film School Student Film

title: Learn 3D Animation at the New York Film Academy
description:
The New York Film Academy's 3D Animation program hosts programs for teens and adults that very in length from four weeks to one or two years. 

The program utilizes Maya software, but throughout the course students will learn many different programs. 

Within the first four weeks of either program each individual students goal is to have completed one short animation. In a year program students will work together and individually in creating many animations.

title: Kids Summer Camps in Paris with New York Film Academy
description:
Experience the New York Film Academy in Paris, France. The academy offers many locations world wide, but Paris allows students to shoot in front of the Eiffle Tower or with The Louvre Museum, Notre Dame or Arc de Triumphe as your background. 

Every young person should experience Paris and here are a couple reasons why to do it with the New York Film Academy.

title: Film School Program - New York Film Academy (NYFA)
description:
The New York Film Academy was founded on the philosophy that "learning by doing" combined with best industry practices is more valuable than years of theoretical study for filmmakers and actors. This educational model allows students to achieve more in less time then at any other university, school or institute in the world.

NYFA's accelerated two year fine arts degree are structured for students who want intensive training from award winning faculty using professional facilities and equipment starting their first day of classes; better preparing them for a career in motion picture and entertainment industries.

For those that are considering college or looking to sharpen their skills, our film and acting schools offer evening filmmaking workshops, and acting workshops. We also host summer film camps and acting camps throughout the world that are designed for high school students.

title: NYFA President to Ring the NASDAQ Stock Market Closing Bell
description:
The New York Film Academy, the most intense and hands-on acting and film school in the world, enjoys being involved in the community. Sometimes this means supporting the global economy. At 3:34 p.m. today, NYFA President Jerry Sherlock will preside over the Closing Bell of the NASDAQ at the NASDAQ MarketSite located in Times Square just minutes from our Union Square school location. Mr. Sherlock will be joined by Matthew Modine, acclaimed Hollywood Actor and Creative Director of the New York Film Academy.

No one knows how todays market will do but one thing is certain, this may be one of the most intense and hands-on Closing Bells in history.

title: Film School NYFA -  GUEST LECTURE -STEPHANE SEDNAOUI
description:
http://www.nyfa.com

Photographer and Music video director Stephane Sednaoui spoke with Academy students about the release of his works on the music video series including Spike Jonze, jonathan Glazer and Mark Romanek. His music videos includes works with bjork, Red hot Chili Peppers, Massive Attack and Lou Reed.

title: Film School NYFA -  GUEST LECTURE -GLEN HANSARD / THE FRAMES
description:
http://www.nyfa.com

Performance at the New York Film Academy by Glen Hansard, frontman for The Frames, and star of "The Commitments", and "Once" w/Marketta Irglova, who plays his love interest in "Once".  "Once" has won numerous noteworthy film festival awards including the 2007 Sundance Audience Award, and has been nominated for The 2008 Independent Spirit Award, the winners of which will be announced February 23rd.
